review: Разработчик данной игры наиграл кучу часов в paint, чтобы создать такую игру. Я думал эта игра песочница, а тут есть какой-то сюжет. Многие в комментариях находят его занимательным, но я ничего в нём такого не нашел. Игра максимально скучная, меня хватило на 5 минут. Поиграл бы я минут 10 и моя голова превратилась бы в квадратик.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065067591', 'num_games_owned': 1267, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1697487649}
review: 一个少见的八位沙盒MMORPG，虽然包括战斗，但简单体验后感觉游戏的重点还是建造和设计，比如说拼像素画，个人不认为游戏本身质量有多出挑，但也不是一部差劲的游戏，如果你喜欢像素沙盒，或者只是想打发打发时间，也未尝不可选择玩玩它（PS：给出推荐的原因是我认为不至于不推荐，但是也并没有任何真心推荐的意思，所以说Steam真的应该加入一个“一般”之类的中间选项了）

author: {'steamid': '76561199081620739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1704543366}
review:
Tutorial is too long, The game is grindy and not even fun, a lot of stuff is locked behind a subscription and I just didn't enjoy it. Honestly it would be better if the game was paid and then you got everything else instead of having the game for free and paying like 9$ per month to have a barely working 3D version of the game with some skins. Also the graphics are absolute dog**it, movement is janky, and there are a lot of improvements that could be done to improve the game.
I know this is probably controversial but I would like the movement to be acceleration based instead of just adding speed to player and then stopping it when key is lifted. One other thing is shading objects that interfere with camera instead of just completely deleting them. Took me a second to realize you can't exit from game with in-game button.
It seems like fun on surface, but then you actually try to play it, you get bored in under 10 minutes (unless you have money to spend on in-game purchases)

author: {'steamid': '76561197963307637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2651, 'last_played': 1704498534}
review: Incredible game worth playing for its quests, challenges, towns, and pixel art. A beta 3D viewer is (was?) in the works that is compatible with 8BitMMO servers and sidesteps the visual depth issue. I don't think this game needs 3D, it just needs an engine update to optimize area loading, fix memory leaks, and add visual depth cues to the blocks.

review:
Почтальон приносит заказное письмо и звонит в дверь. Дверь
открывает мальчик лет восьми, попыхивающий здоровенной такой
гаванской сигарой. Почтальон в изумлении выдавливает из себя:
- Эээ... родители дома?
Мальчик небрежно стряхивает пепел с сигары на ковер,
подмигивает и отвечает:
- Сам-то как думаешь?

review: 8BitMMO, Amerikan indie stüdyosu Archive Entertainment tarafından yaratılan ve şu anda halka açık beta testi aşamasında olan ve 14 Aralık 2013’te Steam’de yayınlanan bir çok oyunculu oyun ve ücretsiz bir oyunudur. Oyuncuların tamamen inşa ettiği bir dünya sunar ve oyuncuların evlerini, kalelerini veya şehirlerini yapabilecekleri bir yapı sandboxudur. Ayrıca kötü LawyerCats’le savaşabilir ve oyuncu vs oyuncu savaşına katılabilirsiniz

author: {'steamid': '76561198044028486', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1498427116}
review: 8bitmmo is a game that is likely to divide players. On the one hand, it has a unique retro style that will appeal to fans of classic games. On the other hand, the graphics and gameplay mechanics may be too simplistic for some. The game has a strong emphasis on player creativity and world-building, which can be rewarding for those who enjoy sandbox-style games. However, the lack of a clear storyline or direction may make it difficult for some players to stay engaged. Overall, 8bitmmo is a game that will appeal to a specific audience, but may not be for everyone. Players who enjoy simple, retro-style games and have a strong interest in world-building and creativity may find it to be a worthwhile experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968566119', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1646472178}
review:
This game at first looks playable, then you start finding blocks that must have used to work correctly, but are game glitching bad right now. For instance, some player made quest (which the game will choose randomly to give you when you talk to the zombie at your first start spawn,) has (among other traps) transparent trap floors (which allow you to fall thru to the floor below. But the floor glitchily pauses my game on my EXTREMELY FAST PC, which causes a stutter where I can not move fast at all. The traps in this location were set up to run across several really quickly, after you situate yourself on the correct 'hidden' traps path. But instead your character stutters and if it moves while the flooring is not transparent. it has an incredibly slow movement rate and the floor becomes see through diagonally again, and you just fall thru.

It seems that nobody plays this game anymore, but of the basic player quests which I played, one told me the last 5 players to find the hidden block and each was spaced apart by about 24 hours. So... about 1 new player per day, probably before we get bored to tears.

This game was designed for player created content by way of creating a design in your space to create. But several years ago it still did not feel rewarding to play. Its basically what seems like an unfinished, unpolished game with mostly very limited creations that are probably permanent, but I think its impossible to start your home in the start town that is probably seen in the trailer. 

This game has an official discord server, but they must have been hit with heavy troll attacks, cause there is an "application process" to join. K... the target audience for this game can barely read. I would not want my child to fill in any application online. Not for this 'official' discord server, nor any game. In fact... I think that may be illegal in the USA to collect a child's information at all. The only saving thought is that the designer may have been a child when they originally created the game, but my bet is they are now an adult when they put their discord server up years later.

Final prognosis: Doesn't compare to Minecraft. Can't compare to Terraria. Avoid at all costs. Except as a study on how someone else had designed a game.

review:
The actual game content is rather repetitive, but the controls are responsive -- creating an action RPG-style combat system that's more entertaining than many MMORPGs. Many of the areas are interesting to explore and when players are active, the player-created content to explore (and your own content to create) provides quite a bit of replayability.

Extremely low population.

It was a mixed experience, but my wife really liked the game (and there's only yes or no) so I'll give it the thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198165443283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1621521425}
review:
Multiplayer:
 While supposedly an MMO, there's clearly way too small a crowd to feel like it. The townbuilding mechanic is lacklustre and you have to pay real money to get any of the blocks with the littlest bit of mechanics in them beyond looking pretty, such as storage, doors that can't be opened by other people, and warp locations. You can pay 2500 coins for a chance to get a paid block for free, but it takes an hour of mindless grinding to get that sum, which is...

Progression:
 Tiring at best. There is almost none. In terms of battle you can get up to level six, which is the current cap. There are a few tutorial quests, and then there is just nothing (aside from user-submitted quests which greatly vary in quality). All you can do to progress is stab the same enemy ten thousand times, past level three.

Visuals:
The forces of Programmer Arts is strong here, too much for my fragile soul to bear. I imagined there may be at least a modicum of actual personalizing - maybe, you know, actual clothing and wigs and such for the avatar to wear at least, and pixel art mechanics at best. In actuality you are limited to a palette of 20 or so blocks with unharmonized palette and nothing else. There are some coloured torsos for you to choose from if that's enough for you.

 Overall, the informal and personal tone the creator takes with its players in the tutorial should give you a scope of how big their vision of the game is supposed to be (and is). I hope they are off to ventures they enjoy more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122169688', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1393643647}
review:
It has been a while since I played this, but from what I recall it is a bit (haha pun) dull. It reminds me of a minecraft-type sandbox that has an aerial view. The graphics are very reminiscent of those 90's computer games, like Mappy, Ski, and Roden'ts Revenge. 
Speaking of, the lawyer cats are kinda cute. I found them to be a funny enemy. 
PVP is available, but very basic. 
There are dungeons and it is MMO. You can build but I found it extremely frustrating to get it right... Anyways.
I would give it a 2 stars out of 5. Not my cup of tea, but not the worst game ever either. It is Free to Play so try it out yourself to see if it is for you! No harm in that!

Графика ВПЕЧАТЛЯЕТ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172233979', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1638235843}
review:
......Holy shit

Wow. I've always have seen abandoned multiplayer games from youtube and stuff but I never thought I would experience one. And on top of that I downloaded this game in 2016ish when I can only assume the game was actually at some sort of population.

Positives: I got to make a disgustingly horrific house that ended up being pretty funny

Negatives: Everything else. The game is a fucking wasteland. I saw one player in my 20 gruelling minutes of playing and he tried to kill me both times. On top of that I was dropped into the world without any notation of what to do. I was given a tip to buy a sign, but once I bought the sign, the game didn't let me place it in the town it spawned me in because I had to be a citizen. To become a citizen you have to talk to the mayor, the mayor that doesn't fucking exist anymore. I can only assume the other player didn't know who or where the mayor is, due to him not responding to any messages. When I finally found a space to bulid my house, I thought it still would have looked bad even if I was trying to make it look good, the games graphics are so shit that even the normal houses I saw all looked the same, and that was looking boring. Along with that, the music is fucking ABHORRENT, It sounds like they let dog loose on the keyboard in the free version of a retro music creator, nothing is melodic, rhythymic, or sounds semi decent. It's absolutely ear piercing, and it plays non stop. The worst of all, according to other reviews, apparently the developer stopped adding to this game on Janurary 2015, the month it came out. This was dead, buried, decomposed and forgotten about literally on arrival. It's incredibly funny, and a good lesson of what not to do.

This doesn't even deserve a rating I usually give.  Fuck you/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198288058950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2721, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1710877021}
review:
Итак, перед нами массовая многопользовательская онлайн (проще MMO) пиксельная 2D-игра с открытым миром. В Steam игра не так давно, но уже завоевала популярность (на официальном сайте указано количество зарегистрированных людей, их более полумиллиона). Небольшое вступление сделано, пора приступать к плюсам и минусам.
Плюсы:
1) Игра бесплатна. Совсем. То есть заходи в Steam на страницу игры, нажимай на кнопку, устанавливай и играй. Все очень быстро. Мы подошли ко второму плюсу.
2) Малый вес игры. Немногим более 250 Мб. Быстро скачать и начать играть.
3) Очень быстрая и простая регистрация. Указываешь ник, почту и пароль (даже не надо вводить его 2 раза, вон как быстро ;D ), выбираешь сервер, один из которых основной, а другой тестовый и играешь.
4) Музыкальное сопровождение. Оно шикарное. Музыка воьмибитная разных жанров, от дабстепа до простых мелодий. В самый раз для этой игры, даже исходя из названия. Если же вам понравилась какая-то определенная песня, то сверху наводите курсор на иконку ноты и увидите название песни, можете поставить "Большой палец" песне или же перейти на страницу автора песни на сайте 8BitMMO. Итак, далее пойдут плюсы про сам интерфейс и геймплей.
5) Приятная пиксельная графика.
6) Можно строить свои дома и даже города, так что игра чем-то похожа на Minecraft. Но в чем преимущество перед Minecraft'om - так это наличие квестов.
7) Наличие квестов, уровней персонажа, а также достижений, что позволяет увеличить времяпровождение в игре.
8) Довольно милые и прикольные NPC, а также враги (чего только стоят слизень, котик или хипстер :) ).
9) У игры есть карточки. Поэтому вы можете сделать значок, поставить в свой профиль и хвастаться друзьям :) .
А теперь же у нас пойдут минусы:
1) Игра на английском. Поэтому если хотите хотя бы примерно понимать квесты или описание предметов, то необходимо базовое знание языка. Но так как игра с хорошим юмором, то советую всё же выучить английский, не пожалеете (тем более вообще по жизни пригодится ;) ).
2) Донат. Хоть необязательный, но он присутствует. В самом Steam вы можете купить платные версии игры.
3) Игра находится в раннем доступе. Поэтому она часто меняется, что может многим не понравится.
4) Без интернета не поиграете, на то и MMO.
Я оцениваю эту игру на 8/10.
Итак, игру я описал, попробовать стоит однозначно, а потом уже и решите, понравилась ли вам игра или нет.
На этом всё, подписывайтесь, комментируйте, ставьте лайк, и до новых встреч, или как там говорят? :D
Тапками не кидайтесь, всем добра :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198194680793', 'num_games_owned': 3031, 'num_reviews': 1947, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1603709884}
review:
Ужасная во всём поделка. Это условно-бесплатная, пиксельная 2D-игра MMO, с открытым миром и видом сверху. Проблемы начинаются с самого начала. Мало установить игру, надо сначала провести регистрацию, в меню на английском языке. Не получится запустить и сразу поиграть. Это я к тому, что если вы быстро хотели ознакомиться с игрой и решить играть в неё, в дальнейшем или нет, у вас не получится. Только через регистрацию. После регистрации заходите на сервер и первое, что вас встречает, это отвратительная музыка, очень уж она раздражительна. Я много слышал восьмибитной музыки (немало переиграл, в своё время, на Денди), и здешняя музыка жалкая пародия.
Геймплейно игра является ролевой. Берёте квесты, выполняете, получаете награду. Только вот квесты унылы и скучны. К тому же, в игре очень много текста, но не на русском языке. 
Так как игра условно-бесплатная, то подразумевается донат. И он есть, что тоже не плюсом идёт игре. 
В общем, сплошные минусы:
Обязательные регистрация и наличие интернета, донат, плохая музыка, унылые квесты, невзрачная графика и отсутствие русского языка. Нет, нет и ещё раз нет. Проходите мимо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070492066', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1597128281}
review:
8bitMMO se veut un MMO minimaliste proposant un système de construction unique, le tout sur le ton de la dérision et la parodie. Sorti en beta en 2013, le jeu a eu un certain succès auprès des joueurs, avant de s'essouffler et d'être délaissé.

Les + :
- Les constructions, originales
- Le ton parodique du jeu

Les - :
- Les combats, chiants
- Les quêtes, fed-EX
- Le jeu est littéralement mort, plus personne n'y joue, le côté MMO perd donc tout son intérêt

8bitMMO est un jeu assez basique, mais qui n'était pas foncièrement mauvais, toutefois, aujourd'hui délaissé, il n'y a plus aucune raison de le lancer aujourd'hui, car sans l'aspect communautaire, il ne reste pas grand chose de ce jeu...

author: {'steamid': '76561198153093580', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1584486771}
review:
Fun-Cost Percentage: 70% (game is free, but not really worth your time)

    To start off, this game is very much dead. The only people that will be online are the friends that you may or may not be able to convince to play with you. Continued development is nonexistent (to the best of my knowledge), so new features are not a factor here. The premise of the game is interesting enough. To me, this game equates to a 2D Roblox with some more traditional MMO elements thrown in the mix. Gameplay wise, there really isn't a whole lot to do unless you really enjoy building two-dimensional structures or have lots of friends to play with. However, the humor is quirky and compelling and was my favorite part of the game by a substantial margin. I cannot recommend this game despite it being free, unless you are bored to tears, or are hunting for Steam achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112647052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1582835262}
review:
Ничего вы не поймёте! 
А если и поймёте — это вам только показалось. 
Всё это очень странно. В самом плохом смысле этого слова. 
И я не знаю, зачем было убивать тех милых птичек.
Да, моему роботу велели прикончить их, чтобы воспользоваться продуктовым автоматом, чтобы он перенёс его на площадку с лесенками и беговой дорожкой, чтобы он отправился дальше, а зачем — мне было уже неинтересно и потому не владею такой информацией.
Музыка прикольная, а в остальном совсем не весело.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1581655547}
review:
8BitMMO is a clumsy "mmo" that relies entirely on the "bad graphics"/"we made our game look bad on purpose" 8 bit theme.  

While the developers did the right thing by making it free (the only other decent thing to do here would be to remove it), it doesn't change the fact that the quality is very low here.  Retro pixel graphics are ugly and always have been.  Professional developers stopped using pixel graphics as soon as newer hardware allowed it.  Terrible lazy indie devs who can't afford artists keep using them.   Also, there's no working fullscreen.  Even for free, I can't recommend this.

review: It's a fun game but seems largely unfinished. Glitches, oversights, and lack of detail make it as of yet largely unplayable. The goal behind it is realistic and certainly seems fun, and should more work be put into it will doubtless produce a very good game, but it has yet to reach that full vision, and given the title has been out for 3 years I would say it's unlikely to receive the love necessary to get it to where the concept deserves to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205494008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1422722200}
review:
When I was 18... 18 years old, I saw for the first time in my life... I saw an image of clarity. I saw a comic strip... a three panel comic strip that, though simple as it seemed, changed me... changed my being, changed who I am... Made me who I am...

Enlightened me...

The strip, Garfield, the comic strip was new... no more than maybe a month and a half since inception, since... since coming into existence... and there it was before me in print, I saw it... a comic strip... What was it called?

Garfield.

The story here is of a man, a plain man. He is Jon, but he is more than that... I will get to this later, but first let us say that he's Jon, a plain man.

And then there is a cat... Garfield.

This is the nature of the world, here. When I see the world, the politics, the future, the... the satellites in space, and... the people who put them there...

You can look at everything as a man and a cat... two beings, in harmony and at war...

So, this strip I saw; this man, Jon, and the cat, Garfield, you see...

Yes... hmm...

It is about everything. This... little comic is, oh, lo and behold... not so little anymore.

So yes, when I was 18, I saw this comic... and it hit me all at once, its power. I clipped it, and every day, I looked at it, and I said "Okay... let me look at this here. What is this doing to me? Why is this so powerful?"

Jon Arbuckle, he sits here, legs crossed... comfortable in his home, and he reads his newspaper... The news of the world, perhaps... and then he extends his fingers lightly, delicately... he taps his fingers on an end table, and he feels for something...

What is it? It is something he needs, but it is not there.

And then he looks up, slightly cockeyed, and he thinks... His newspaper's in his lap now, and he thinks this...

Now where could my pipe be?

This... I always come to this, because I was a young man... I'm older now, and I still don't have the secrets, the answers, so this question still rings true, Jon looks up and he thinks...

Now where could my pipe be?

And then it happens... You see it, you see... it's almost like divine intervention, suddenly it is there, and it overpowers you...

A cat is smoking a pipe.

It is the man's pipe, it's Jon's pipe, but the cat... this cat, Garfield, is smoking the pipe... and from afar, and someplace near, but not clear... near but not clear... The man calls out... Jon calls out, he is shocked. "Garfield!" he shouts.

Garfield. The cat's name.

But, let's take a step back... let us examine this from all sides, all perspectives... and when I first came across this comic strip, I was at my father's house... a newspaper had arrived, and I picked it up for him, and brought it inside.

I organized its sections for him and then, yes, the comic strip section fell out from somewhere in the middle, and landed on the kitchen floor... I picked up the paper pages and saw, up somewhere near the top of this strip... just like Jon, I was wearing an aquamarine shirt.

So I thought, "Ah, interesting. I'll have to see this later." I snipped out the little comic, and held on to it... and five days later, I reexamined it... and it gripped me, I needed to find out more about this. The information I had was minimal, but enough...

An orange cat named Garfield...

Okay, that seemed to be the lynchpin of this whole operation, yes. Another clue... a signature in the bottom right corner, a man's name...

Jim Davis.

Yes, I'm on to it for sure.

So... one: Garfield, orange cat, and two: Jim Davis, the creator of this cat...

And that curiously plain man.

I did not know, at the time, that his name was Jon. This strip, you see, had no mention of this man's name, and I'd never seen it before.

But I had these clues; Jim Davis, Garfield.

And then I saw more, I spotted the tiny copyright mark in the upper left corner. Copyright 1978 to... what is this? Copyright belongs to a... PAWS Incorporated...

I use the local library and mail services to track down the information I was looking for...

Jim Davis, a cartoonist, had created a comic strip about a cat, Garfield... and a man, Jon Arbuckle. Well, from that point on, I made sure I read the Garfield comic strips, though as I read each one, as each day passed... the strips seemed to resonate with me less and less...

I sent letters to PAWS Incorporated, long letters, pages upon pages... asking if Mister Jim Davis could somehow publish just the one comic, over and over again... "It would be meditative," I wrote, "the strength of that."

Could you imagine?

But... no response... The strips lost their power, and eventually I stopped reading, but... I did not want my perceptions diluted, so I vowed to read the pipe strip over and over again... That is what I call it, "The Pipe Strip."

The Pipe Strip.

Everything about it is perfect. I can only describe it as a miracle creation, something came together... the elements aligned... It is like the comets, the cosmic orchestra that is up there over your head... The immense, enormous void is working all for one thing, to tell you one thing...

Gas and rock, and purity, and nothing.

I will say this... When I see the pipe strip... and I mean every single time I look at the lines, the colors, the shapes that make up the three panel comic...

I see perfection.

Do I find perfection in many things?

Some things, I would say... Some things are perfect... and this is one of them. I can look at the little tuft of hair on Jon Arbuckle's head... it is the perfect shade... The purple pipe in Garfield's mouth... How could a mere mortal even MAKE this?

I have a theory, about Jim Davis...

After copious research and, yes, of course, now we have the internet, and this information is all readily available, but...

Jim Davis, he used his life experiences to influence his comic...

Like I mentioned before, none of them seem to have the weight of the pipe strip... But you have to wonder about the man who is able to even, just once, create the perfect form, a literally flawless execution of art, brilliance! Just as in a ward... I think there is a spiritual element at work...

I've seen my share of bad times and... when you have something... Well, it's just... emotions, and neurons in your brain, but... something tells you that it's the truth...

Truth's radiant light.

Garfield, the cat? Neurons in my brain, it's... it's harmony, you see? It... Jon and Garfield, it's truly harmony, like a... continuous, looping, everlasting harmony... The lavender chair, the brown end table, the salmon-colored wall, the fore's green carpeting, Garfield is hunched, perched... perhaps with the pipe stuck firmly between his jowls... His tail curls around. It's more than shapes too, because... I...

Okay, stay with me... I've done this experiment several times.

You take the strip. You trace only the basic elements. You can do anything, you can simplify the shapes down to just... blobs, just outlines, but it still makes sense...

You can replace the blobs with magazine cutouts of other things, replace Jon Arbuckle with a... car parked in a driveway sideways, cut that out of a magazine, stick it in... Replace him there in the second panel with a... a food processor... Okay, and then we put a picture of the planet in the third panel over Garfield...

It still works.

These are universal proportions. I don't know... how best to explain why it works, I've studied the pipe strip, and analyzed Jon and Garfield's proportions against several universal mathematical constants.

E, Pi, the Golden Ratio, the Feigenbaum Constants, and so on... and it's surprising... scary even, how things align. You can take just... tiny pieces of the pipe strip, for instance, take Jon's elbow from the second panel... and take that, and project it back over Jon's entire shape in the second panel, and you'll see a near perfect Fibonacci sequence emerge...

It's eerie to me... and it makes you wonder if you're in the presence of a deity, if there is some larger hand at work...

review:
8BitMMO is a retro-style 2D massively multiplayer game! It's a giant construction sandbox -- you can build a home or a castle in a persistent streaming world. Found and manage your own city. Fight evil LawyerCats and engage in Player vs Player battle.
@
8BitMMO-это массовая многопользовательская игра в стиле ретро 2D! Это гигантская строительная песочница - вы можете построить дом или замок в постоянном потоковом мире. Найди и управляй своим собственным городом. Сражайтесь со злыми адвокатами и участвуйте в битве игрок против игрока.

10 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198130592481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2075, 'last_played': 1620775561}
review:
Though I only ever play it to go on a nostalgia trip, I can't deny that I enjoyed it.
If building is not your tea, you should probably leave this place. The start can be relatively boring, But once you get out of the tutorial and you get some money, you can go to your pocket dimension and just have a blast building things...Or you can go into the Wilderness and build...Keep in mind you should place a home block so you don't lose where you built..And don't expect to find anyone..The game died years ago..All there really is now is the empty unexplored wastes..Forgotten quests for the reward block...and well..the empty towns..

author: {'steamid': '76561198361422446', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1542814384}
review: So, I had time to kill and searched the store for free games because I'm a broke human being. So I found this game called 8bitmmo. "Sounds good!" I said and jumped in. I breezed through the quests in the first two hours and decided to head into the wild. All there was was ruins. Howling wind and the remains of structures eroded by time and griefing. Not a single human, in the whole server. I found a museum, and looked back into the world's history, but was snuck up on by another player. Far more experienced than me, he told the story of the world, not much more than I already knew. If you love exploring ancient history, and brushing dust off ruins to learn a story long since told, you will love this game. It is a unique experience, wandering a world with seven years of history. But if you prefer socialising, it isn't for you sadly. But my advice is go forth, explore, and bring life back to a dead world!

author: {'steamid': '76561198121525707', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1535006914}
review:
This game looks like something i might would've enjoyed when i was 11-12 years old. 

Gameplay is pretty basic, you farm gold by killing monsters in different worlds, and you use the same gold to buy items to place in your world. Combat is just pressing the space button to attack with your sword, or shoot with the gun, im not sure if there is more depth to it later on, or other weapons at all.

However, while the idea is basic, game can get pretty annoying. First of all, building is very weird, since you cant turn around camera, and everything is a cube, it can be hard to align it properly since you can stack items one on another, most of the time when i was trying to place blocks next to each other, they went on top on the other blocks. There are dozens of portals around for different worlds but its extremely hard navigate through them since there is so many. 

The world is basically brighly colored cubes that look like something when zoomed out, and that is the only point of the game, to build things with simple cubes that look like different images, or maybe something random.

Pros:
- Kid friendly
- Simple 

Neutral:
- I liked some of music, however most of it is extremely loud and fast
- Humor

Cons:
- Dead
- A lot of portals makes navigating very hard and confusing
- Building can be annoying because of block placement
- Not much depth to it
- US only server
- Hasnt been updated for longer time

author: {'steamid': '76561198182803537', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1962, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1642286588}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198129967410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1575234778}
review:
The main gameplay is made up of going to player-created worlds to find reward blocks. You are assigned these worlds randomly, and if you don't like it, it's thrown back into the shuffle and you get a new quest. The problem is that these quests can be any difficulty. They can be a short walk to the reward, a cryptic puzzle, a maze, search the town until you find it, or just pay the quest-creator a certain amount of currency. These get boring very fast.

I do not recommend building. Buying requires money that you can only get from either buying it with real money, tedious combat, or finding those reward blocks. Some blocks even cost "plat," which you can only get by paying real money. The building interface is horrid.

Both aspects of the game stink. Don't get this game.

review:

Too bad there's barely anyone else on at this point. The game itself is quite enjoyable, but it's still an MMO, a genre which has an inherent dependence on the players.
Sure, the game is deserted, far as I could tell, but it isn't bad. Maybe the world could live again, if incoming users could know of this game's existence.
Don't pass this one up. Try it out a bit, and spread the word to friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198198278458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 8428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5453, 'last_played': 1519422130}
review:
For what it is, this is a good game. You can build a city, either in the Wild or in your personal pocket dimension. Which you can then let other players live in. The world itself is completely player made, which is another cool factor. A fun part of the game was the player run Plat shops, plat being the premium currency, and bc of that you could buy premium items for in game money. Sadly, however, I think thats what led the game to its eventual death. Because the Dev wasnt really making money on it, the game wasn't updated since 2015. I loved this game when it was alive. As it is i cannot recommend it less. It is a dead game.

Edit; reading through the comments now, I think i get why it was abandoned. It was shxt on to oblivion back in the day, and looking at some of the achievements, im more inclined to say the dev had a mental breakdown because of it. I do still think it was partly the fault of the in-game platinum shops. but now i can almost confidently say that the toxicity of haters also contributed. Which is a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125325243', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1434649315}
review:
8bitMMO! I hate this game! Mostly for the fact that you can build up something amazing and then destroy it with restoration only using premium currency and it's generally boring. Just kididng though, I don't hate it that much, but it doesn't taste very well for me.

Pros:
- 8 bit graphics
- Good place to meet up and roleplay (or smth)

Cons:
- Transponder mechanics (premium currency required for restoration, waste of money tbh)
- Meme enemies (Seriously, LOLcats??? Game reviewers/journalists?!)
Also not to mention, those LOLcats and game reviewers are the only enemies you can find in game!
- Boring

Conclusion is...it's bland and stupid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357673752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1515975068}
review:
Its a fun game, nice mechanics, cool tutorial, etc. I honestly would play this game but there are some cons that keeps me at bay from playing it. Before you install, let me just tell you, I only recommend this game for what it is, not how fun it actually is. That may sound confusing, but you'll understand once I explain this next part:

The game had potential. Sadly, it is run by a close-to-dead community so unless you have a hefty amount of buddies to play with, you're wandering a ghost town. The game mixes RPG killing and building but if you really want a game that does this better, you can just go play TROVE. I haven't gotten far into it, but there's this sort of mayor-system that doesn't let you build unless the mayor gives you permission, but when you play a dead game where you're the only one online, its kind of hard to get permission to build.

Now, why did I upvote this game? Well, if you have a weak computer, this is a good game to just test it on. I'm sure you can use a computer from the late 90s and as long as it has been properly taken care of, it should run the game with minimal lag. It also gives you a good feel for topview RPGs which this world doesn't have enough of, but if you have the money you can play RPG horror games like "The Crooked Man" "Ao Oni? (I forgot how to spell it)" or "The Witches House." You can also play MMORPGs with an actual community in games like ROTMG. This game has its points though, its built around the community, and it would be very fun to hang out, build a city, and form a small band to go farming. At this point it kind of seems like I'm repeating myself but like I've said, its a dead game. It was built FOR the community, but when that doesn't exist, the game pretty much crumbles. So that is why I gave it a positive rating, the actual game would be amazing to play, its just that it doesn't have the players to keep the fire burning - and we can't blame the devs for that.

review:
Eu simplesmente adorei o jogo, a sua trilha sonora 8Bits é muito boa, mas eu vou dizer um ponto fraco do jogo...
O jogo é bom, quando eu vi o trailer eu fiquei interessado no jogo, mas quando o abri pela primeira vez, vi varios glitchs no cenario, coisas mal feitas e bastante lag (Isso eu acho que é minha internet mesmo xdddd)
Mas o que eu fiquei surpreso, é esse jogo ser de grátis, pois na steam tem vários jogos porcarias e que são... 10 reais, 20 reais (não que esse jogo seja porcaria...)

A nota que eu dou para esse jogo é 8/10, e não sei por que ele está sendo tão injustiçado...

author: {'steamid': '76561198081788477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1389891538}
review:
I only have invested two hours at the time of writing this review, but having said that I have tried the base mechanics and have a general understanding of the game. Even though the graphics are a little old for it's time, it is clear that they possess a certain charm to them which is reminiscent to the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series. The frame rate is excellent and runs very smoothly which helps gunfights and player actions commence seemlessly and naturally. The looting system is well designed with higher-tier gear on the Hostile NPC's and 'civilian grade' guns located in the world. The quest system isn't particually my cup of tea but those who enjoy RPG's might take a shining to this. The AI in the world is well balanced and poses a REAL threat unlike some other survival games dayz *cough*. The only complaint so far is that the temperature and illness system needs to be nerfed as it is almost impossible to traverse at night without freezing up and dying. 

TL:DR - Cheap survival game with fun pvp gameplay and interesting pve interactions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136199613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1617, 'last_played': 1458865367}
review: This immensely old 8-bit game by RobbyZ is a pixelated combat; building game and while being appealing it isn't being updated anymore and the game has a non-existent player base. No one plays this game anymore and it would figuratively be a miracle to find someone playing. There is no reason to download 8BitMMO anymore. I and everyone else really wanted 8BitMMO to improve and expand but unfortunately, just like March of Industry, he abandons developing it. Most of his games are similar to 8BitMMO. They have minimal content, lack of a player base and they also become abandoned. Developer: RobbyZ does make neat ideas though he poorly executes them then lazily abandons them. I hope one day he'll come out and get the motivation to make something great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052193344', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1484720184}
review:
Simple, fun, and a field to be creative in.

The fun here is in seeing how you can use (and seeing how other people have used) extremely simple mechanics to create unique structures and experiences. 

There exist the ability to 'make' a quest with albeit very simple options, but people have found ways to do really cool things with these seemingly super limited capabilities.

On the negative side the world is very messy in-between the beautiful areas, and for every good player quest about 3 are dull or broken. 

Over all 8-bit mmo is something not quite like any other sort of game i've seen before.

review:
Tags: Multiplayer Based
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: No steam integration for login. Community of veterans make finding yourself a niche daunting, assuming the game is not dead, which I cannot verify since I will not make a third party account.

Old minimalistic retro inspired MMO that looks like final fantasy 1 except not really authentic. Player economy used to favor veterans. People report it is dead but I cant be arsed to handle yet another third party account to check it out. I thought this had steam integrated login. If you are going to be a Steam game do it correctly or dont bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142489359', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1552601339}
review:
This game was fantastic, before it became a wasteland of abandoned creations. 
Despite all the negativity I still have hope, nobody plays, because nobody plays. What I mean is when a person logs onto this game, all they find is an empty server, with nobody to talk to/play with, which they have a decision to stay and explore or to leave, most of the time is leave.

I've had alot of fun in this game, I just dont think it deserves all these negative ratings.

Some issues others had:

Grinding: There are gold farms you may have not known about which help farm gold. Plus, the game doesnt allow you to farm over 2k gold until "Gold Queue" (What I call it, not actual name) resets, meaning that you'll have to socialize if you dont want to just sit and do nothing.

Dead Servers: (Refer to the beginning of review)

No updates: Sim9 may be done with this game and is probably working hard on 9bitMMO, and I'm sure he has reasons for what he does.

I just hope that people start playing again. I said so much fun learning everything this game had to offer.

IGN: Shadowlock
(I try to go on 8Bit to check whether people still play whenever I can.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127805101', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 11548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10230, 'last_played': 1520570448}
review:
R.I.P 8BitMMO

When I played, the community was pretty cancerous, but I ignored them. The game felt fun.

Now, its a wasteland. Wilds is just as torn up as when I left. At most, 5 people will be on the server. I honestly can't remember the last time there was an update for this game. Plat is a dead premium currency, because not enough people around for it to be of use.

Jeez Sim9, atleast give us a new shirt or something to tell us you are still alive.

EDIT: Sim9 has abandoned the game, but has left the servers up for people to still enjoy it. There is nobody on anymore, and it will likely stay that way. I'd recommend the game, but only if you can enjoy a lifeless MMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006162756', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 2246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2204, 'last_played': 1613146600}
review:
This retro sandbox construction MMO had a LOT of potential to be something really neat but sadly theres these issues:

- Developer hasn't made any new content updates since its Steam launch back in Jan of 2015

- Gameplay is barebones & requires you to pay real money to build your own proper towns or dungeons 

- Game's population is under 10 people(as of last year when I was active)

- Developer decideds to wipe inactive accounts because of server migration which somehow affected my account and whenever I try to log on main server, I just get a black screen. So as a result this game is unplayable to me and I've lost complete interest on a dead game that its own sole developer abandon without care.

EDIT(10/14/2017): Well apparently my 8BitMMO account still exists however I still stand by on what I've said months ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985129582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1497658572}
review: I really wanted this game to be good, I gave it a go. There just isn't much to it. The game relies on people to build the so called "quests". The entire game is exploring and winning all of the user made "dungeons" which are all mostly the same. Also you can build anything you want! A city, Pixel Art, Anything! .... Except every block costs gold which sends you running back to the boring player made dungeons. This is a really good starting point for what good have been a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347285445', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1528616502}
review:
2Dサンドボックス&RPG。

まず遊ぼうとしたらゲーム内でアカウント登録必須だったのでこの時はアンインストールしたが、再度インストールしてアカ登録してスタート。してみたら下記のような問題点ばかり。
:日本人からしたら滅茶苦茶な日本語。ちゃんと翻訳してるのかと言いたいレベル。
:アイテムを捨てられないし、売却もコマンドで全てのみ。それでもインベントリから削除できないアイテムがある。
:あるダンジョンである敵を倒すとよくサーバーへの再接続がされる。
:他プレイヤーが作った街に行って目的を達成するクエストがあるが、中には達成が困難だったり果てに達成不可能なものもある。そうなっても別のクエに変えてもらうこともできる。
特に滅茶苦茶な日本語は日本人プレイヤーの協力を得て誤字修正すべきではないのか?
退屈しないのはまだましなものの、これらの問題点が解消されないと快適に遊べない。
BGMのチップチューンを聞きながら弁護士猫を剣で刺しまくりましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198284171097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2839, 'last_played': 1495911856}
review: i like this game, i like the sandbox element of it, but that's pretty much it. one thing i found quite annoying throughout the game is dimensions, making an 8-bit game in 3-D is not only kinda difficult, it raises some problems such as when you go under something. the game helps you a bit by making blocks above you (and all the blocks that WOULD be above you) invisible, so you can actually see where you're going, but it doesn't stop it from being REALLY confusing at times. something that would DRASTICALLY change this, is shading, that's it, all you need is shading, it can come from the left, right   it doesn't matter ALL WE NEED IS SHADING! overall i would recommend this to SOME people, but just a few, i don't know many people who like 8-bit games that are actually 3-D and the navigation is really confusing at times. since i would'nt reccomend this to the majority of people, i'm not recommending it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353573538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1494285403}
review:
I generally sweep up any free to play games i find on my explore list. Wow. This game. Despite being advertised as a "giant construction sandbox" you will spend more time grinding lawyercats than building anything. Every block you want to get costs gold, anything that could spark creativity costs real money (lots). You rarely meet anyone anywhere, screenshots are waaaaaay outdated, humor is sparse, it may be free to play, but it is 110% pay to enjoy. not to mention it hasn't updated at all since it came out... IN 2015.

*CAN IT GET BETTER?*
Yes! Totally! The one thing i would suggest would be to ditch the shop system, at least the platinum stuff. From there, it can get so much better.

TL;DR, its got potential, but at this point, potential is all it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339306375', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1528263872}
review:
I'll be honest here- now, while I barely have any hours on steam I've played a ton in browser, I had some very nice memories here, became a regular-ish, made quite a few friends, but while everyone, quite literally, is shouting at the dev as to what he needs to do, he blatantly ignores it all. Up and banning players for no reason? muting people for asking? I really do not recommend this whatsoever anymore...


EDIT: This review was quite some time ago. While the state of the game has not changed, the developer's reasoning behind a lot of his actions are clearer to me now.  Though the state of the game is that development has been dropped, and there's virtually no community at this point. 

(Apologies for being yet another nag in your side back then, Robby Zinchak.)

review:
8BitMMO is a alright game but it has some bugs.
It seems that soon as i load into the main server i can do everything but after 3 or less seconds my keyboard wont work and im left to use only my mouse. 

its a pain and after going through every website and faq to fix theres nothing.

Please Update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005852802', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1486227103}
review:
Story:
Well this is easy. There is none. An MMO has to have a purpose other than just run around and kill things. This can be improved on and needs to be acted upon fast.

Soundtrack:
The soundtrack is awesome! I'll give you that. The chiptune sounds in this make the music stand out and feel like 4 NES consoles battling to produce the best sound. This is one of the only high points.

Art / Sprite work:
The sprites in this game are well drawn apart from the default main character. It's a little bit too plain for my liking. You could've put a shirt and some pants on the guy and I would've liked it more but just plain white is kinda boring.

Gameplay:
The game controls poorly and has a weird "momentum" mechanic in it that changes your speed between two different settings. The first setting is really slow and the first setting makes you feel faster than Sonic the Hedgehog. The thing is weird and using E as the interact button really messed with my head because I was trying space bar and Z and X and everything. E was my last guess.

POSITIVES -
* Good Soundtrack
* Decent Spritework
* Great Server Connectivity

NEGATIVES -
* Poor Controls
* No Story
* Confusing Mechanics
* Perspective Issues


DISCLAIMER:
This is just my opinion. You are free to have what ever opinions you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006563527', 'num_games_owned': 3442, 'num_reviews': 909, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1477241473}
review:
8BitMMO ist ein Free-to-Play Sandbox-MMORPG. Bevor jetzt die Bezüge zu Trove hergestellt werden, 8BitMMO ist ein 2D-8Bit Spiel. Bedeutet, was mit Retro beworben wird, ist ziemlich häßlich und einfach in der Optik. Aber wie bei Frauen und Autos bedeutet Edeloptik wenig wenn der Spass dafür nicht stimmt. Ob man bei 8BitMMO viel Spass hat, ist wohl vor allem Geschmackssache. Das Spiel feiert einen gewissen Humor ab der sich in zahlreichen Anspielungen und Parodien auf andere Spiele und die reale Welt ergeht. Das kann lustig sein, aber auch nerven. Pluspunkt ist sicherlich die ständig am Spiel bauende und erweiternde Community. Aber da die Grafik wirklich zuerst massiv abschreckt, muss man wirklich bereit sein sich darauf einzulassen. Und auf die teilweise etwas umständliche Steuerung und den "Levelaufbau", vermutlich der Engine geschuldet. Ich gebe ehrlich zu, mich begeistert das Spiel nicht, aber ich sympathisiere prinzipiell mit Herzblut-Projekten die ihre Community miteinbezieht, daher Daumen hoch.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7_dotQ27GE

The game mechanics.

Good rpg, just needs potential. It will be better once it gets a little better.

This game has potential. It has lots of potential, just needs a good update to make it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288955556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1470025615}
review: I downloaded this game(against my better judgement) and found what i believe to be a game with a great concept that fell flat on its face because of its stupid devs. Even though I saw all the nasty, and concerning warnings NOT to get this game, I did so. Just a few minutes of gameplay showed that its community is DEAD, with no players (from my experience) the dev thinks he's funny, but really is an asshole. Even the controls and building/fighting system is confusing and broken, as my attempt to build a simple wall was confusing enough to make me want to quit. This game is only recomended for those who want to just cry because of how bad and quiet and terrible the "community" is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307455569', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1468776512}
review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel schon länger ausführlich im Browser getestet und um wirklich Spaß haben zu können
muss man einfach Geld ausgeben,da es 2 Währungen gibt 1.Gold (für diese Währung gibt es eine Farm die man mit /zoo erreicht,das Problem ist das man da mit einfachem halten von Space farmt und es ziemlich einfach ist ein Script zu schreiben was das tut und das macht die Wirtschaft kaputt)2.Platin Gold bekommt man easy Mobs töten usw.
Platin bekommt man fast garnicht(also ich habs noch NIE bekommen).Man kann einfach nicht "creativ" sein wie das Spiel
verspricht.Klar man kann einfach ein Standart Haus inrotzen aber wer will in einem Spiel was mit vielfalt wirbt das gleiche wie 50% der anderen haben?In der Theorie ist das Spiel verdammt.Probiert es aus und bildet euch selbst eine Meinung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198303733370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1466267164}
review:
(English)
8bitmmo is a fun game for those willing to pay attention, this is a great community and the game gives You numerous ways to bind you all together, to not feel so alone. To do other reviews, it seemed as if there was nothing to do and it's a pretty boring game, I think otherwise. You can build a mansion, the beginning of the city, PvP players with the right weapons you gifted the game menu weapons, and you can join one of our clans!, Clans is not a game, but still powerful in pvp and building. Clans are a great way to play with friends, and this is only the beginning of what you can do 8bitmmo. The building system is quite complex at first glance, but becomes fun. one you got the hang of it, I play this game to relax with friends I made in this brilliant game. 10/10

(Русский)
8bitmmo-это веселая игра для тех, кто готов обратить внимание, это большое сообщество, и игра дает Вам множество способов, чтобы привязать вас всех вместе, чтобы не чувствовать себя так одиноко. Сделать другие отзывы, казалось, как будто там нечего делать и это довольно скучная игра, я думаю иначе. Вы можете построить особняк, начало города, PvP игроков с нужным оружием ты одаренный меню игры оружия, и вы можете присоединиться к одному из наших кланов!, Кланы не игра, но все еще влиятельных в пвп и дом. Кланы являются отличным способом, чтобы играть с друзьями, и это только начало того, что вы можете сделать 8bitmmo. Системы здания-это довольно сложная на первый взгляд, но становится весело. одним вы получили повесить его, я играю в эту игру, чтобы расслабиться с друзьями я сделал в этой блестящей игре. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198280284029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1464292609}
review:
This is a a good game and has lots of potential these are my thoughts.
good things:
-Easy to pick up
-friendly community
-very fun game (with friends atleast)

bad things:
-most of the items require a curency which u can only get with microtransactions
-laggy sometimes because the world is completely player built
-easy ways of cheating the games mechanics

I cant really recommend this game as it was abandoned by the dev a good while ago, i know i dont have many hours of it on steam but before i used steam i used to sweat this game on the browser version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305930788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1465932078}
{'steamid': '76561198271873989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 57914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30848, 'last_played': 1472476596}
review: 8bitmmo is a fun game for those willing to pay attention, It has a great community and the game gives you a variety of ways to bind you all together so you don't feel so isolated. Other reviews make it seem as if there isn't much to do and it's a rather boring game, I think otherwise. You can build a mansion, Start a town, PvP players with the options of weapons you're gifted by the games weapons menu, and you can join one of our clans!, Clans aren't recognized by the game but are still influential to pvp and building. Clans are a great way to play with friends, and this is just the start of what you can do during 8bitmmo. The building system is pretty complicated at first glance but it becomes fun one you've got the hang of it, I play this game to relax with the amazing friends I've made within this brilliant game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134489185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1497369749}
review:
Do I reccomend this? Eh.... no.

It's dead, really.

By dead, I mean REALLY Dead, noone really plays it now.

Yeah, some people are nice in this game, atleast I was nicely greeted.

Yeah, the building is... Moderate.

From the other reviews I saw, people don't like this game quite much. I enjoyed it though for some time... (11 hours)

If you want to have a decent town, you have to grind quests, try to make cash, or just grind enemies for hours to get atleast 10000 gold, and still, if you want to have a big one, you need ACTUAL REAL CASH.

Log of my 3 days:

Just when I joined, I got greeted, and some people showed me round'.
Then I got a pocket townstone.
Then I made a town.
Then a guy got in my town.
Then I got a new steam friend.
Then I got 2 more people in my town.
Now I don't have space for my friend to build.
Now I need a town extension.
To be continued.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123506572', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1542330146}
review:
Pros:
decent, yet fun game to play
You have your own building place that you can invite people over
It's 8-bit


Cons:
cant un-citizenify someone
cant kick people out of your little world
glitches happen often
the zombie's player quests are repeated
limited gold from slaying enemies (due to farms , or zoos, for farming money)
there is a timer on when the enemies drop the gold again
"special" currency, called plat. that you mostly have to buy
so many things need plat.  like boxes that you can put stuff in.
There's like 5 people playing, so the name "8bitMMo' is no longer allowed, sinnce it's not a MMO

author: {'steamid': '76561198116910959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3660, 'last_played': 1559107177}
review:
This game all in all is halfway decent, but as any other game, it has its own set of flaws. Even though there are a [b]lot[/b] of cons, I will still try and save this dying game and its community. This game is great, but it is abandoned by the developer with a dying community, and the developer won't even give it a proper funeral, but my problem is with the developer, not the game.

[b]Pros: [/b]
[olist]
[*] It has a great community, apart from people who just joined and don't get it
[*] Its online multiplayer, so there will usually be someone online to keep company
[*] It is free2play, even though it has premium currency, so you don't [b]have[/b] to spend money
[*] A good bit of the premium currecy items can be obtained for the non-premium currency, even if it is a lot
[/olist]

[b]Cons: [/b]
[olist]
[*] It claims it is an MMO, even though there is a maximum of 20 people online, out of the over 800 thousand registered users.
[*] The game developer (Who is Sim9 ingame and on IRC, which you can find [url=https://irc.editingarchive.com:8080/?channels=8bit-gamewatch,8bit]here[/url]) has basically abandoned this game,
[*] People, like me, end up quitting the game every once in a while, because the game is never updated, and everything has been done up to this point.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198142460164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1497756414}
review:
This game kind of gets boring after a while. It at first was really fun, I enjoyed getting better gear, messing around with my pocket universe, and exploring the map. It slowly gets... kind of dull after a while though. 

[b]Combat[/b]
The enemies in this game are all the exact same, except they look different and have different stats. They will try to run at you, and hit you after 5 seconds. Needless to say, they are very easy to kill. PVP is pretty engaging at first, but gets old really quickly. You have 4 types of weapons that each work differently, and considering there is only one developer, this isn't that bad. The issue is the weapons themselves. There are three swords, exactly the same except in damage. There is a gun, that shoots little friendliness pellets at people, and it controls alright. The laser is pretty weird, you charge it for a few seconds, and it shoots a straight line. People actually have made good use of this in pvp, but it seems extermely easy to dodge. Lastly is the hammer, doing a massive area damage, but taking a while to charge. Each of these weapons can be specialized to do well in pvp, and people have become really good at pvp in this game. Regardless, it does get dull quickly, however it is worth trying out. 

[b]Community[/b]
The community is actually pretty helpful, when I played this game, I actually learned a lot from other people. The only issue is that for an MMO, there is pretty much nobody. 5-10 people are usually online at a time, which is pretty small considering a huge part of the game is Towns. It would be a much, much better game if it were more active. Because of recent events I have heard of (and not participated in, and as such will not talk about), and the game not really being updated, I doubt this will happen easily. The community that is there is fine, though.

[b]Building[/b]
Ironically, this is probably the worst aspect of the game. Well, second worst. The mechanics are not that bad, it just takes getting used to. The issue is often, unless you are an expert and know what your doing, it won't turn look very good. This wouldn't be that bad if more materials were available, but microtransactions make it worse.

[b]Microtransactions[/b]
I get it, I honestly get it. There has to be a way for servers to keep running, so microtransactions are used. Honestly though, when I get a game, I want all the features available (minus DLC, that's different). It's a bit like PVE, and PVE2. Plants vs Zombies costs some money, but it gives all the features immediately. Plants vs Zombies 2, on the other hand, is free. However, there are many micotransactions. I would rather just pay the $5. Not only do items cost money, though this is forgivable considering items aren't necessarilly needed, and they are obtainable through mystery boxes, but towns and pocket universes need money. Towns need money to make, and money to expand. Pocket Universes need money to expand. Even dungeons, a large gimmick of this game, need money to make. The good news is it's easy to get some items via players, and there are shops that sell them. The bad news is they are really expensive.

[b]Style[/b]
The style of this game is actually not that bad. It doesn't look really good, but it's alright. The music is really on your taste, however. I personally don't mind it, but I can easily see people turn off the game after 5 minutes from it. It's essentially 8-bit dubstep. Ironically, it is one of the only aspects of the game that doesn't get old after a while.

[b]Final Verdict[/b]
8-bit mmo, dispite it's flaws, is a fun game. It is a nice little game to pop in every now and then, mess around with, and leave. It isn't by any means horrible, but it isn't a masterpiece either. It's pretty fun for the first 10-20 hours, but then gets dull, depending on your taste. That being said, you should try it out, and if it isn't your style, forget about it. Because of the numerous flaws, and it being boring after a short while, I'm going to have to give it a 5/10. See if you like it, but if it doesn't look like your cup of tea, skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133920326', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1462027018}

Probably one of the worst games i've ever wasted my time testing out!
I've done all the opening quests, and now there's nothing else left to do!
The game doesn't give enough (or any) instructions on what to do or where to go, or what the next mission to do is!
The building is buggy and pretty crap. The game is basically pay to win. And the graphics are pure shit. Yes, i know it's supposed to be an 8bit, but that's no excuse to not add shaders and any sort of detail to a modern game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102057946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 30514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20554, 'last_played': 1508085281}
review:
TLDR

you have to spam spacebar for literally (and i mean literally i am not just using it for emphasis) 9 hours to get say a publicpad from a shop that you don't even know will have it. Even if your satisfied never using premium blocks it will still take forever to build something cool after spamming the spacebar for longer.Quests need more tools and quest incentives should be premium currency. The inflation can't be fixed at this point (I assume)

The long version

On the off chance that anyone actually reads this or finds this helpful, this is what the game is.First i want to start off by saying i don't know why i play this game anymore. If your thinking "hmmm sandbox mmo might be interesting" it's hardly either of those things, or if your thinking "if the players make the world its probably filled with spammed blocks" and thats absolutely true, but aside from that and the drama between some (lets say) long time players here is whats wrong.

The "quest" system

I figured i'd start with the most obvious and most ignored part of the game. See the quest system is where most of the games problems begin. basically theres only 6 levels and your limited by the type of quest you can create because of the tools you have at your disposal. Most quests are Mazes,find the keys in the maze, get through the maze with invisible spikes,parkour with blocks you can't tell the height of(unless your in 9bit 3d mode which costs 30$),all of the above, or my personal favorite no quest at all.Once you get to level 6 theres no incentive because you gain a measly 50 gold and no exp.

Farming or zoo

the previous issue extends into this.see zoo's or gold farms are places where you can stab downward through a wall by spamming spacebar to gain gold from spawners. Naturally this broke the economy and inflated prices because now gold is too easy to get and now theres no incentive to do quests other than leveling to 6. To be clearer, the shop item never changed price, but there are items that can only be bought with premium currency. so platinum shops were created where people would sell platinum items for gold. Those were the prices that inflated. but the fact that you have to pay for regular blocks in the first place means if you want to build something cool you better have A)a town or a lot of space in the wilderness to do it B) be extremely patient or pay up the wazoo. 

Possible solutions

quests

While it's a long way from fixing or making the game worth playing in any way, my suggestion would be to make it so that rewardblocks give off platinum sure you can't get a reward block twice, but it's premium currency anyway so it would help players be able to get items they want by completing quests and while i realize that this is not a complete solution it's the best i can come up with. That being said players need more tools to create decent quests like npc's that can be interacted with maybe they give you items (That aren't keys) that can be put into a quest item inventory even that would be a start.

farming and inflation

I would say there is one, but unfortunately there isn't.
it all started from a bug that allowed you to stab downward through a wall thats never been fixed.
That's all that needed to be done to fix it, yet it's come to the point where certain people would be very reluctant to change their prices if this problem was fixed. they don't need your gold they are selling it to you out of "courtesy."

you know a certain someone even got touchy when i asked him why /tele awesome place was worth 1,000,000 gold i get that your paying for a title (because it's apparently the default suggestion for a telepad name) but even then i doubt even the minority of the players who can afford it would buy it.

My final thoughts

This game could have had so much potential but there are things wrong beyond what i have listed (because the other steam reviews cover them) and this game was really only held together by the  now long dead community. There are over 884,000 registered players and only about 20 will be playing at any given time at maximum. I don't want to dislike this game, but it's a shame that i do.

Congrats intrepid explorer!

if you got through the grammatical errors, my long rant, and the fact that my final thought wasn't final then you deserve a word of advice. If you decide to play this game and you see me in chat acting like a child although im almost technically and adult and spamming spacebar for the gold cycle instead of doing my biology homework or hanging out with my non-existant friends...

Say hello.
