author: {'steamid': '76561198077367882', 'num_games_owned': 553, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 25169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24343, 'last_played': 1613780613}
review:
[h1] Why I nominated this game [/h1] 
    I nominated this game for standing the test of time. No matter how deserted the game becomes, the people I have met in the game always make me come back for the rare chance that we have some minigames to play. That is why I nominated 8BitMMO despite my review. (Written 11-23-2016 AT 12:18 PM)

[h1] Disclaimer [/h1]
   Though my hours may seem low compared to other people who have reviewed this game, they aren't. I have played well over 1,000 hours of this game total combined with Steam and the Standalone version. With that said, lets get started! Oi! Also. I am working on making this review better. Mainly because this review right now seems one sided. Till it is updated. Please don't take the review as "completed" 

[h1] Tl;dr or something [/h1]
   This will sum up the review if you would rather not read a giant thing of words. The only reason I don't recommend this game is because of recent events in-game. The main Dev went insane and banned two mods. Then everyone freaked out and a lot of stuff went down hill from there.

[h1] Building [/h1]
   Argh, the building in this game is...weird, different, clunky, any word like those can describe the building in 8BitMMO. The angle that you play at contributes a [u]HUGE[/u] part in how you build. At the angle you play at you have to build the back of your building first,them the sides, then the front. If not done in this order, your building will not turn out right. To combat this, you would have to buy the "DLC" called 9BitMMO. It is just a 3D viewer for the game that costs [b] 35 dollars! [/b] this is outrageous just for a 3D viewer for the game! Other than those flaws, if you are able to become an expert builder and learn all the tricks, you are then able to build some [i] insane [/i] stuff!

[h1] PVP [/h1]
   The PVP in this game is rather bland and boring with only 3 swords, [spoiler] that are just recolored versions of each other that only do a little more damage [/spoiler] a pistol, a laser rifle, a hammer, and thats it. Being really good at PVP in the game is rather boring, being consider 2nd best my self; you can take it from me. Other than the weapons you can also heal your self in battle with chicken, steak, and a few other items. 

[h1] Community [/h1]
   Ok, this is where I become split at where I should recommend this game or not. The community in the game is actually pretty ok! There are some friendly faces out there that can really brighten up your day! But then you have the rare trolls that come in and either start insulting people or just being cringe-worthy. 

[h1] Rules and Moderators [/h1]
   The rules in this game are...ok? You aren't allowed to really swear besides being able to say "Damnit" and you are not able to spam either but that rule is normal. The moderators are also ok as well, from my experiences they are always fair and never take one side of the situation just because someone is their friend. They also never mute/hard-mute people when they don't deserve it [spoiler] 99% of the time. [/spoiler]

[h1] Huge Pros and Cons [/h1]
[b] CONS [/b]
[olist]
   [*]Dev who almost never listens to the community and starts going on a muting spree if you ask one simple question.
   [*]Almost no active community at this point
   [*]To build anything good you need to buy it with Platinum (Currency bought with real money)
[/olist]
[b] PROS [/b]
[olist]
   [*]Gold is rather easy to get if you are an active player at farms.
   [*]A lot of the players and mods are willing to help you if you have trouble.
   [*]Plat items are able to be bought with in game gold, though a lot I might add.
[/olist]

[h1] Ending Note(s) [/h1]
   In conclusion, 8BitMMO is an "meh" game with it's flaws, but until the Dev can get his **** together, this will stay negative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120686918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 221043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36537, 'last_played': 1463278918}
review:
Several months ago, I wrote a review for this game and said that I have not abandoned my willingness to change this game for future players. 

Now I have.

 In the past, I talked about the various changes this game could use because I cared enough to believe this game can be improved. I truly thought there was hope for improvement. This game left me with nothing more than disappointment for my own inadequacy to change it, and the frustration that it has been left unchanged. With no omission of detail, I will describe all the injustices of this game I have endured and eventually, what led to my eventual retirement.

I am a well known player, and I have received numerous achievements including the community's recognition for my candidacy as a moderator. As of this review, it has been about a year since the developer displayed any intentions of enlisting new moderators. 

Over the course of two weeks, I built this game's only non linear open-world quest. To compensate for the lack of NPC's in the game, I created makeshift ones with pumpkins and hid signs on every NPC, amounting to over 3000 words of dialogue. This construction received no recognition and the only part of the quest that received any major attention was a large boat that represented the last part of the quest.

I built a tutorial for this game to remake the current one. The current tutorial cannot be considered, in any shape or form, a tutorial. It teaches basic controls, but it omitted the most important and preliminary components of any mandatory tutorial. There were no instructions on how to build, how to obtain gold, or even how to use the shop.  Most players are turned away in utter confusion for the game's mechanics. Despite spending well over 40 dollars of premium currency on construction of a new tutorial, the developer declined before I even showed him what I made. 

I reconstructed the spawning area for players. The current one is vestigial other than a mild utility of teleport links to two mandatory dungeons; the rest lead to dead cities and abandoned PVP arenas. This too, was declined without a second thought.
 
I reported two major exploits regarding 9bitmmo (the experimental 3D game viewer).One allows unlimited gold farming and the other allows no-clipping through walls at will. The first was fixed within the day I reported it, and the second has yet to be fixed. The developer has no intention of fixing the second exploit stating simply, "people can already no-clip through more nefarious means". To this day, no-clipping through walls in 9bitmmo leaves all areas open to theft and quest exploitation. 

I created this game's first and only Megabuild, a castle that spanned the size of a 6X expanded town. The premium currency spent in its construction approaches well over 500 dollars. The most publicity it received was a visit by the developer and publicity on Facebook, twitter, and the sidebar for about two weeks. No monetary compensation was rewarded for its construction, and a teleport pad was never added to the spawn area for players to visit this place.

I contributed 400 dollars in donations towards the Novemberbit fundraiser event, amounting to 1000 dollars under my name. The only prize for donating this exorbiant amount is a custom item created and implemented under the name of the donator. Ever since the creations of items for the zealous donators of the game, no other items have been added.

What made me quit this game eventually is the ignorance of the developer to sympathize with the players of this game that truly want to make it better for others. If there is criticism to be heard, it falls on deaf ears. It has been over a year since a new building block as added to the game and almost mockingly, the developer still hovers over the forums and regulates posts that criticize the declining state of the game.

(Edit: I erased part of my review since at the time of writing it, I was rather hotheaded. There were times I fell in with the wrong crowd and made some inconsiderate comments. Although my criticisms of the game will remain, it will be directed in a purely constructive manner. A good critique should always be directed at the argument, not the individual)

author: {'steamid': '76561198090805135', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1414291214}
review:
When I first played this game I was like cool a game that is sandbox. But though it took me awhile to realize after playing the game how bad the community was, how bad the tutorial was and having to buy coins to get 1 block. Lets start with community, This is your community, a little 10 year kid running around saying "HOW DO DIS?" "HOW DO THAT?!" "YOU HAXER FKING REPORTED!!". You think thats bad? Well thats only part of it. Next thing, the tutorial barely tells you how to build (very disapointed i was excited for the building part and it gave a horrible tutorial on how to build) doesnt really teach you the basics (the creator was more like i "HEY LETS NOT TELL THESE PEOPLE HOW TO PLAY THE GAME AND PUT SHITTY HUMOR IN IT"). Last but not least the pay2win, I'll be honest it isnt the biggest pay to win game alive but it sure is one. If you want a game that makes you pay like 1000 coins for 1 block, then go ahead knock yourself out its stupid as hell to do something like that. Getting coins is a pain in the ass too, you only get like 1 coin to killing 1 enemy which is a waste of time and total bull shit.
Overall I highly hope you waste your money on some other game 1/10 rot in hell developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115921620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1456102027}
review:
So I haven't returned to this game for quite some time, since last year, in fact. I remember only playing it briefly through my insomniac days of living in a college dorm. So, after seeing this game again, I thought "Hey, I haven't played this in, like, forever, why not give it another go?"

Then, just like that, like the time I decided to mix all the sodas in that Burger King for some weird reason, I remembered exactly why I didn't play this game for very long.

THERE'S NOTHING TO DO.

It's boring, to say the least. There's not much of...well....ANYTHING to do. It's like if Minecraft went 2D, top-down perspective, killed EVERYTHING, including the graphics (if you can say that), ate it, then vom'd everywhere. Sure there's a centralized hub, but it seems so empty and desolate. Not only that, but the paths in town make you go from dainty stroll to HOLY S**T in a second, it's really weird.

Speaking of desolation, the player-base is extremely small. I didn't encounter any of the 10 year-olds like most seem to have complained about, mainly because, besides myself, there were only 4 or 5 other players on. Truly not the most abundant of a number, but that's what I noted anyway.

What's really strange, though, is that I ENJOY the sandbox genre. I like quirky graphic styles and stuff like that. But this game is like pulling teeth.

The minute I typed on a sign "Uhh, f**kin' I don't know" was the point at which I knew I was getting bored out of my mind. So, in retrospect, I should've kept this sleeping dog lie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073968961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1810, 'last_played': 1541594682}
review:
It is definitely easy to play and easy to understand and easy to build and easy in-general. This game can be a lot of fun and it can be pretty creative for a 2D game... But, it hasn't got much content at the moment despite the length of it's release and I hope they improve upon it more in the near future, as the community is pretty small but friendly. Also, some of the achievements are so hard to actually unlock, they are practically bugged and sometimes enemies can attack you through walls. I am going to say yes to recommending this game, simply because of what it is and it's free. But if it ever changes to a more Pay-to-Play, it might go to ruin. In my opinion: it's pretty much Habbo Hotel on Pixelated Crack. 

Completionist's Note: Now that I have finally done what there is to date, I can finally conclude that my opinion of the games been improved slightly, I had a lot of fun building and the community is really friendly! 75/100.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133077002', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1397660886}
review:
I remember a year ago I got Steam near my birthday and needed something to play. So I wen't to the Free to Play section and saw this game and I wanted to get into MMOs so I got this. I'm not a graphics whore so the 8-Bit doesn't bother me, but oh my god the screenshots made the game look clean. It's not like that it looks like a Taco Bell shit mixed with a hair from a old man. I didn't find a battle or clean land untill I explored the open green thing for 5 hours. I got killed. If you like unexistent battles and the look of Taco Bell shit and old man hair. Get this game if your somewhat normal and don't like that DON'T! 

Overall 2/10

review: A very good, made game. The game is pretty good on the fact that you have freedom on whatever you do, meaning you can make anything you want, in your "pocket universe". The "make your own dungeon" part is really well worked out, and you can find and create one full of trolls and halarious traps that do anything but good. The amount of weapons is broad, considering the amount of time they had with this game. Tell your siblings or friends about this game and ahve you and them steal from each other. Gret game, and hope you will play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198237577814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1639784550}
review:
8BitMMO is a tribute to the old gaming days where VGA (not SVGA or XGA) graphics cards was the gold standard and CGA the entry level. If you are familar with the blocky character dungeon quest games of the late 1980s and early 1990s as I was, this will bring back fond memories as it did for me. The twist is it's a sandbox MMO too. 

In this sandbox you build a place you call your own either in a pocket part of this 8 bit universe, as part of another player's town, or in the wilds where PvP is activated. The building blocks to create your spot are in fact...blocks...block grass, block wood, blook concrete, block glass, and so on. This stuff does not come free though..you pay for it in gold through quests given out initially by a personification of the developer. and later on a dragon architect and a zombie. You can also get gold just by entering dungeons created by players (you can create your own dungeon BTW for players to try) and kill lots of things and scoop up rewards.

The intentional retro look does not take away any artistic creativity on what you can build in this sandbox. I've seen very impressive multifloor buildings resembling a typical downtown area, and patterns of popular comic, video and cartoon characters. Getting the hang of building things is a little challenging but there is a community on online chat and IRC to guide you. Some have been nice enough to give me a few things to get myself going. There's a lot of items that give you the freedom to create nearly everything -- traps, teleporters, roads and sand to change a player's walking speed and so on. You can also buy some weapons to make the quests easier to complete and some articles of clothing to make your blocky figure at least somewhat distinct.

8bitMMO is free-to-play with an option to buy platinum to purchase special things that do not give an edge in PvP. 

Would I recommend it? I am not sure how the SkyRim generation of gamers would take to this, but the older players like myself -- as well as those who find the early days of 8-bit graphic games a golden era to be cherished -- will find plenty of things to do. I'd recommend it and give it 4/5 Stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166608352', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1581763877}
review:
Well, I'm in favor of 8-bit style games, but this one just not like what I have expected. First of all, it uses it's version control hash as game directory name. Seriously, if I search this hash on GitHub and SourceForge, would I get the source code? But I don't technically need that because this game is made of Java!
And second, I cannot download game data anyway, even with a proxy! I've reinstalled it for a few times, but it just doesn't work. It always fails or just jumps back to server selection page.
In general, not quite recommend to download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042393704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24873, 'last_played': 1556956384}
review: To start this game was developed by one person. Anyone who has ever coded anything will notice that the developer has most likely thrown his entire life and soul into this (which he has). This game has come so far, and has so much more potential. The community is friendly, and very helpful. Mods are on nearly 24/7, you can message the developer directly on IRC for quick replies. If you want an RPG then don't go here. This is a social, sandbox game. Everything you can do you can do without buying anything with real money. The MOST you have to do in the form of extra payment is buy premium items from other players with gold. Every single thing in this game is player built, and most of them are absolutely amazing. This game deserves so much more attention then it has right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230821440', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1441393250}
review:
Idk if I am the only one who likes this game.
But whatev!

I like the game istelf, It's kind of like an old-school game... I guess
AND THEN FIGHT FOR HOURS.
My pocket universe is great!
If you are wondering where yours is, it's that one blue teleporter at /spawn.

review: it is a good game and i do recomend it for the gamers that like the thrill of a 2d world with monsters and a build mechanism in it as well as anti grief systematics in the game if you are in a town but what i dont like is the lack of space for new players to muild their own houses and many people end up renting plots from other people or just dont have a home at all but of course you got your own little plot where you can build your own little home away from the others but the sad thing about that is that the only way someone can see it is by going on the internet and finding it in the online map amoung the other five million other plots out there so simply you cant share it with your friends any other way than taking a screenshot sadly if they cant find the plot on the map.

review:
This game is so cool! It's kind of sad that this is a "Mixed" game and only 61% of the people who get it like it but I love it! I like being a mayor and completing fun quests!

Besides the game being fun, the music loops, the fanbase sucks, and the quests get old really quick - but I still recommend it to play for a few hours.

I would've loved an open-world survival game like this with waves of enemies, hunger, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239728136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1608428083}
review:
I found this game quite interesting. It is very much like minecraft exept not from first perspective. My character name is She Wolf and if you play the game you may have seen me around. It is not like minecraft in many ways though. you don't die of hunger and thirst. You have money,it's more like civilization. You should see the awesome things people have made! Most of the people in the virtual world are friendly (exepting names) and will help you out when you are confused. You can make your own town! Your own house! It's not really that hard. Once you get to certain levels there are really awesome things! If you haven't yet, totally play this game!

-Wolf Girl

author: {'steamid': '76561198110792310', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 6978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1510133978}
review:
[h1]Большому кораблю - большое плаванье[/h1]
Но в нашем случае, скорее, утлое суденышко с парой дыр в днище.
Начнем, пожалуй, с музыкального сопровождения. Как говорил Мэддисон, ужасная "Коричневая музыка" выебет вам мозг уже на пятой минуте игры. Сука, да в переходах однорукие попрошайки с баянами играют лучше, чем те "Музыканты" которые делали музыкальное сопровождение для игры.
Нет русского языка, но это далеко не главная проблема этой игры.
Унылые квесты, на уровне браузерной игры.
Ужасно криворуко сделаны все локации, как-будто позвали школьника из "Копателя" обустроить их мирки.
Никакого олдфажного духа, даже намека на РПГ нет.
УЖАСНО
Однозначно, не стоит ее качать, так как в игре вас ждет еще и куча доната.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067950264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1864, 'last_played': 1473855600}
review:
Thirteen hours in the last few days, and I still can't quite figure out why I like this game. The graphics are, indeed 8-bit, though the colors are more like 16 bit. 32 bit if you play with the flesh tone color change option (/color <0-9>), as some of the variances are too subtle for 16 bit. 

You can mod your textures very easily. Which, I did do... Since I was sick of blue glass that you couldn't see through and neon green grass that makes your eyes water. All it takes to mod is a zip file creator and a paint program with transparency.... Go check the community, there's a FAQ for that.

Some of the stuff you really want is limited to platinum, which is only available through real-world money. Though, there are people that buy plat items and sell them for gold. (Regular quest cash.) These can go in the houses you build or - honestly - just about anywhere in the world. You can even found towns and build them up with friends.

Maybe that's what I like about this game.... When I used to play all those 8 and 16 bit RPGs, I used to think to myself that I could make better houses. This is my chance. (And, yes, I am a fanatic for a certain game that starts with an 's' and ends with 'ims.') 

Also, the game isn't that difficult. I find that making money is a breeze once you buy a gun and just sit just barely in range of a spawner. Levelling to 4 was long, but - if you do the draco and brain quests - not terribly bad. The draco quests can be repeated by clearing your quest log, by the way. I haven't hit 5 yet, but I'm on the way and looking forward to opening up some more blocks to build with. I'm also really looking forward to gathering enough gold to buy a spawner off of someone that has plat, so I can make a shooting range.

review:
This isn't a "good game" really. But if you like wandering the wastelands of blocks and things looking for ancient ruins of past players who actually quite enjoyed the game, then this is the game for you. The map is HUGE! Filled with random things everywhere and large cities in small corners of the world. All I wanted was an open world, and I got that.

-11/10 Would wander aimlessly again

author: {'steamid': '76561198064848393', 'num_games_owned': 39, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1440651501}
review:
1/10
-Grind is...boring and long
-Limited gold farm per hour
-Pay4Gold and Plat
-Combat is wtf
-Graphics are crap.....But somehow it lags my desktop (Might be just my comp...but it doesn't lag on Tera)
-Small community/Inactive
-Achievements a bit too easy to complete.
-Building is fun.....but every single block requires gold which is hard to come buy.
-Some blocks are exclusive to be bought with premium cash.
-Character design is garbage.
-wtf is the potato race.
-I strongly feel the need to bot in this kind of game.

review:
Извините за вырожение но эта игра полное гавно!
1Мир в игре непонятный я не могу понять где тропинка а где стена и постоянное изминенния взгляда на мир меня просто убивает!
2.В игре царствует донат.
3.Почему нету русского языка.
4.Мало мобов да и ихние имена не  очень видно что создатили этой игрышки называли их от делать нечего.
Не советую эту игру.Поиграйте лучше в conter strike go)

author: {'steamid': '76561198134090782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1438089123}
review: Хотите знать моё мнение об игре? Отстой! Если взяли тему восьмибитного RPG, то делайте грамотно, с умом! Здесь совсем нет такой души, как на NES. Тут будто все сделано по быстрому, выглядит отвратительно, быстро надоедает. Я разочарован в игре, а ждал большего. Ожидается нечто ностальгическое и потрясное, в итоге выходит какое-то дерьмо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043151304', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1402772704}
review: Hra je plna chyb, glitchu a dalsich neprijemnosti obstastnujicich vase hrani. Neprehledne prostredi, repetetivni sprity mobu. Celkove ne az tolik zabavne. Prednosti by mela byt 8 bitova grafika a fakt, ze se jedna o MMO, ale najdeme zde zajimavejsi kandidaty, ktera vas vtahnou na delsi cas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967718083', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1437903631}
review:
Intérêt global: ★☆☆☆☆
8BitMMO est comme son nom l’indique un MMO en 8Bit, ni plus ni moins. La question qui se pose est peut-on trouver du fun sur ce concept quand le marché est allé bien au-delà, même dans le gratuit ? Un petit plus pour la communauté sympathique mais à faible population.
Graphismes : ★★☆☆☆
Des graphismes 8 Bits corrects. Ce qui est agaçant c’est la quantité de bugs graphiques : on passe à travers les murs, on ne détecte pas vraiment bien les hauteurs, on n’arrive pas à prendre toujours les portes et les escaliers,… 
Musique / Son : ★★★☆☆
La bande sonore respecte l’univers 8bits avec l’accompagnement de chiptunes. Cependant la plupart des chiptunes choisis cassent les oreilles. Attention au mal de crane c’est assez bourrin sur la plupart des musiques de fond.
Jouabilité : ★★☆☆☆
Jouabilité classique d’un jeu en 8Bit avec 3D isométrique : on se déplace dans l’univers avec les flèches directionnelles. Les plus sont la présence d’un mode de craft housing qu’il est possible même de faire en groupe. Sinon c’est du classique : vous utilisez des téléporteurs en fonction de l’activité que vous voulez faire : pvp, quest pve, housing, achat/shop. Interface pas très ergonomique : il faut entrer des commandes dans le chat et il est difficile de socialiser avec d’autres joueurs facilement.
Durée de vie : ★★☆☆☆
Je ne pense pas que l’on passe plusieurs heures sur ce soft. On se lasse assez vite vu l’intérêt proposé par le soft. L’univers est sans doute important mais n’apporte rien de plus que farmer des quetes dans queue ni tête sans trame de fond, histoire ou héro à l’emblème charismatique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121823772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1437597523}
review:
When I play a videogame (regardless of genre), I expect it to grab me by the arms and drag me into it's world. I want to be fully engrossed in it's universe, story, and gameplay.

Personally, 8BitMMO did none of this for me.

Now, I realize I didn't play this game for very long. I plan to play more of it in the coming days, to really give it a fair shot. I also realize that the focus of this game leans more towards user created content then a narrative-heavy experience. I GET that. But what 8BitMMo is supposed to do, it doesn't seem to do particularly well. It just hasn't made a great impression so far.

PROS:
--Somewhat clever sense of humor
--Relatively empty servers
--Easy to pick up and play
--Does not require an email address to play

Cons:
--World-building, an already slow and unintersting affair (and unfortunately the whole point of the game), is made more difficult via microtransactions.
--Gameplay is fundamentally oversimplified, and not very interesting as a result.
--Quests lack challenge and variety
--Performance issues-notably server lag.

It's just hard to reccomend an MMO like this when there are so many better experiences available.

review:
8BitMMO is a retro-style 2D massively multiplayer game! It's a giant construction sandbox -- you can build a home or a castle in a persistent streaming world. Found and manage your own city. Fight evil LawyerCats and engage in Player vs Player battle. Work in Progress! :)
Joined a server, got accused of hacking by 3 people with "kid" in their username, got banned while stabbing cats
11/10 best game on the planet
69/10 best community
Alright, this isn't for a review, this is for the devs:

Good job. It looks like you guys have been trying very hard on making this game as good as it can be. I haven't played much, but only because you guys are obviously not finished with it, but right now it looks like it has a lot of potential. There are a few bugs in there, like a shadow bug after taking away bricks (don't know if it's just me), but it looks like it's gonna be good. I really like where you guys are going. With that being said, I do have a few rants about it.

-The open world is all brown. I don't know if it's unaccesable (again, haven't played much), but it just looks kinda ugly on the world map site. I do not mean to offend.

-restricting access to blocks from low levels is a weird mechanic. If the restricted blocks do something special, then sure, but if it's just decoration it's weird.

there's more, but I am very tired this morning so I will stop here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089234092', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1401905469}
review:
Honestly, this game was a disappointment. At first, this game looked amazing, fun, and well put together. But that's just in the trailor. The truth is,  when you actually begin to play the game, you notice a lot that went wrong. First, it's incredibly hard to figure out how to play. The tutorial doesn't tell you much at all about what you're supposed to do, or how to get started. Second, the block layouts are all very 'chunky' and hard to work with. You can barely tell where blocks actually are, what level they're at, or where a wall is.
This game has a camera view very similar to old 8 bit games, but the view genuinely sucks. You can't even see the sides of blocks so even with the different layers, this game doesn't even have a 3d feel to it. Other than that, the character art is awful, battles don't make much sense, and I couldn't even figure out just by playing the game if there's an inventory system.
In general, I would rate 8bitMMO 3/10. I just couldn't see a good side to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062644451', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1435423147}
review:
Intense MMORPG, and i cant git enuff.

It can get a bit tricky later on, so hears a quik guide on starting out.

First thing is when you enter the game, you wanna open up the menu, this will allow you to choose your first skill and your
elemental ability. The best one is fire for damage, but water is also good considering the healing factor, but otherwise no one else plays grass or earth. After that, you want to type in chat and see if anyone is having a Igneo run. If someone is, use the teleport to player button next to the chat box and you should see a mountain with many players. When they all walk in the door, you should follow and gain the gold and good gear that the minions drop. The hardest part is the mini boss, Ifrit, who comes early on. He has for attacks, bite, dealing aprox 1000 dps, howl, increasing his wolf pups stats by 100 each which is pretty hefty if he has more than at least ten. Then tackle and roll, which are stupid and will most likely miss.

Next the building, oh the building. Probably some of the best building mechanics i have seen in a long time. You will get 100 free blocks to start, but that wont be enough. Remember all the gold you got from the Igneo run, use that to buy some! Build beautiful imagery in this fantastic game.

"This is like a merging of Fallout, World of Warcraft, Call of Duty, and Dota 2, pretty much heaven on earth" Deadpool

author: {'steamid': '76561198061109495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1389994724}
review:
This, I gotta say, was a great idea, but turned out completely rubbish.

So the entire world is user created, and it's a good concept, but most things in the world looks half-assed and unfinished. You'll find some things that are good, but not much. 

The combat system is terrible, it's just constantly spamming one button and then getting the loot. It gets repetitive and boring over time. Again, quests are boring and tiring, and the tutorial itself was terribletoo. A tutorial is supposed to engage the player into playing the game and learning how to. This obviously for me, did not.

I got bored of this after half an hour and me and my friend couldn't find eachother either. The whole idea is great n' all, but just not really my cup of tea.

3/10. ~Deejay

author: {'steamid': '76561198115682104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 30103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8396, 'last_played': 1458922852}
review: Its a sandbox game.  The 3d mechanics of building blocks take some getting used to.  Commands similar to irc commands.   This game's been online supposedly for 5 years.  I see lots of towns incomplete and some players homes abandoned.  3 of the quests I've yet to figure out how to get to them.  3 of the quests are not clear on how to complete them and the other 4 are relatively easy.  If they actually clean up the landscape of the discarded plots I'd say this is a great game.  Its ok for the 10 dollars I invested in it. I wouldn't advise going past 10 dollars, you may experience buyers remorse.  Its a nice game for killing time that doesn't take up alot of memory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092386915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1424107085}
review:
Signed up for early access and enjoyed probably around 30 minutes before being hit by the realization of what was wrong. Even though the game shows promise with being able to build whatever you want and start your own towns and the like...i was not hooked with this like i was with Minecraft or other games that do this type of formula. The quests are all very generic, such as only incremeting the amount of blocks you need to face or enemies you need to kill. Blocks need to be purchased, and even though thats not bad, good luck trying to find to a place to build instead of your own personal portal since most towns either have buildings that are fully complete or were eventually left alone. Money, which is need to pay for blocks, is also slow to obtain; bad lag is also apparent some time.

In the end, this game showed promise early on, but eventually fell to some problems which did not contribute to the overall experience. Mabye in a year or two my opinion will be different, but spending 10 or 20 dollars on founders packs is money that could be used on other games which could provide more and last longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172467675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1424825695}
review:
I LOVE to build. If it is possible to build something in a game, I build it. And when I found 8
-Bit MMO, I figured, "player-built worlds? This looks like it might be worth a try." But this game fell short of my, to be honest, rather low, expectations. It is a pain in the ass to build anything, and that is reflected in the creations of the other people playing the game. You can find some of your favorite types of places to go in the many towns of the game, such as, half-finished libraries, crappy houses, incomplete, non-functional bowling alleys, and abandoned projects that people got tired of working on.
The combat isn't great either. It's just not fun with, as far as I know, only one weapon.

It sucked. 
-8/10 IGN

review:
the game: draco's tutorial: place 10 blocks place 20 blocks place 10000 blocks with your limited knowledge now.you can place in the air by holding shift. place 99999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999 blocks using this method. make a house. sir brains? was that his name? tutorial: poke cats with a stick.  poke hippies with a stick. buy a blue stick so your pokes make them leave you faster. now his player made quests: navigate the labyrinth with all 5 enemies in it to get the 1st reward block. now kill this non-existant creature 5 times for the second reward. now go uninstall this game.  you have to grind to buy every single induvidual block by poking a blue stick through a wall. now buy a L that shoots squares. keep poking them with a blue stick. farm a cent after 92035375698564 centuries. buy a single brick. farm for 999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999 milluniems to get to level 4 and buy a tv. now with your 2 excess cents buy another brick.keep farming. try to build a simple house with the crap building.also this is not an mmo or 8-bit. its also not a rpg. i want my money back and this is a free game. .5/10000

notice its .5 instead of 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037245954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1422716110}
review:
This game is a big grindfest, and there aren't really enough content to be able to say if it's good or not.
There's a huge lack of enemies to fight and the purpose of the game stops at level 5-6 (cap level) because there's nothing left to do than just click and click and click...
The game also forces you to use real money to be able to progress which is generally BAD.
But i enjoyed the game nevertheless, and built myself an Asian styled hotel.

I will still give thumbs up because i do see the potential in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045321265', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1432329253}
review:
Vítejte u recenze na MMO hru, kterou [b] NEMOHU [/b] doporučit!
Jedná se o indee hru, nesoucí název 8BitMMO, která je na Steamu zcela zdarma. Pojďme se podívat, jak u mně obstála.

[h1] Grafika [/h1]
    Zde není moc co vyprávět. Hra sama svým názvem napovídá, že nebude obsahovat styl grafiky, známí například u AAA titulů. :) Máme zde prostou 8 bitovou grafiku.
    Hra bohužel při taková grafice, navíc v 2D prostoru působí velice chaoticky a na určitých místech se budete vztekat, kvůli nemožnému pohybu hlavní postavy, neboť pořádně není vidět vrstva bloků, nebo se Vám bloky neskryjí, když stojíte pod nimi. 2/10

[h1] Hudba [/h1]
    Hudba Vám začne obtěžovat mozek od samotného začátku, proto jí raději vypnete a pustíte si svojí vlastní oblíbenou vypalovačku. 1,5/10

[h1] Questy [/h1]
    Nevím, co vývojáři zamýšleli... Ale když Vám dají ten samí úkol 3x-5x za sebou a pouze změní číslo požadavku, je to velice otravné. [Příklad: Polož 10 blocků, úkol splníte a odevzdáte, obdržíte nový úkol - Polož 50 blocků... A tak to jde dále.]
    Pokud se přes toto prokoušete, dostanou se na řadu úkoly od hráčů...[Pravděpodobně, je to napsáno před zadáním úkolu...] Dámy a pánové, některé jsou tak nemožné, že jsem musel hru vypnout a okamžitě začít psát tuto recenzi... Pokud obdržíte úkol a místo popisku úkolu, co by jste měli splnit, se Vám napíše jen "Welcome to Metropolis"... Nemáte ponětí, co máte splnit, či provést.
    Další úkol, který mi utkvěl v paměti, nesl popis o vyšplhání věže do nejvyššího patra...Pokud pomineme velice chaotické schody...Přijde mi absolutně stupidní, když z toho vršku můžete vkročit do vzduchu a "létat" na mapě...
    Questy jsou něco, co mi nešlo do hlavy...2/10

[h1] Komunita hráčů [/h1]
    Osobně jsem za dobu svého hraní narazil na 3-4 osoby... I chat ve hře je velice poklidný. Pokud nemáte ve hře aktivní hráče, něco je pravděpodobně špatně.

[h1] Achievementy [/h1]
    Hra si u mě odnáší malé plus za Achievementy. Jsou ovšem docela jednoduché a splníte je, pokud hru budete hrát... To podle mého není žádná výzva k námaze za Achievementy... Výjimky se najdou, ale koukat 15 minut do nastavení hry pro odemknutí úspěchu? Nebuďte směšní. 3/10

[h1] Co říci závěrem? [/h1]
    Pokud mám hodnotit hru sám za sebe, dostává ohodnocení [b] 2/10 [/b] kvůli veliké nepřehlednosti/chaotičnosti, nesmyslným questům, otravné muzice a nízké herní aktivitě.

    Pokud máte jakoukoliv kritiku, či chválu, prosím dejte mi vědět :)
    Snad se Vám recenze líbila. Pokud ano, tak doufám, že se uvidíme někdy příště! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138602012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19802, 'last_played': 1519190100}
review: 8bitMMO is a Very fun game. At certain times it can be very boring, depending on what players are online. It is a friendly game, except when people scam, spam, or curse. Be forewarned this happens quite frequently. When people buy plat or plat items, they either sell them or use them. Plat item selling is very common, so it is uncommon for people to buy plat. There are also items called mystery boxes, so you can buy plat items only with gold. There is so much you can do on this game! it depends entirely on what you want to do. If you like making pixel art, there are many blocks that provide colors to do so. One player (Sage) made realistic looking people using only blocks he/she could buy in-game. If you like being a popular and admired player, you can give or sell plat items. In total 8bitMMO is one of the best games i have ever encountered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095809327', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1439216788}
review:
This game is poorly made. You build 3D buildings in a 2D world. HOW IS THAT POSSIBLE? I honestly spend over half of my time figuring that out. I'll list some Pro's and Con's.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
-Creative World Design
-Interesting Characters (but terrible names.)

[h1] Cons [/h1]
-Character Names (lawyer cat? dafuq?)
-Impossible to build
-Nobody is ever on, hardly a "mmo"
-The DLC's cost so damn much.
-The combat is terrible. You can only knife.


[h1] OVERALL [/h1]
1/10.

The only fun part is getting the achievments. Some are hard to get. Some are as simple as placing a god damn block. 8BitMMO, change your name to "8BitPeiceOfShit" because that will get you more people TO STAY AWAY THE TORTURE THEMSELVES WITH THIS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038056805', 'num_games_owned': 3183, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1431102933}
review:
It was hard for me to find pros for this game, but I'll try to make a comprehensive list:

PROS:
Good casual MMORPG with user-built quests to ensure new quests are added to the system

You will be called names that you never thought you would be called after elementary school ended, like "poopy head", dork, and "fart sniffer"

This game will make you reminisce the days when you were between 9 and 14 years old.

CONS:
Community is between 9 and 14 years old; no, that's not me trolling them, they are literally between 9 and 14 years old. Do not expect a good community here, because it just isn't good.

Game is way too easy, even without the purchase of plat because of individuals who have made "farming zoos", which spawn creeps and grant incredibly easy gold/exp. If you don't use them, you will be way behind.

You will be called names that you never thought you would be called after elementary school ended, like "poopy head", dork, and "fart sniffer".

Mods are also between 9 and 14 years old.

The graphics look like they were created by someone between 9 and 14 years old.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052662282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1429331043}
review: I was drawn to give this game a try by the sandboxy building aspect of the game and thought it might be enjoyable to play with a friend or two. Upon playing the game for a while, I realized that while you can build as much as you want in a barren landscape of nothingness (granted, there's a pay element that slows your building down significantly if you choose not to pay which is another pain point), there is realistically nothing for you to do in this game. It is neat that a single dude pumped this out but other than allowing you to look at pixel art on a mini-map that generates rarely, he didn't give you much to do which is why I can't recommend you spend any time on this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109665440', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1429895630}
review:
Un juego que a mi parecer se centra en que sean los propios jugadores los que vayan aumentando las quests, objetos y demás. Es un juego entretenido que intenta copiar a minecraft en el sentido de la construcción, pero que no se asemeja.
Suele travarse en algunos puntos.
El sistema de combate, menús y demás es de lo mejor que he visto; pero un fallo que tiene es que están los diálogos en inglés y luego te saltan a castellano.
También sería un juego muy corto si como dije antes no fuese por la comunidad de jugadores, que se dedican a hacer misiones, ya  que alllegar al nivel 3 solo haces misiones de jugadores.
Si te gusta desarrolar tus misiones, pero no eres muy manitas este es tu juego, y entretenido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116377047', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7637, 'last_played': 1550809067}
review:
Edit:
This game is not at full capacity, and still has a lot of issues.
Placing blocks is still a chore, and you can and will mess up without a doubt.
there have been more blocks added, but still a lack of block types, variants, etc.
And as of recently, I'm not sure if support for the game has been dropped, but nothing seems to open from the dropdown menu on the side, everything stalls at (Example).exe error.
I am unable to officially state if that is the case, but it is quite annoying for sure.

The Playerbase is still nonexistent, and I see no forseeable comeback from this state of "depression".
Grinding is still kind of a problem, but has been lessened, to a degree, but it is still a bit of an issue, since there is a reset period on the money, which also means that the game has a sort of cap after a certain amout of money gained, you'll be hard pressed to get any from mobs.

So all in all, after more time spent playing this game, I still personally can not recommend this game.
There are still too many issues and lack of blocks to chose from.
5/10 (Mediocre)

author: {'steamid': '76561198168214466', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1486576922}
review:
Сначала проходим обучение, от том, как нужно ходить, бить(махать мечом), открывать двери.
Из плюсов:
Большое количество и весьма разнообразные вещи + 15
Неплохой интерфейс + 15
Приятная 8bit`ная графика +30
Возможность псотройки своего дома + 10
Даже во время обучения рядом ходят реальные игроки, а не боты + 20

Из минусов: 
Отсутсвие, даже примитивного русского языка - 10
Трудно ориентироваться в зданиях - 15

Итого: 
65 баллов из 100.
Выше среднего.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071696746', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1427341429}
review:
-=Hello=-

I've played this game for quite a while now, and felt it would be nice to write a review finally. I'm going to catogorize the subjects into "Pros", "Cons", and "Nuetrals", because that's just how I like doing it.

-=Pros=-
1) Charming Graphics. Though many may not enjoy the 8-bit appeal, I personally love these graphics, simple, vibrant, and a calm step back from common graphics nowadays trying to break the gate between virtual and realistic.

2) The combat. It's so simple, but so satisfying when a hit is registered, and I feel the new addition of the hammer has only made it better.

3) Freedom. This game has little to no story, and pretty much goes out of it's way to limit the player in anyway, letting him/her venture off and do their own thing, with a few quests and mazes here and there.

4) Unserious charm. The game has many points in which it breaks drama to give off a joke or just sillyness in general, which I personally love.

-=Cons=-

1) The building system. This definitely needs some work, as it is hard, and generally a pain in the arse when you have to tear down an entire wall just because you misplaced a block on one of the walls, as there's no way to turn the camera when you want to change an axis.

2) Lack of content. This game definitely is missing a large part of free content, and feels as though it relies on the community to make most of its content so the devs are left to freelance as they wish.

3) Pay-to-play. Yes, most of the content you have to pay for. Especially building. In order to make the fantastic wonderful builds in the trailer, you need to pay to get the town stone, and be a mayor, etc.

-=Nuetrals=-

1) The music. All music is created by the community. Whether you like this or not, it definitely is unique for a game's audio to be presented by the players.

2) Cosmetics. These are a bit odd, but colorful and fun. Some like them, some don't, but atleast they allow the player a bit of individuality, even if you do have to pay for the cool things.

-=Final Verdict=-

In the end, this game is an awesome little time-burner, that is completely free to play. Yes, the game strongly nudges you towards payments, but it's always avoidable. I have to give this game a recommendation, just because of how cute and charming it is.

review:
Reasons:

Combat? A joke. I poked cats and hippies with a blue sword.

Building? Nope. Everywhere is claimed and the mayors are never on.

MMO? NO ONe IS EVER ON. And when they are they just complain.

RPG? What? Sorry? What is an RPG? I dont think this game is one.

8-Bit? Uh...no. Not in ANY way.

Music? Have decent. Half. It would bug out and... static.

Overall:
.5/6

Look closely. Thats a .5 not a 5.

Yeah. It sucks. And the people that were on only ever helped out them selves. None of the new guys.

And the develper was so lasy he had people make his dundeons and buildings for him. His jokes were stupid too.

Redo-
.5/8

Just...terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121239801', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1425360595}
review:
I actually really like 8bitmmo because of the fact that it is unlike most other games on steam or anywhere else in fact and it is different from most other building games, being more retro unlike minecraft which is being intentionally pixilated, but actually looking like it would have been if it were made back then.

This game has a different view point than other games being a fixed camera game like terraria and starbound but with the little added 3d ish effect  that everyone hates when building. It makes you take thing apart to piece your buildings together, but this gets you to know what you are building and I like it that way. 

One other thing that people hate that is unreasonable is the fact that there are in game purchases. It may have them but you don't have to use them because there are so many other people who are impatient and by the coins who you can use in game trading to trade with for the platinum coins that everyone dislikes.

There is also the fact that it is supper hard to get coins but that is not true there is /tele zoo to get easy coins and doing the basic quests to get coins is easy too. All you have to have is a little patients and who said in minecraft you didn't have to go mob farming for items and spend a couple hours building your dream home. In 8bitmmo you don't even have to spend that long on it.

There are towns and mayors with micro leadership over their town setting rules for their towns within the guidelines of the games rules not unlike how the actual cities and towns have to obey their nations rules creating a tiny bit of realism in it that makes it just all that more appealing to me.

The entire world is player made creating this fun looking world with everyone's interests in their areas like some giant mansions and some with custom built dungeons with traps and mazes. There are even people who create there favorite characters in the blocks shoeing that you can do almost anything you could think of in 8bitmmo.

So in the long run being free and a completely unique game with its different quirks it is one of my favorite games and I didn't even find it on purpose just by surfing the steam store!

review: Honestly this game isnt that great in my mind but it may be in yours. First off, it says mmo but its not even a mmo you dont get to interact with people that much, its more of just talking with people. I'm not fond of the building either, you cannot tell where your placing, how high the blocks are up, and theres lots of bugs like walking inside things and getting stuck. The quests, can be pretty fun but if you dont do one its constantly on your screen and it doesnt go away. This game is also about sandbox? Well it takes forever just to get to be able to build freely and with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137517419', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1424542358}
review:
It took me ten minutes to find out what was wrong with this game. Now, I am never playing it again. Allow me to list my problems with the game. Note that I have nothing against games with 8bit or 16bit art styles, as I actually own several true 8 and 16 bit games.

1. Your character has two sprites, one as an idle sprite, one for walking. This means you will never know which way you are facing.
2. These graphics just seem lazy. The charm of 8bit is taking that limitation and making something beautiful out of it, not going HELLO LOOK AT ME IM SUCH A NOSTALGIA JUNKIE LOOK ITS 8BIT SEE SEE. That doesn't stop your game from looking like crap. Take an example of another game that uses an 8bit artstyle, the ever popular Shovel Knight. The difference between these two games is that one looks good, and actually has different sprites for which direction your character is facing, as well as the simple fact that it actually looks like a game from the time period it's trying to emulate.
3. Whenever you walk against walls, everything kind of jerks around and I have no idea why.
4. The music is like someone took a generic dubstep loop and gutted it of anything that might have made it good.
5. The game tries to be cool by breaking the fourth wall in really dumb ways.
6. User created dungeons are rarely a good idea.
7. Don't even bother walking under any sort of ceiling. The effect is not pleasant.
8. The first mandatory dungeon is a LOLcats reference.
9. There is no point to any NPC humor whatsoever. This lead to me skipping so much of their dialogue.
10. Stepping up onto another block makes the camera jerk around.


Don't support these developers, and don't play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179278937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1429720839}
review:
Суперская ммо-игра в стиле 8bit! Сначала я подумал что это ещё одна игра жанра квестМмо... но нет! это оказалась намного более классная игра! Для любителей квестов. И вообще для всех кто только знакомится с жанром ММО.
И так:
Музыка - 10/10
Графика (для 8биток) - 8/10
Геймплей и механика - 9/10
И конечно же в этой игре присутствует юмор, много юмора! Как раз то что не хватает некоторым великолепным ММО
Игра класс.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042061468', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1424312929}
review:
This game is cute, and definitely has it's pros, but overall I don't recommend it.

The pros:
1. Who doesn't love a trying-to-look-old super pixely game?! I find it adorable, personally.
2. The music just adds to pro #1.
3. The quest-giver dialog is entertaining and worth reading.
4. It's free.
5. You can see other people running around, so it makes you feel like you're not really alone.

The cons:
1. It's super laggy. I'll click a teleporter and won't go, so I'll think I missed it, move closer and click it again and suddenly I'm thrown into the new world and then back again because I accidently took the teleporter back.
2. Building. It's terrible. I (very accidently) spent 200g on blocks and somehow am still able to walk through the walls of my "home."
3. After the first few quests all you're doing is trying to build, exploring random towns other people have built (good luck figureing out which blocks you can walk on and which you can't), or trying to memorize player-made dungeons so you don't keep falling into the same hidden spike traps.
4. There's other people running around, but other than talking in chat, I haven't found any way to interact with them (ie forming a group to do quests or explore together?). I'm not saying it doesn't EXIST, just that I couldn't figure out how.
5. Only 3% of people who played made it to level 4. That should be a sign. For reference, I got to level 3 in an hour.

I enjoyed this for the first, say, 30 minutes and spent the next 30 trying to figure out what enjoyable thing there was to do next. I couldn't find any.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095704568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1424462962}
review:
Basically Minecraft, Team Fotress 2, Hat Sim 2015 and The Land of Awkward One way doors. The community is great, just great. Just DON'T JOIN SERVERS (ON PAIN OF DEATH) and you'll be fine. I say this cos EVERY SINGLE SERVER has a dungeon which you are trapped in IMMEDIATELY on joining. This goes on until your spam bugs the host so much he/she lets you out, then you immediately discover the door is only openable from the other side and you're stuck in one room anyway. Get it if you like hats. There are loads of hats. Loads and loads of hats. I mean SHNITZEL TONS OF HATS! SHNITZEL Tons!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

6/9 - Cos i CAN (swag).

P.S. Did I mention? HATS!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081558201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1562305795}
review:
8BitMMO, created by Robby Zinchak aka RobbyZ is a old school styled Free Roam Rpg. 8BitMMO is a game that takes inspiration from many games such as Minecraft, Legend of Zelda, and even Mario. In 8BitMMO you start off waking up in a man's house who is completely aware that he is in a video game by breaking the 4th wall. He sends you off to complete quests in order to just get you out of his house, he references that he has done this multiple times and that strangers waking up in his house has become a common problem for him. This snarky dialogue made me enjoy my first 10 minutes of the game, as it reminded me of dialogue coming from games like Saints Row. I love it when games make fun of the fact that it is a game. Unfortunately after the tutorial this dialogue seemed to cease and enjoyment of my gameplay experience began to decrease more and more. The combat in 8BitMMO is simple enough to play with one hand, with occasionaly reaching for your mouse. Only having the WASD keys for movement and the space bar for attacking made hunting quests and fighting off enemies a bore after the tutorial. There is also another element that makes 8BitMMO a little more entertaining; the ability to build. You are able to build a houses and environments like a top down Minecraft or Terraria. The building can become tedious with blocks stacking not the way you want them to and having a lack of tools to do anything truly spectacular. Although I didnt enjoy this feature, I did see many interesting and cool user created homes and even areas that put the building and combat to good use. The music is probably what I enjoyed most from 8BitMMO, it had beats that went along with the art direction and it had the convenient feature to skip the current song as if i was using Pandora radio. The game does have a leveling system like most other MMO's that encourage you to rank up in order to get certain items or get to certain areas. I have to completely honest and say that I didnt have a great time with 8BitMMO. It is free on Steam and does offer microtransactions, BUT doesnt flash them around begging for money. The game might be fun with a few friends looking to make your own quests and adventures but playing alone is just plain boring.

Overall:

8BitMMO has a lot of great ideas that just dont work out yet. After sometime and update the game can be great. The music fits in with the world perfectly and the combat is a little bland. In my opinion I would like to see RobbyZ create either more content for this game or make more games with the same amount of snark and wit that the tutorial of this game had. I loved the original dialogue and was set to play a game that knew how to make fun of its self but instead, I got a bland and lifeless world that could and should be improved dramatically. And could be alot of fun if your bored with nothing new to play or if you find a group to play with.(Roleplaying could be fun in this game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052007123', 'num_games_owned': 6823, 'num_reviews': 1307, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1423803482}
review: Didn't catch my interest in Early Access, thought about giving it another try after full release. Ended my adventure pretty quickly. Why? I don't mind killing over and over monsters for some gold for blocks, to build city/house/dungeon or some other things. I think it's pretty neat idea. But the whole building stuff doesn't feel right. It's just no fun, it's quite hard and often you will place blocks on another one instead of next to. It's not so addictive as building in Minecraft or Terraria. Or even in Blockland. What's the point in playing a game where the main "objective", building in this giant construction sandbox, is not fun? Since it's free to play you should check for yourself if you will like it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093110969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1423798185}
review:
I'd rather post a sideways thumb, but, as there ain't one, I'll give this a thumbs up, due to its creativity.

I know my play time in 8bitMMO is pretty low, but thats just it. This game is so simple.  Its pixelated, so feels more like a computer game from 1993-2000. Literally. I felt like I'd fallen into a timewarp or something, when I first tried this.
It should be noted that, messages from the community disappear after a few seconds, to minutes(depending on how many are chatting) so it is hard to tell how the community is, or how active it is, to me.

Ai is the evil, really terrible....Lawyer Cats. Yea. That appears to be the basic enemy, and may be the only one on the game. Unless the quest sends you to kill a certain thing, such as slugs. And fighting is simple enough. Press the Spacebar. One Lawyer Cat down. Even if you got 4-5 Cats running after you. Oh and as of level 2, my total HP(Hit Points) is the very super high number of 6.

You can also build in "towns" across the game. The owner is known as the Mayor, and with his permission, you can build in it, and become a citizen of that town. Then you place blocks down, similarly to MineCraft. Except the game has "flat walls" which is where the game world is flat, and you run along in, what looks like a maze of colored pixels. Just like back in the ancient days of gaming.

Overall, this is probably the best MMO for children, or complete newcomers to the genre. Simple, and teaches you the basics of MMO gaming. It also lacks alot of that challenging, wanting to come back for more. Veteran MMO players will probably find this game super boring, while young kids, new MMO comers, or fans of pixelated Indie games may feel like they found a treasure trove with this game. Again, only reason I put a thumbs up was cause, 1. No neutral thumb and 2. Its creativity and uniquness of making it look so pixelated seems 1-of-a-kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178884766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1423869016}

author: {'steamid': '76561198119818916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1423675189}
review:
Now that I have played this game I will give my input on it. Unless you plan on sinking money into this game, it SUCKS. You have your root hub instance, where you can get a couple of quests, and a portal to a pocket universe for you to build by yourself. Takes 500 gold to make it so people can help you in your little universe, and then 10 platinum (purchase only premium currency) to turn it into a small town in the world.

In case you are wondering: Oh 10 platinum? That's not all that bad. Yeah, it is. There is a sale going on right now, that for $4.99 you get 9 platinum. 9.... it was 7 but since its on a sale its 9. 1 short of being a town. Very irritating. So the next pack up from that is $9.99. I'm not paying $10 to have my own town in a free to play game that the town will be server specific to.

Then you can upgrade your town. Great! If you want to lose even more money. So the biggest platinum/gold pack gives you 350 Platinum. It will set you back $200. To have the biggest size possible town, it would cost you at least $700.00 US currency (over 1100 platinum total). Granted that will be a huge town, but I could do a lot of things with $700 that doesn't include playing this game. I could go play minecraft and build it all in 3D for ~$25?

This is not really an mmo. You hardly even run into people unless you look for them. You level up a whole 5 times in this game. 5 TIMES! What is even the point? I thought about gold farming on mobs a bit, BUT WHAT IS THE POINT? People in their towns put down reward boxes that are either right next to their warp, or through some really bad maze. If you tell the quest zombie you didn't like the quest you were sent on, he tosses it back in the rotation. I kept getting 3 of the same quests over and over that could not be done because the developer saw their quest and closed it off.

If you want a better 2D slayer game, go play REALM OF THE MAD GOD. If you want a better building block game, go play MINECRAFT. You will have more fun in either of those 2 games than you will in this one. Guarantee it. This game could be something decent if the guy gets up off his ass and adds content to it. More blocks, levels, mobs, weapons, everything. Also he needs to cheapen his price on his premium currency, or find a way for players to get it in game, even if that would mean converting your gold at like 2000 for 1 platinum. That would keep more people playing. It would have people being proud that they earned their city rather than saying "hey dev, here's 10 bucks gimme a city"

Overall this game is a 2/10

If dev decides to stop being a lazy dick trying to rake in money for this crap he could turn this game into an 5/10.

He would need more prebuilt cities in the game servers with their own npc's and prebuilt quests that actually make you do things and then he could hit 7/10

Add armor, vehicles, maps, zoom functionality, magic, actual things mmos need and you could hit 8/10

But until then, this will remain a 2/10. GG Dev, NO RE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062449987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1422408616}
review:
DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME, END OF STORY!

The GUI and interface are clunky and underdeveloped, the sprites are the equivalent of an 8th grader's work, the jokes and dialogue are both terrible, the gameplay was so bland, dull, and lifeless that I couldn't even tell if I had died or not. There is still a sizeable lag factor in the game for whatever reason (I say this because it obviously takes nothing to run the game).

Pros:
-None that I can think of

Cons:
-Bad graphics and sprite design
-Terrible level design
-Terrible GUI, interface, and control design
-Very poor dialogue and humor accompanied by no plot/questline
-Yet another excuse to try and milk some form of money out of you, as it takes forever to get the money needed to build a dungeon otherwise.

SUMMARY:
Waste of time, and there are virtually no redeeming qualities of any kind for this game.
For once, 0/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051310184', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 70645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38206, 'last_played': 1465638507}
review:
This is definitely a special game to me, in that it's been built from the ground up by 1 developer who clearly has a lot of his heart and passion poured into this game.

Now as a gamer in 8 bit mmo I would simply describe it as a Social and/or Creative game, in that the better your creative and social skills, the more you'll get back from playing this game.

Many players trend towards laziness and wont pay attention to the tutorials and faq, or swear and get banned quickly, or try to get into marketing which this game WASNT built for but their overriding greedy tendencies don't care!
But ultimately they wont really enjoy this game for what it's really all about, be social! Make friends! Build a community. Or just build beautiful things, build upon ideas or concepts, explore your imagination!

Bottom line is
If you have no social grace, nor any imagination. Don't touch this game!
I'll continue to support this game as I see a lot of potential for it in the near future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036433096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1426232743}
review:
After playing for a few day, I feel like I can give an honest review.

Hours 1-3: Learning the game and how to build. Ran the beginning dungeons to get XP to build more. So far, enjoying the game.

Hours 4-14: Running dungeons are pretty stupid. All of them are player made and all look the same. Learned the best way to make a town is to grind gold in a very Destiny "Loot Cave" method. Basically just click a wall thousands and thousands of time to loot gold. Game itself has become boring, but kept playing to unlock more items and finish my town.

Hours 15-16: Finished my town {which is the only enjoyment I really got out of this game}. Decided to explore neighboring towns to only find a wasteland of unfinished and random buildings. Its like an entire world of builders just vanished from a plague... of bordom. At this point, I feel like I wasted hours playing this game... Should have played MineCraft...

For a game that has been out for a year. This game is VERY lacking. Its supposed to be an MMO, but with a level cap of 5, that doesnt allow much progress besides building a town with very little crafting matierals. If this game had more pieces to build with and better dungeons, this game would be a lot better. DEVS need to go into the world and start deleted abandoned creations, because at this point, its just random crap everywhere and doesnt feel like a player created world...

This game has potential and there seems to be a few people who love this game... I, just like so many others, find this game to be very boring and a poor sandbox builder...

Would i recommend? Maybe... Some people really love it, but as a whole, this game sucks. If they added more content and the players actually made dungeons worth playing, I would give a higher score. 

4/10

review:
what people have to understand is that this mmo was created to be simply, to act as a blank canvas for people to do whatever they wanted in a large, persistent, multiplayer world, and in that respect, despite the little this game does, it does quite well, and i can say that i enjoyed my little tad of time i spent playing it

i encourage the developer to keep adding more to this game he has, more content, make it look like less of a broken flash game in terms of its art style, and generally add more structure to the game as a whole, and with time this game could grow into something great =D

author: {'steamid': '76561198091145436', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1422910072}
review:
Let me tell you somthing about this game:
It is a fun game. I haven't played it for a while (actually I downloaded it today)
I think this game has the potential to be somthing like Terraria or Minecraft but as an MMO 
BUT it does not welcome new players. As a guy who just came into the game I was stunned.
It was so beautiful. Realy reminding me of older games which I love!
But as soon as I went into the Teleporters just to fight the lvl 3 "Hipsters".
The game started lagging like I WAS playing it on a toaster (look at System Requirements to understand the joke).
I could barley move I died every 3 seconds because I wasn't able to move with more then around 3FPS.
Which is crazy. And no my computer ain't that bad so its not "my computers fault" I mean for christ sakes.
I run games 100 times more difficult then this with NO problem whatsoever.
So the only problem I have against this game as of now is its MASSIVE lag!
Other then that it's a pretty fun game. I like the costumeztion and how you can build your own little place.
It's got a great potential but please for the love of god. Fix the lagg mate!
I recommend it i mean it's free and takes 3sec to install/uninstall. Just try it

author: {'steamid': '76561198104076481', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1422817008}
review: It's a good concept, just poorly executed. Though I do love the player created world, I also hate it. Neary everything is claimed, gold income is decent, but the gold/platinum system just kills it for me. If you made it easier to get platinum or everything costed gold, I'd say thats perfect, but back to the world. After taking the random teleport (which by the way only seems to have about a 100x100 tp range) you have to walk for about ten minutes to get to the wilderness where you can build. The world is laggy af in dungeons and the hp scaling on level up is so tiny and leveling up takes so long that you'd be lucky to pass level 3 without any deaths to your name. Vanity items are way too expensive as seen in most games. The buildings in the world are atrocious but that doesn't affect my opinion as those are player made. Honestly, I think it'd be MUCH better if you hade official in game cities with paths between them where you could go off and build from, and make a random warp that puts you not right in someone elses building area. All in all, I'd give this game a 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198151544731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1422755586}
review:
Honestly it was pretty bad, for the tutorial there is way too many instructions, and they dont really tell you anything about building, and they say the game is free when really they're trying to make you buy all the other stuff. Also I got bored in about 5 minutes of playing, and I only downloaded it because I wanted to see the game myself instead of reading the reviews about it, but now I understand why people thought this was terrible!

I would rate this game as: A even more crappier version of roblox only more expensive! 0.5/10                                                   I would say 0/10 but I'm not that harsh

author: {'steamid': '76561198005194820', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1422621868}
review: I was wondering why the levels were a confusing mess that made no logical sense, then realized it's all user generated. It's a cool idea but doesn't ultimately work. If the idea of an "8-bit MMO" intrigued you, then NEStalgia is the game you want. It's basically Dragon Warrior Online and is actually well thought-out and fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173104653', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1423313365}
review:
自己是没过四级的英语水平，目前一路凭着少得可怜的词汇量跟着感觉外带查单词玩到3级，感觉是一个很有意思的八位网游
个人认为8位游戏最大的好处就是制作者不需要将太多的精力花在画面上，从而可以更加专心的关注游戏内容
游戏的商店就在菜单里，有充值系统，美刀直接买游戏币(gold)
有给一片地方可以用来自己建造建筑这样的设定，有一条任务线会让你不停的建造东西，购买建造材料需要g，如果你懒得刷怪，那就只能去充值了，不过说句不厚道的话，不充值的情况下玩玩就行了，充值的话有点不合适
[b]画面党慎入，这是8位游戏，抱着试一试的心态进来让晃瞎了就得不偿失了[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198148621526', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1410812949}
