review:
Игра довольно проста поначалу, имеется даже немного юмора (если читать то, что пишут в диалогах). Но без гида для новичков далеко в ней уйти сложно.
К минусам я могу отнести очень медленную отрисовку "теней" и возможность строить дома только в тех местах, где ты каким-то образом договорился о получении места.
Я пока только начал играть, серьезных проблем и недостатков не заметил.

review:
So some good humour, solid tutorial, good concept. But I can't get past how hard it is to see what's going on as they've taken retro visuals a step too far back.
If they tweak the look one notch up I'll return to give it more time.
But hey it's free and it only took me an hour or less to learn basics and decide if I wanted to see more, so no harm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076371384', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1422636831}
review:
Really cool game with classic rogue-like style, and obviously stunning 8bit mechanics!

Pros:
1. Addictive
2. Free
3. Great economy system (Farm for money all day!)
4. Great leveling system
5. Better than Call of Duty

Cons:
1. Addictive
2. Has more improvements to be done/added (I'm aware it's still in development)

I got some ideas like more mobs, levels, and maybe something like party quests?

author: {'steamid': '76561198059581838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1422496137}
review: Sometimes I vomit uncontrollably, spewing half digested supplements upon all that which stand in my immediate vicinity. Trying desperately to hold in my chunks, my eyes would bulge and the veins would pop, making my vision blurry and red, and as my vision begins to wane I try to let go and let myself vomit, but of course it's too late to stop my eyes from bleeding, and I would get a sharp pain in the side of my head. I often would black out and come to in a puddle of my own blood, mucus, stomache acid, clutching my belly, and tears streaking down my cheeks. These occurrences are quite a kin to playing 8BitMMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097395787', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1422751512}
review: I played this, I tried to make my own pokemon center only to find that the possible items are like.. 10 all in all. If you're going to make an 8bit game then for heaven's sake make 100 at least items or make a creator and let the users in a workshop do your dirty work. The weapons are also 8 or something (including a sword, a blue sword, a red sword... (not kidding)). Again if you're going to make an 8bit game put spells and stuff or at least an axe and a spear or a bow. Placing gray boxes with a roof cannot keep you playing even if you do it with friends. This game has the same effort put into it as a school project or a hobby you're not that much into...

author: {'steamid': '76561198081478544', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1425411903}

review:
Złe recenzje zawsze ciężko się pisze, ale cóż trzeba to zrobić. 8BitMMO to gra słabiutka, koncepcja gry sama w sobie jest dobra - stworzyć grę w podobnie tibia, diablo, Dragon Ball (z GBA) w klimacie 8bitow. Niestety nic dobrego z tego nie wyszło, jedynym plusem jest możliwość gry z innymi ale to za mało aby gra zachwyciła świeżością.

Jeżeli nie ciśnie was by to sprawdzić to polecam ominiecie tego tytułu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132258232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1462212354}
review:
I recommend this game because of the brilliant 2D graphics and also the game design. There's only one problem: You need to add more servers! But apart from the lack of servers, I would still recommend this game because when you first get in, the tutorials aren't that bothering but they're very simple! 

If you love big open sandbox games, then get the free version of this game! Whats even better is that you don't have to pay for 8BITMMO like any other game on Steam, it's just a free world for you to do whatever you wish! Now not only saying that, no games aren't without it's bugs. The only bug I've found so far in this game, is when I move and I get stuck into a floor for some reason!

I know I seem a bit of a fusser, but really: this game is recommended for people who like Garry's Mod or all of them genres of games. So, if you're looking for a really good sandbox but can't find any free ones, download this and you'll probably enjoy it! Now, if you're a bit of a fusspot and games need to be absolutely perfect with no messed up bits, then I wouldn't download it (yet!). Since this game has only entered the Game Development Update stage, players will kind've see missing parts/blocks or bits that should've appeared but didn't! But probably in the future when this game is fully gotten developed, none of that should happen and you should enjoy it more and not see missing parts/blocks or bits that should've appeared but haven't!

Peace Out- Balloon Boy (Youtube Name: Nath Brown)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069098054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1422409889}
review:
I simply wanted to say this is neither 8-bit nor MMO, and a pathetic excuse of a game, but it seems like a lot of people invested significant amount of time to build and play this game, so I must add some thoughts.

I guess its selling point is 100% player built world, which explains why everything looks messy, half-baked and crummy. Remember seeing similar phenomenon in MC freebuild servers. Very few builder-type core players may create something that's actually worth looking at, but majority of builders aren't so talented or got better things to do that the landscape ends up being filled with featureless assortment of random ugly structures. The problem is exacerbated by the fact that builders often end up losing interest rather quickly and abandon their pet project to go somewhere else and start anew, leaving behind ugly husks of their former obsessions which only serves as roadblocks to newcomers trying to explore the world. And I mean UGLY. Can't even tore them down and they're littered with spikes which results in instant death for your newly created character. Really hope there were options for these abandoned structures to self-destruct and morph into forest or something.

I've no idea how some reviewers say "tutorials were fun as hell", but I dunno, different taste I guess. Starter dungeon is a joke. Rectangular cage with mobs that spawn all over the place and they won't even fight back properly. Having said that, fighting is a joke. Lag is crazy and you only have one weapon to "fight" moving around in 2D plain; go figure. NPC interaction is a joke. No storyline, no dialogue, no interaction worth caring. Had you ever played any other modern MMOs you'll know beyond doubt this "game" calling itself MMO is a joke. Quests are irrelevant, NPC jokes are equally terrible and quite frankly feels like the writers are insulting you for wasting your time playing this game. This game would've been good in the last century, but the year is 2015 and it is clearly out of time.

Music is pretty good though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069956938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1422708606}

author: {'steamid': '76561198099927147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1424202777}
review:
Das Spiel macht echt Laune!

Das Spielprinzip ist ähnlich wie dem von Minecraft. Man kann aus diversen Blöcken bauen was man möchte. Es gibt schöne Gegenstände (könnte aber gerne auch mehr sein), um sein Haus oder andere Sachen schöner gestalten zu können.

Zusätzlich gibt es die Möglichkeit, zu farmen, um auf diese Weise einfach an Geld heranzukommen. Das oft angesprochene Pay-2-Win Prinzip kann ich nicht bestätigen. Alles wichtige bekommt man auch so - und falls nicht, gibt es genügend Spieler, die Premium-Items gegen Gold tauschen.

Außerdem gibt es unzählige Spielerquest, die Abwechslung und neuen Spielspaß bringen und teilweise echt herausfordernd und gut gemacht sind.

Ich bin echt positiv überzeugt von dem Spiel und kann die schlechten Reviews in keinster Weise nachvollziehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977250415', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1422354044}
review:
Also ich bin ja so ein Mensch der sich erst sein Urteil über Spiele bildet, wenn er sie erst ausprobiert hat. Ich hatte vorher schon ein schlechtes Gefühl bei 8BitMMO und habe es jetzt nach dem Spielen definitiv bestätigt bekommen. Mir gefällt das Spiel gar nicht. Es fängt schon an, dass die Server ziemlich laggen. Dann ist die deutsche Übersetzung für meinen Geschmack ziemlich für den A...llerwertesten. Das übersetze ich sogar besser. 
Dann, wenn man unter sichtbehindernden Objekten wie Decken etc. durch geht verschwinden sie und erscheinen wieder. Wenn sowas mehrfach hintereinander kommt, dann dauert's nicht mehr lange und dann kriegt man noch Epilepsie. Um aber noch eine kleine gute Sache zu sagen: Die Grundidee war wenigstens schonmal gut... was Minecraft, Terraria und viele andere Spiele auch schon hatten. Also ich würde das Spiel nicht weiter empfehlen.

review:
Ok I honestly love this game, I love the ranking system, currency, and customization options. I got this game a while back from RobbyZ when it was in closed beta, I was the first of my friends to recieve the game and I actully got to talk to RobbyZ on Twitter when the beta was first released. Its definitelya good game to play if your into older games and MMO'S.
One thing I suggest working on in this game is optimization, I can run DayZ at 30 FPS but this games gives me INSANE mouse lag and frame drops in 1920x1080. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198108124614', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1443978346}
review:
Great game!
You propably WILL get bored after few hours... but thats my opinion.
Really cool feature is bulilding your constructions like houses (dungeons are too big to be placed on a normal map) anywhere outside the cities!
Building in this game is the main point and so, the best feature!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129951766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 128254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39647, 'last_played': 1511504343}
review:
8bitmmo is a top down sandbox game with fixed world vision. It has a moderately sized group of core players that keep things steady. There are quests, buildings, artwork, and more. The PVP has been kicked up a notch with the addition of Transponder battles. With many possibilities I suggest you give the game a try.

The premium currency items can generally be traded for from other players, so don't be discouraged. Even if you don't want to pay for plat you can still enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021074343', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1420126602}
review:
At least it's trying, but still feels repetitive. The humour feels forced, the false low self esteem trope has beed milked more than your mothers breasts and using LEL FUNNEH INNERNET MAYMAYS as a selling point is asking for trouble.

Enough of the outgoing selling, but what about the game?:
Nice ideas but not all that original, I found problems with the way the game likes to replicate the feeling of dungeons; The way it draws roofs over areas to engage an idea of mystery but when you get close the roofs disappear, this would 5 times out of 10 halt rendering the other sprites, like the enemies.

The art style of the game is generic as all hell. Game devs: please don't be as lazy because of "nostalgia".

Overall, not original and forced humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136326942', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1419345568}
review:
When I clicked that install button, I wasn't aware of how BAD this game is. I knew it was on the last page of the free-to-play adventure-RPG's, but I didn't think it would be that bad. Now that I'm talking about it, where IS the adventure? I've played this game for 20 minutes and no adventure at all, no storyline, no nothing. Isn't that the point of adventure RPG's? 

In my opinion the introduction fails a lot. It should introduce you into the game; who are you playing as? What is your main objective? Instead you start off at a poorly decorated login screen. I could make that with Microsoft Word. after you log in and select a server, you will be taken to another window. And then it all begins. You are randomly dropped in some guys house. Oh and what I forgot to mention: the lack of humor. It's like the game is trying to be funny, but it isn't; "An epic adventure to the kitchen" 

After the opening you get to some kind of selection room. You can choose between a zombie and a dragon: a fighter and a builder. I chose the dragon, because if I think about dragons I think about combat and not about building. I only did the quest with the dragon, because I simply got bored. There is one thing that I sure don't like: the shop. Okay, this is an RPG, I like the fact that you can always buy swords 'n stuff, but blocks?! Shouldn't those things be collected in the overworld instead of some kind of boring window which says "shop"?

Anyways, this was my opinion about this game. 3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113099045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1418574881}
review:
i would choose spartans vs zombies over this

basically you are a little pixel guy in a big, creative world. except you are not in an actual game, it feels like a poorly made minecraft server with half-a-billion plugins all mashed into one horrid mess. random spam everywhere, trying to build 3d houses and dungeons in a 2d landscape is impossibe. if you want to build you have to buy EACH. BLOCK. INDIVIDUALY. this can make the costs go through the roof, if you don't like that, don't worry, you can just spend $10 on microtransactions :D. dungeons are a joke, barren and boring, the monsters are practically hittable blocks. all user created missions are complete crap, and there is lag everywhere. it might be good if you can tolerate its massive amount of problems, maybe then it might be worth a play.

3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060359009', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1448140132}
review:
Ich verstehe nicht so wirklich, warum dieses Spiel so viel Hate bekommt. Leute beschweren sich über verstecktes Bezahlen an allen Ecken - ganz ehrlich, davon habe ich noch nicht viel bemerkt.

Im Übrigen: Dieses Spiel ist zu 100% Sandbox. Die Quests sind fast alle von anderen Spielern erstellt, ebenso die Strukturen.  Farming ist klar Teil des Spiels, dafür gbt es aber extra - ebenfalls von Spielern angefertigte - Farmen. Sobald man das Gold gesammelt hat, macht man sich frisch ans Werk und baut seine Häuser auf. Man kann das Prinzip vielleicht mit "abgespecktes 2D-Minecraft MMO" kurzfassen, aber das klingt abwertender als es sollte.

Es ist ein free2play Titel, also probiert ihn einfach aus, bevor Ihr euch ein Urteil bildet - und mit "ausprobieren" meine ich schon 1-2 h. Wenn ich hier wieder Leute sehe, die es sich mit nur 10 min Spielzeit erlauben ein Urteil zu fällen möchte ich sie schlicht und ergreifend erwürgen.
Abschließend bleibt noch anzumerken, dass wer in einem EARLY ACCESS-Spiel das, verdammt noch einmal, FREE TO PLAY ist, Geld ausgibt, selber schuld ist. Und nun: Viel Spaß!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981583813', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1417673681}
review:
Its ok at first, but honestly at this point in time it is not fun to play ( at least for me). The combat is ok but buggy and unfun.  Overhead tiles make it hard to do combat if theres an enemy near you because you cannot see the enemy to hit them (they do have a name that shows up but thats not that helpful). 

Building is ok.... Its certainly not on par to MC, or even terraria.... 


In short, I probably would love/devote hours to this game..... If it was made 10 years ago, but as it stands now I have played games that have the same elements as this but have done it better. Even the old "make your mmo" software that use to exist in the mid 2000s was alot more fun for building than this.

I can't speak about the community of this game because when it comes to mmos I am a lurker.

This game has potential, and I hope it grows to become better than it is now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067460853', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1404097260}
review:
This is a decent community oriented game.

Basically paying members can get various perks, including home stones to set permissions on a small homestead in the general play area (rather than their private area) town stones that let them set permissions on an area and form a village or city as well as quest stones that let them set up quests for other players.

This provides a nice active community where both paying and non-paying members.  It's pretty nice.

It's clearly not for everyone.  The graphics are rudimentary but functional, and the gameplay is quite simplistic.  Still, there is a certain community cohesion and simplicity that will appeal to other players.

This is clearly a nitch game, but if it's your nitch you will certainly enjoy it.  Your best bet is to try it for free, and see if you like it.   Worst case you lose the few hours you spent learning the game mechanics, and even then observant players who don't like the game will gain insite into the nitch title which may help them understand certain general game and community mechanics that were done right in this game, as well as where the title is lacking which makes it only appeal to a nitch group.

Oh yeah, and there's some achievements for you achievement whores out there. :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198114646078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1416967769}
review:
It's not smart to let players build your whole world because then you'll end up with a world map as ludicrous as this one with random bed and houses made of foot high concrete steps. It's not great to have your roads speed up your avatar so much that you shoot down the street like a bullet, past whatever you were trying to get to. It's not fun to have enemies respawn instantly behind you and doggie pile your guy, who then dies with no animation or sound and then appears on a warp pad or maybe at your base, it seems to change and I couldn't figure it out. The text box is small, messages disappear too fast, reading signs or fighting enemies fills up your chat and makes it hard to follow conversations and if the community is going to enforce no swearing the game should just have a profanity filter.

Cute idea that was charming at first, but it's missing too much to be fun, barely playable.

review:
The intro, asthetics, and mechanics of the game just didn't appeal to me. This game has some niche appeal I can see, but as a pixel fan this wasn't for me. If you want a game that combines a slower version of God of the Mad Realm and the 2d version of Minecraft, then maybe, this game is for you.

I did not spend much time with it. Perhaps the game requires more timeinvestment to be fun, but I definately did not experience fun in the introduction of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123573663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1415997722}
review:
Ok, 'Imma be honest.
This Game is not good and not bad.
It was boring for me after 100 minutes.
It's as monotone as this review.
After a Tutorial that is kinda funny you have the choice between building quests and dungeon quests,
I took building and I must admit it has it's very own charme, but it's very complicated and definetly not motivating.
(I tried not to spoil)
The Dungeon type of Quest was the last piece of shit, I usually do't swear, but it made me do it.
The Dungeons are overloaded and very laggy.  One moment you are at full health and the next you're dead, without even seing your enemy. 
I didn't try pvp yet and I don't think I will.
The music is cool in the beginning, but after 10 mins you get annoyed and turn it off ( at least I did)

So to put it in a nutshell:   3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142632885', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1404049112}
review:
[h1]Hmm...[/h1]
The concept is good, but there are some things I don't like. First and foremost, there are [b]way[/b] too many [b]microtransactions[/b] (AKA in-app purchases). To build something, you need to buy [b]every single block[/b] with coins. To gather enough of them, you have two options; either keep playing and get them (which takes [b]forever[/b]) or buy them with real money. So, by that aspect, you may feel kinda [b]scammed[/b], like I did.

Regarding the [b]gameplay[/b], it is really [b]difficult to build[/b]. You'll have a hard time trying to place a block over another. Try it for your own, you'll see. Sometimes, [b]the block hiding system doesn't work[/b], thus making it [b]impossible[/b] to play inside a room.

But [u]wait[/u], there are [b]positives[/b]; as I mentioned beforehand, I liked the concept, even though it's not new. There is also a [b]fully functional anti-grief system[/b], which I admire, as there is no such thing in [b]Minecraft[/b] or [b]Terraria[/b] (yet).

author: {'steamid': '76561198065370379', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1413326850}
review: No. Just. No. This game may only be in beta, but it's so bad I almost cried at how bad it is. The mechanics are bad, the tutorials take forever, the quests drag on, and have no point, and they have player-made quests meant only so you'll see their crappy towns and buy a spot in it. It's nothing but a poor way for the devs to make a quick buck, while shitting all over the players. Not only is all of the above true, but you won't find anyone on here that's friendly, helpful, or interesting. Everyone just argues about stupid crap, and tries to get you to buy shit from them. It tries so hard to be funny, and their attempts are definately in vain. They make jokes that stopped being funny about five years ago. They basically downplay RPG's of all sorts with the guide's personality being so poor, and this also proves to be a poor strategy, as the game is an RPG. -30/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198132465615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1573465393}
review: For no cost it is a fine game indeed and you can build anything you want and glorify it with enough time spent. However the enemies do tend to get a bit repetitive but still challenging in a way, I enjoy it very much but its really up to you about how you feel about it when it comes to what your looking for in gameplay. If you want a casual building game with some fighting but not quite minecraft than this may be for you! If your looking for a action packed battle game with flaming demonic wolves than i suggest you keep searching. This may be a short review but it is what i think of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139244422', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1499379184}
review:
Игра так себе. На 7/10. Ясно, что графика 8бит, но блииин, неужели так трудно нормально нарисовать спрайты?! Это твари, а не человечки. Идея на высшем уровне. Все постройки строят люди, то есть, выходит что делают целый мир, и это не какой-то маинкруфт, где вы скажете, "там тожи строить можна!!11!", нет. Тут реально целый город. Даже карту мира в ГуглМапс можно посмотреть! Неужели не круто? Что плохого, так это... НИЧЕГО НЕ ПОНЯТНО!!! Я довольно хорошо знаю английский, но квесты... Это не квесты. Это.. Даже как назвать не знаю. Все перечислять глупо, игра в раннем доступе, а доната там, как в готовой игре, где все нормально работает. Игра на пару часиков. Когда нечего делать, и остальные игры надоели. 
Реализацию бы лучше, и вообще, перчик

author: {'steamid': '76561198143943743', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1546966899}
review: Eu achei legalzinho até, para o estilo. Se você está procurando por um joguinho simples, que faça referencia a um daqueles antigos. MEU PEIXE, VOCÊ ACHOU O JOGO CERTO. Agora se você ta procurando por aventuras, sangue, ou altas tetas balangando na tela. Pode trocar de jogo. 8BitMMO é um jogo perfeito para quem tem um PC não muito bom e quer fazer alguma coisa diferente, como construir e se lembrar dos tempos em que era um menininho jogando aqueles joguinhos de Gameboy. EU ACHEI O JOGO UMA SACADA MUITO MASSA DOS CRIADORES. Você e Players construindo uma cidade e ganhando dinheiro e sendo feliz, vivendo sua vida online. Resumindo. MUUUUUUUUITO LEGAAAAAAAALLLLLLLL

author: {'steamid': '76561198010524245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1387671803}
review:
It's what it feels like.

A quick cheap unoriginal cash in using 8-bit and retro as the lure in it's pay to win gameplay.  Unbalenced, tons of EXP farms, playing this makes anything you play next seem truely original in comparison (Except Unturned, that's just as bad as this.).

You are better off using Microsoft Paint instead of this abomination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055514796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1387825956}
review:
Avoid this game like the plague. To really play this game and "enjoy" (I say that in quotes because there is nothing to enjoy) One must pay money to get platinum which is everything. The way this game is set up is a bit strange and can be confusing at first, I do say this game has potential, but the developers need to stop banning people for saying small things like "This game is boring" "I dont enjoy this game" And on the forums when one lists bugs and ideas to fix those, you are banned for trying to help them improve their game. Dont play this game until it's developers mature to a point where the game is playable.

2/10 +2 Because of the wizard hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120332110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1413061068}
review: Juegazo sin duda para los amantes de los 8BITS les causara muucha nostalgia (9/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030571327', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 127060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71441, 'last_played': 1643174112}
review:
8bitmmo... you apear in the house of some npc named robbyz where after killing some lobbyist slugs.. you are projected into a red room... Hmm.. there are npcs here.... QUESTS! BUILDING! FARMING GOLD AND BEING RICH!!! Then you continue to play this game, because it is beautiful. Seriously. 

Possibly the best part about this game though, is the fact that there is lots of communication with the developer, and this game is ALWAYS being updated. I doubt you will find a better indie game that has only ONE developer.

And to anyone who said the graphics are bad, because they are 8bit. You are really, really, REALLY dumb. This game is supposed to have that retro 8bit look. And you can play the game easily without making any microtransactions. You can get any item (except clothes) from other players without spending much time to get the gold.

Chances are, most reviews are from this game in it's older stages. This game has progressed significantly more than most indie games ever do... and it only has one developer...

9.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081412864', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1412037118}
review: By Now, I have played 8 hours of this game, on a very low-end laptop, there are a lot of things wrong with it, many have established this, but I feel it can become much better in the future, though at it's current state it is very horrible, platinum is needed for a lot of items that you need/want and most of the items cost 10+ platinum (btw 7 platinum = $5!) Literately your only other resort is to hope and pray someone will give you a platinum item for being such a good friend or farming Mobs for a week straight, drink all the coffee in your house, sit up all day and all night so you won't be banned, and sell that 150K+ gold for idk 15+ platinum? (I don't envy the trade system nor do I want to see it) This game has the, let me rephrase that, THIS GAME 'HAD' THE POTENTIAL TO DO GOOD! This was made in 13 YEARS! I mean CMON, I don't even touch SPIKES, I DIE!, I can't scoot OVER FAR ENOUGH ONTO A BLOCK TO GET PAST THE SPIKES, THIS GAME IS A DEATHTRAP OF RAGE! Literately, I Don't even Rage at games, and this one throws me off my record for "Person that Rages the Least Award" I mean cmon bro, Step up your game, add more platinum to the money packages and lastly, put in more optimizations as well as, SELECTIVE QUESTING, I don't like being repettitively asked to do the same quest over and over when I CANT do it because there are SPIKES, LASERS, AND GAME REVIEWERS EVERYWHERE. Sorry, Getting a little out of hand, I do not recommend this game, but if you want to play it, idc, I may continue playing it just because I don't care.

review: WOW this is a sorry excuse for a game that is clearly trying to milk the "sandbox"and "MMO" stamp.. It is so basic, and they claim that is because they wanted to make it "retro" BUT that has become a lazy excuse now so devs can make a crappy looking game and hiding behind "retro" it is an abysmal cash grab game. It has no place on steam really. So what can you do: you can move with WASD and hit with space that is it, everything cost so much so they hope you spend real money to buy credits to buy blocks and Shit... And they write you can become 3 races, there is nothing to them and one of them is you turn into a potato untill you die, and you can't attack while you are this 3 pixel potato. There is no customization or anything like you would hope there is in an MMO. It is SO bad Don't give them the pleasure of dragging you through this mess. AVIOD AVOID AVOID!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198139877102', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1409609726}
review:
This whole game's one of the clunkiest I've played in a while, and not even the funny kind. Just straight up frustrating.

The construction is unwieldy as all heck. First, you have to buy all materials from the shop (I'll get to the cost later). Then it becomes a fight with the camera angle to even build a decent house with a roof. Let me tell you, a "slightly" top down view is NOT a good angle for anything construction related. There are even cases where the walls completely block certain tiles, not only making it feel like you're building blindfolded, but also forcing you to deconstruct everything just to build whatever it was the walls were blocking.

The combat... Oh the combat. Unless you're ranged, it's almost impossible to battle without getting hit. Normally this would be fine, damage is inevitable, but considering how few hitpoints you get, the damage adds up. Ultimately, you'll be finding yourself dying and going back to the beginning of the world. Even as ranged, there's also the case of extreme respawn times, so be prepared to get shell-shocked.

Speaking of worlds, quests are pretty much your only option to even hope of getting decent money and EXP. It takes an EXTREME amount of gold to get enough to build anything past a small house. So unless you like running at cheap enemies, you'll have to do quests. Again, this would normally be fine, but after the initial quests, every quest you get is randomized, and I mean RANDOMIZED. It takes no account what level you are or anything. With some quests taking place in worlds locked behind level requirements, this is a major problem. This is countered with the ability to talk to the quest giver for a different quest, but the number of awful quests to cycle through is astounding. From continuous pixel-perfect gauntlets given to beginners, to ultra vague scavenger hunts, it's like there was no effort put into filtering the good, the bad, and the ugly.

Finally, the cost. Like I said before, every block in the game costs coins, heck, even entering certain doors cost coins. I'm talking about an extravigant number of coins. With the small, convoluted shop menu, it's almost impossible to find what exactly you want. Pair that with the cost of everything, good luck trying to build something actually worth looking at. They're practically making you pay to get anything good, and even good's a strong word.

This game has no soul. It feels like something thrown together and then presented as an enchanting ground breaking indie game. It doesn't even try to hide the amount of cynicism it throws at you. Even what few NPCs are shown are extremely cynical. Jokes are fine, but having sarcastic remarks the only things NPCs say to you in an already soulless husk of a game just spits in your face. I'm sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145911765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1419046096}
review:
It seems fun at first, but then you run into problems where its hard to see where some of the things are. I like the idea of player made quests, but the way they are set up, it is impossible to see where certain things are. The player made quests are impossible to do because there are so many blocks spamed in places. Its just too hard to do.

Another problem is, you have to pay REAL money to make a town. This is one of my problems. The owners of the like 5 towns arn't on a whole lot, so it is hard to get in a town. So if I want a town that I am sure will be what I like, I would want to make my own, but If I have to pay REAL money to make one, it makes the experience worse.

Things that would make the game more enjoyable:
1. Improve the way things can be seen.
2. Make the map a live map so you can see what is going on
3. Have towns be bought with in game money.

Other than that, this game does have great potential, but I think I needs a lot of work.

review: Not bad considering that it's so simple, but it's not just simple in graphics terms, there's also just not much there yet content-wise. Right now this is basicaly 2.5D Minecraft without any ability to mine or otherwise gather resources. (Everything has to be bought wth coins gained from killing monsters or purchasing with real money.) Honestly I think I'd rather just play Minecraft. This game really needs more to differentiate itself, like if players coud script things in-game or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070314837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1406765081}
review:
Эта игра не только крайне скучная, она еще и до ужаса однообразная и неиграбельная. Деньги можно добыть либо донатом, либо проводя по часу на "фермах", нажимая одну и ту же кнопку non stop. Особый ракурс камеры ломает мозг: не понятно, где наш этаж, где яма, а где ступенька. Врагов мало, модификаций, шмота и оружия - тоже. Лут отсутствует. 
Тратить время на эту херь - самый изощренно-тупой способ потратить время ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149825071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1409706394}
review:
WOW MY FIRST REVIEW!!! Anyways...8BITMMO is a fun little game that will pretty much run on any computer, it has many features such as:

Building: you can make anything you can imagine using blocks!

Combat: There's swords, guns, Hammers to beat peoples faces in! it's so cool it could be Spacebar Simulator 2014!

Customize: You can Customize your character with clothes, Hats, or you can become a potato if that's your sorta thing!

Packed with content: There's alot to do in the game! you can PvP, do quest made by other people, or even become a zombie and infect people!

There's many more features to this game! but I suggest checking it out right now! YES, RIGHT NOW!!! so what are you waiting for? download it now!

In game User: Sparkystream.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997660517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1403192092}
review:
To make things simple, let's put it like this: this game is trying to be something it's not. 

There's elements of player-built world- except the the whole mess is terrible confusing in 2D.
There are complicated society elements like towns and such- except they cost too much for something that is almost useless and challenging in this limited 2D world.
There's customization-but everyone still looks almost the same.
There's quests to get gold- yet as they're player-created most of them are unplayable.

If you wanna play a free-to-play mmo, look elsewhere, because no one should lower down to this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051595315', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1399819198}
review:
Bad game.
Tutorial is very long winded and boring, i never finished it as it was tedious.
It's needed, however, as the construction is crappy and overly complicated. Once you're done you can hardly build anything, because you get next to no money and blocks cost alot.
I didn't even bother with the zombie mode. It is completely unoriginal, and the weapons you get are badly programmed.
Retro style games are getting out of hand. I would like a game that looks like a ps1 or ps2 game over an overly 8 bit game

author: {'steamid': '76561198081383533', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1409318157}
review:
занятная убивалка времени, не более того.  поиграв почти полтора часа, выбив часть ачивок, стало скучно.  
фактически игра донельзя напоминает minecraft с прикрученными квестами в 8 битах. для комфортного понимания что вообще происходит необходимо минимальное знание английского. 
но для бесплатной игры вполне сойдет. даже с учетом того, что игра фриплейная, донатить за голду, шапки и тому подобное нет смысла. те же 6 и 12 баксов можно потратить на другие игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108040263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1409513864}
review:
I jumped in thinking this would be a lighthearted romp through an 8-Bit world. Oh, how I was wrong. The traps in this game are painfully annoying, the enemies seem to always get the better hand in the end even if you spam the attack button, the quests (though granted, some are user made) make you want to punch glass just so the pain distracts you and the 'map editing' that I really looked forward to was not only annoying to use but felt like work rather than play. When you hear 'making your own town' and 'RPG' you think 'fun', not 'an slow, mind numbing shamble through dungeons of seemingly uber strength hipsters for a mere pennies for the next five hours before you can even build your house fully'. The only positive wasn't game based but rather the somewhat pleasent band of people who play.

If you're fine with a lot of annoying things, go right ahead, it's free after all. But if you're prone to gritting and grinding your teeth, avoid unless you're fine with dentures... Cos this game will make you grind them down to your jaw bone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134540018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1408424103}

author: {'steamid': '76561198125125323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1408408338}
review:
[h1]Enjoyed it.[/h1]

My experience with 8BitMMO was engaging, and fun. I like how you get to choose from killing Lawyer Cats to Building your home, or both. 

[b]PROS[/b]

[list]
[*] Character Customization
[*] Weapon selection
[*] EXP System
[*] Free to build whatever you desire
[/list]

[b]CONS[/b]

[list]
[*] Easily gets repetitive
[*] Can be confusing at times
[/list]

But despite the little negatives, 8BitMMO is definately a game for creative minds, and is worth a try, especially since it's free. What do you have to lose?

author: {'steamid': '76561198147037803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2021, 'last_played': 1432954959}
review:
So for this being the only thing on steam that my computer can run-- I'd say I have the patience of a shaolin monk. 
Here's why. 
The game, although pixelated and simple is quite rich of things. 
I spent quite a time bored on this game, do to the fact that I didn't have a town or money for that matter.
I played it for a few days straight, desperate to hold on to what little patience I had with this computer. 
Suddenly brought into citizenship, I found a town. The mayor was probably 12 y/o and said "__ okay?" like I was a child that was  pressing the action button to show the next block of text. While in this town I was a "bartender" sitting in an inn while he gained more citizens. After getting bored and going on to another town, I asked this guy --mind you he had the platinum townstone-- if he had a job for me. As my job I made 1k gold a day to donate to town projects. I ended up donating 2k a day out of kindness. I constantly gotten praise for being so nice.
A few days later I started to help other people for no reward-- donating 1k to them. 
I'm bored with the game for now--but I do recommend it to any and everyone. 
If you spend enough time paying attention, you'll learn to gold farm (There's a gold income system, a 45 minute interval) to get anywhere, and also need weapons to get such gold to get such weapons to get such gold to build amazing things.
Confusing?
Try walking up to a hipster with your puny noob sword. You will die.
This isn't minecraft. Or roblox. Or any childish rpg game.
This is 8bitMMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135238009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1407417270}
review:
Note: This is a review for early access game, the review might change from time to time as it is being update.

Well, here I am, played for 17 hours already, but still a thumb down.

I hope there can be more dungeon to explore. The map really looks incomplete (although it is your intention to let the players fill it up, but it seems lack of things to play). Hope to have more place to explore, then I might change my mind. Or maybe let some creative players to have some contribution here. By giving them some free plats, they can eventually make more nice place and quests.

I wasted few hours looking for a town to live and instead I live in someone else's pocket universe. And I do a lot of farming when I am in the game... Until I gave up.

P.s: The thing I like the most is.. Hmmm... The TARDIS I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096285927', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 86540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17247, 'last_played': 1546294373}
review:
Absolutely amazing! I would, and have, recommended this game to others. The community is nice, kind and friendly, and the odd "bad" (inconsiderate?) player is easily dealt with by the multiple game moderators. It's free! Seriously, it's amazing that something this awesome is Free to Play. Some people (I won't lie - me included) don't like the graphics but the Texture Packs made by the community for the community add a really unique feel to the game. Even if a construction looks "bad", most players are considerate and try find as much good points about the build as possible. The developer, Robby Zinchak (Sim9), is really involved with the game and its community, not like some other games (minecraft?). It's a construction sandbox! Personally, I absolutely love construction sandboxes, and one were you can suggest something and it's likely it'll be added? Even better! You can suggest things through either the forums or in the suggestion box and Robby will read it and, possibly, add it in. The moderators are all friendly and I don't have an issue with even 1 of them. You can chat relaxed with the community and it's so laid back it's unbelievable.

I would DEFINITELY recommend this game to as many people as I possibly can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063555404', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1408175313}
review:
8BitMMO is definitely my favorite MMO and one of my favorite games now. Very simple design, but not overly so. The best part isn't the graphics, the theme, or retro-styled soundtrack. It's the total interaction.

You play in a large world will all those who are on and can build, fight, create a town, join a town, explore dungeons, kill Hipsters, do custom player quests, and more. Definitely a great pack. I highly recommend this to anyone who just wants to have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080959391', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1406915754}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069978137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1431026923}
review:
The first few hours of playing I was excited, because I thought that everything I did in the first 5 mins would be just the tip of the iceberg. Sadly, that is it. All of it. The building is buggy and the fighting is too stiff. Nothing you do feels satisfying. There is that excitement of joining a town, contributing to its growth, but it builds up to nothing. 

I like the general idea of it - the players make everything and create their own world with cities and quests, but It just lacks depth. It has the potential to be really fun, though. Just needs more creativity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146724431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1423600736}
review:
Introduction: 8BitMMO will always be a special game to me for a number of reasons; it's the first MMO that i've taken seriously, it's one of the first free-to-play games that I've ever downloaded (with Tank-Tank-Tank! for the Wii U being the first) and finally it is actually my first Steam game. If all of that wasn't enough for me to see the game in a positive light then the huge amount of content, the great community features and the charm that the game hands out frequently would just about do it.

Gameplay: The gameplay is based on three core-styles; building, combat and exploration. I'd say that the building and exploration aspects are far more prominent in the game rather than the combat. The exploration in the game is a little dodgy but that's just dependent on how well you and other users have developed explorable worlds. You explore by visiting other user's built worlds, villages, dungeons... well, what ever they have decided to make to be honest! Your objectives in these areas are to find a reward block after completing challenges set by the creator/user... but how do these challenges work? Well, the user is supposed to put enemies and other hazards in the way of the player and the reward block. An issue with this is that most people just put a bunch of enemies in the way of a bunch of complicated building structures, the question is though, is this the game's fault? Players are given a number of different choices in design so I'd say no, the game's barrier for design is your imagination. If you're a boring minded gamer then I'm sorry but the truth is that your game is going to be boring. The combat (as mentioned before) plays a key part in this form of exploration because apparently spamming the "insert enemy here" button equals good game design. The combat is very simplistic for a MMO but that isn't a bad thing, it keeps a constant and consistent flow in-between the gameplay styles without completely dumbing it down. You can purchase weapons with money such as a sword, a stronger sword and a stronger sword... ok, they may have dumbed it down a little... ok, a lot... ok, quite a lot. Sure there's a fire arm and it's many bigger brothers but that's about it. Finally there's the element of building that I'm sure has some 4 year olds screaming "MINECRAFT CLONE!" but it's not the same. Rather than crafting and harvesting recources you instead buy them with the money that you take from fallen enemies, it's simple and it works. People can also be seen in your game but interacting with them is far from the attraction of the online.

Presentation: The style is 8-bit and the music is kick-ass (and obviously 8-bit), that sounds familiar doesn't it? An 8-bit styled game with great music... Oh yea, it's nearley EVERY Steam game ever. Besides that though it's all fairly easy to explain, the style is in the form of a top down 8-bit game and the music is just great and enjoyable. 

Story: So uh... some guy called... I want to say Alan, Alan? Alan. Anyway some guy called Alan gets you to talk to... a Zombie and a Dragon. Ok, the story sucks and there's no way around that, it is there to open the gameplay up. With that said there are plenty of witty one-liners and just a ton of cool nods to other series. Not that it makes up for the off pacing though.

Positives: - The exploration, combat and the building all fit well (even if not equally),
               - The gameplay is just solid overall,
               - The game has a very solid online system which works on so many levels.

Negatives: - The combat is repetetive and is way too simple,
                 - The design is staggered (but not ruined) by the less creative gamers out there.

Score: 7/10 - I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040890215', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1406174541}
review:
At least as of this point in development, I find the name very misleading. The game is in fact not 8-Bit, and while technically a MMO, doesn't quite fit the genre. If it was called "Yet another attempt at trying to make Minecraft fun", maybe I'd be able to reccomend it for what it is. Sadly, it's just not there.
This game has potential, but I don't see it shaping up to that any time soon.

Also, while most reviews complain about "freemium", and while there is microtransactions, in all instances I've played I haven't been asked to spend a single penny. At least there's that. It's a solid timewaster if that's what you're into.

Otherwise, don't even bother. You probably already have Minecraft, and you probably have played that with leveling systems online anyway, and that sticks true to what it is. This is yet to, but at a later date let's hope we can find it again to be reborn a new, original game.

This review is outdated, and I have not played the game since July of 2014.  Therefore, it is entirely possible that whatever complaints listed below may have been fixed since then.  I will give the game another chance soon, and will then update my review accordingly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080469699', 'num_games_owned': 3090, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1405168385}
review:
Итак, перед нами массовая многопользовательская онлайн (проще MMO) пиксельная 2D-игра с открытым миром. В Steam игра не так давно, но уже завоевала популярность (на официальном сайте указано количество зарегистрированных людей, их более полумиллиона). Небольшое вступление сделано, пора приступать к плюсам и минусам.
Плюсы:
1) Игра бесплатна. Совсем. То есть заходи в Steam на страницу игры, нажимай на кнопку, устанавливай и играй. Все очень быстро. Мы подошли ко второму плюсу.
2) Малый вес игры. Немногим более 250 Мб. Быстро скачать и начать играть.
3) Очень быстрая и простая регистрация. Указываешь ник, почту и пароль (даже не надо вводить его 2 раза, вон как быстро ;D ), выбираешь сервер, один из которых основной, а другой тестовый и играешь.
4) Музыкальное сопровождение. Оно шикарное. Музыка воьмибитная разных жанров, от дабстепа до простых мелодий. В самый раз для этой игры, даже исходя из названия. Если же вам понравилась какая-то определенная песня, то сверху наводите курсор на иконку ноты и увидите название песни, можете поставить "Большой палец" песне или же перейти на страницу автора песни на сайте 8BitMMO. Итак, далее пойдут плюсы про сам интерфейс и геймплей.
5) Приятная пиксельная графика.
6) Можно строить свои дома и даже города, так что игра чем-то похожа на Minecraft. Но в чем преимущество перед Minecraft'om - так это наличие квестов.
7) Наличие квестов, уровней персонажа, а также достижений, что позволяет увеличить времяпровождение в игре.
8) Довольно милые и прикольные NPC, а также враги (чего только стоят слизень, котик или хипстер :) ).
9) У игры есть карточки. Поэтому вы можете сделать значок, поставить в свой профиль и хвастаться друзьям :) .
А теперь же у нас пойдут минусы:
1) Игра на английском. Поэтому если хотите хотя бы примерно понимать квесты или описание предметов, то необходимо базовое знание языка. Но так как игра с хорошим юмором, то советую всё же выучить английский, не пожалеете (тем более вообще по жизни пригодится ;) ).
2) Донат. Хоть необязательный, но он присутствует. В самом Steam вы можете купить платные версии игры.
3) Игра находится в раннем доступе. Поэтому она часто меняется, что может многим не понравится.
4) Без интернета не поиграете, на то и MMO.
Я оцениваю эту игру на 8/10.
Итак, игру я описал, попробовать стоит однозначно, а потом уже и решите, понравилась ли вам игра или нет.
На этом всё, подписывайтесь, комментируйте, ставьте лайк, и до новых встреч, или как там говорят? :D
Тапками не кидайтесь, всем добра :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198055421141', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1404858136}
review:
It was definatly good, but I think that it is very "pay to win". New players can join and the tutorial is well thought out, and introduces the player to the idea of dungeons, Items, Weapons, and Building in a nice, easy pace... but they only have 2 tutorial quests from the main "spawn".

The enemies are limited. as far as i can tell there is only Slugs, Laywer Cats, Hipsters, Game developers, and Dire Game Developers. you gain the ability to kill all of the enemies within half an hour of gamplay (during the tutorial).

the weaponry is shallow, to say the least. Theres "Color Swords" that come in 3 levels (white, Blue and Red, dealing 1, 3, and 6 damage respectivly.) and two guns. I have not tried the guns, but they do not seem to be worth it.

The EXP and leveling system is so broken it takes HOURS to reach level 5 (the point where you can start your own town.) I myself have only reached level 3, and that was spending about 2 hours grinding away on some of the public farms.

With all that said, It has potential. The building aspect is very nice, even with the limited amount of blocks, and It WOULD be worth playing to get a town if the game changed.

I would change this, If I could:
*Add more "classic" enemies. Dragons could be a high-level enemy that cannot be hit with a sword and attacks from a range. this would encourage the use of ranged weapons, Orcs could be melee enemies that have a lot of HP... etc
*New weapons. Bows, Spears, Shotguns, Clubs, are all examples of weapons that can fit easily into this game, and would add variety.
*Loot. Enemies should drop Clothes as loot. NOT weapons. this allows people to look at your character and see what kinds of Monsters you have slain.
*"Official" dungeons and Quests. that feature Monsters that are tougher and unique to the "official" storyline.
*Shop sells a few weapons but not all of them. This would encourage players to continue on the official storyline to get more powerfull stuff.
*Private Arenas. Self explanitory, arenas that allow 2, 3, or even 4 people to duke it out without others interference.
*Better Leveling system, gives the player a reward when they level up, and make it so that you can play for a while and feel rewarded
*Dungeon Voting. This is a good one. All I got quest-wise was a bunch of "Hey, come look at my house! isnt it awesome!?" quests that I did not care about. I did not get ONE quest that said "go through a dungeon filled with complicated obsticles". to fix this, Make a "voting" system where, when you reach a finish quest block, it will ask to rate the quest on a scale of 1-10. (or to skip voting.) this allows for the good quests to be recommended while the "fake" quests will be pushed back and not recommended at all.

In short, I think the game has potential, but it should be a "Fight through the Dungeon RPG-style" focused game and less of a "Building/Fighting" game. I do think the building should be IN the game, but it is too broken right now to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051491676', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1404850148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018745755', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1404537294}
review:
This is by far one of the worst games I have ever wasted my time on. I'm pretty sure I played the SimCity beta for longer. I mentioned a few problems I had on the forums, and this is when I decided to make this review. They fucking banned me, for TRYING TO HELP THEM IMPROVE THEIR GAME. No, you ungrateful pricks go fuck yourself. Just because mommy and daddy gave you the money to kickstart this game doesn't mean you can walk around like you are some big dev company and anything that anybody says against you is wrong. I could rant in detail about all the things I found stupid with this game, but I'll give a summary. In the time I played I already received a repeat quest. I discovered that building things is PAINFULLY difficult. Also, this is NOT LIKE MINECRAFT in terms of building a world. You have to buy the blocks, with either in game money or real life money. Actually you can buy anything with real life money because this game doesn't even hide the fact that they simply want all your money and could care less about the game. The combat system..... or if you can call it that, is "press space at stuff", and is one of the worst combat systems I have ever had to deal with. 

Overall 0/10
This is the worst MMO game I have ever played and I will tell all my friends and everyone I know to avoid this game like the plague.

Edit: Of course this game -has- potential. But it's hella neglected and the devs obviously don't care. They got their money and went on vacation. This could be a good game, but as it is now it's an absolute waste of time.

review: For a crappy graphic game with no major animation, this is a great game I will admit! Funny too, when you read random signs or when you talk to people for quests. You can build a house, get a gun, get colored clothing, fight cats, kill hipsters, and more stuff you will have to see for yourself. Most of the reviews are just retarded. You obviously have to enjoy 2-D 8-Bit games to understand a bit more. Im recommending this because it is actually addicting. Kinda addicting like when your bored you go on random websites to find a flash game, but this one is the more "opened" up version instead of shootiing targets or 2D racing. Just try this and it may be kinda good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143175748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1404698457}
review:
Lute pela sobrevivência em um MMO RPG bem descontraído com gráficos de Atari

Se você sempre ficou curioso sobre como ficaria um jogo com gráficos de 8 bits com suporte para multiplayer na internet, aqui a está a resposta.

8BitMMO é um jogo de RPG online para muitos jogadores em que você precisa lutar contra inimigos e sobreviver em um mundo livre.

Nele, você pode completar quests e ganhar experiência para aumentar o nível do seu personagem e ser o melhor dos heróis desenhados com poucos pixels.

Um mundo livre

O game segue uma linha de evolução não linear, em que você é livre para iniciar apenas as missões que quiser ou apenas andar pelos cenários. Um pequeno tutorial no início ensina você sobre os comandos básicos e ações disponíveis do jogo, mas não demora até que seu personagem possa começar a perambular por aí.

Os comandos do jogo são tão simples quanto os seus gráficos: teclas W, A, S, D para andar e barra de espaço para atacar. Um pequeno menu também está disponível no canto esquerdo com as opções de abrir o inventário e realizar outras ações, como ressurgir depois de uma morte.

Assim como qualquer outro game de RPG, o seu personagem em 8BitMMO possui staus de pontos de vida e mana. Estes atributos podem ser aprimorados à medida que você avançar através dos níveis. Cada equipamento também tem suas próprias características... Mesmo que elas não sejam muito visíveis neste jogo de gráficos simplistas.

Construção

Além de explorar o mundo aberto e combater criaturas estranhas, o game também permite que você construa suas próprias casas usando as mesmas peças presentes em outras edificações.

Prós
Liberdade de exploração dos cenários

Contras
Gráficos simplórios demais
Efeitos sonoros pobres

author: {'steamid': '76561198094717193', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1410478480}
review:
This is probably the worst game I have ever played. At first I thought "Woah a free 8 bit RPG with a sandbox aspect! YES!"
I got it, and I have played about 70 minutes. After the first 3 minutes of doing the lazy TUTORIAL quest, I spent the next 67 minutes of my time searching for the tinyest bit of fun. "Oh, cool! I can make my own town?" Nope. Pay us money, and we give you a small plot of land for a town. "Ok. But what if I ask for a town to live in?" No! The community is terrible, and they expect TONS of in-game cash to get in! 

But what about the player made quests? Those HAVE to be good, like defeat a mighty dragon and get your reward, right? NO.
most of those quests are lazy and stupid. I got one that says "find the building with the r on it to claim your reward." Oh yeah? Well when I go into the player quest warp, i get put in this ghost town with random blocks placed everywhere and NOTHING TO DO WITH THE QUEST. 

Also. The way the game went out with its top down 8-bit 3D graphics, I cant tell if im on a roof, wall, or floor. To see a door in which I can go in, I practically have to hug the wall trying to find it, because the roof is covering the entire damn house! I also cant tell if a platform is raised or not! Why is that? THERE ARE NO SHADOWS FOR BLOCKS. NO DEPTH PERCEPTION. ITS TERRIBLE. Anyways, this game is horrible., its free, but it's horrible. Dont waist your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068774201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1398385237}
review:
8BitMMO, created by Robby Zinchak aka RobbyZ is a old school styled Free Roam Rpg. 8BitMMO is a game that takes inspiration from many games such as Minecraft, Legend of Zelda, and even Mario. In 8BitMMO you start off waking up in a man's house who is completely aware that he is in a video game by breaking the 4th wall. He sends you off to complete quests in order to just get you out of his house, he references that he has done this multiple times and that strangers waking up in his house has become a common problem for him. This snarky dialogue made me enjoy my first 10 minutes of the game, as it reminded me of dialogue coming from games like Saints Row. I love it when games make fun of the fact that it is a game. Unfortunately after the tutorial this dialogue seemed to cease and enjoyment of my gameplay experience began to decrease more and more. The combat in 8BitMMO is simple enough to play with one hand, with occasionaly reaching for your mouse. Only having the WASD keys for movement and the space bar for attacking made hunting quests and fighting off enemies a bore after the tutorial. There is also another element that makes 8BitMMO a little more entertaining; the ability to build. You are able to build a houses and environments like a top down Minecraft or Terraria. The building can become tedious with blocks stacking not the way you want them to and having a lack of tools to do anything truly spectacular. Although I didnt enjoy this feature, I did see many interesting and cool user created homes and even areas that put the building and combat to good use. The music is probably what I enjoyed most from 8BitMMO, it had beats that went along with the art direction and it had the convenient feature to skip the current song as if i was using Pandora radio. The game does have a leveling system like most other MMO's that encourage you to rank up in order to get certain items or get to certain areas. I have to completely honest and say that I didnt have a great time with 8BitMMO. It is free on Steam and does offer microtransactions, BUT doesnt flash them around begging for money. The game might be fun with a few friends looking to make your own quests and adventures but playing alone is just plain boring.

Overall:

8BitMMO has a lot of great ideas that just dont work out yet. After sometime and update the game can be great. The music fits in with the world perfectly and the combat is a little bland. In my opinion I would like to see RobbyZ create either more content for this game or make more games with the same amount of snark and wit that the tutorial of this game had. I loved the original dialogue and was set to play a game that knew how to make fun of its self but instead, I got a bland and lifeless world that could and should be improved dramatically. And could be alot of fun if your bored with nothing new to play or if you find a group to play with.(Roleplaying could be fun in this game)

Verdict:

7.0

Worth a try.(hey its free!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047075548', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1389781420}
review: Not very nice looking, I got caught on most of the enviroment. The monsters were-- slow. The gameplay didn't have much to get my attention. Really it was like playing Furcadia (if anyone remembers that) and getting caught on badly coded doorways. It seemed like a simple point and click thing, not much individualization, and just not up my alley. However! If you like independant little games where you run around, have fun building things, enjoy blocks and such like that in a 3Dish enviroment with other people, this game might be for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067329826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1403795378}
review:
As a free to play game its worth while to give it a shot and you probably will have a couple hours of fun but the game do have a few problems. The graphics are very limited, being an 8-bit game, and can be very confusing while trying to navigate through different areas. I think that this game has a lot of potential if done right, which would probably be difficult to do, but at the moment i think it needs work. But really as of this review its only a new game in early access and has time to fix these problems.
If you want to see a MMO like this workout then I'd highly recommend you try it out and any problems you find report them to the developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128470789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1409968859}
review: I really enjoy this game! It's fun to interact with other people. Some players can be abusive, bu in all of my time playing, I have only ran into one. People are always there to help, so if you are just starting and are a little confused, just ask in the chat and someone will help! There are quests to do, people to talk to, towns to move into, and fun to be had! Even more: it's free! And a great way to spend some time when you're feeling down, because you are never really alone. You can even be a potato. Don't waste another second; as long as you have a toaster, you can play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127167749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1393133763}
review:
God, How would I put this? "ROBLOX SUX!!!1111" "Meh, (I refuse to say the name of this game, but I have to) 8BitMMO was worse".
How do I put this?
Community: ROBLOX-esque. Though as said below, People got banned for just saying that "This game is boring". I mean, You could kicked for just referencing ponies in Minecraft. Or how about the time you got kicked for trading a 'duped' item when it's really a killstreak in a crowded TF2 server full of squeakers? OR HOW ABOUT THE TIME YOU GOT KICKED FOR NO REASON AT ALL? yeah. forget that, the 8BitMMO fanbase is too connected.
Game: It looks generic, somehow attractive, but it's enitrely player-created.  Nobody's gonna think it's good or anything. I mean, the LawyerCats just looks like a prototype cat enemy from BattleBlock Theatre. Speaking fo lawyers, I'mgonna phone mine up now.


Altogether,I can't say anything else. This is just bad. -69/10

review:
Nedoporučuji.
Koncept hry je zajímavý, mám rád celkem MMORPG hry. Každá hra nemusí být o grafice. A teď ohleďně hraní, dialogy jsou celkem zajímavé a klidně jsem si je přečetl, úkoly jsou velice dobře popsané a víte jak na to, ale ty chyby... Když máte jeden úkol dělat i 3x jen kvůli tomu ,že chytnete chybu tak vás hra odradí a začnete ji nenávidět. Možná si to opět zahraju až bude většina chyb opravena. Prozatím nedoporučuji.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115296879', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1403466031}
review:
I came in, expecting a cheap but fun retro-style MMO where you build stuff. Instead I got a cheap and unfun game with poor hit detection, lots of lag and a rather aggressive player base. The gameplay, while simplistic, doesn't always function the way you want it to, concepts of the game aren't explained well in it's tutorials, and there is no way that I could find of telling when I was getting hit, so I ended up dying when it appeared I was doing really well. The graphics are more akin to a late-era Atari 2600 game as opposed to an 8-bit console, which sort of ruins the entire 8-bit feel. I guess some of the music is catchy, though some of it is also not so good, so it's rather hit-and-miss.

I did not spend that much time with the game, but the time I did spend was enough to convince me that this game is not for me, and most likely not a game that was well made. I'd say avoid this one, it's just not worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134621814', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1403514085}
review:
我喜欢像素类的游戏，这款游戏深深地打动了我。当我第一次看见它时，我就被他吸引了。
在这款游戏里，你可以建造，可以与朋友一起战斗，甚至可以PVP。
游戏里都是像素可爱的画风，让我回忆起了童年玩红白机的生活。
现在我已玩了一会儿，完成了不少任务，也已经3级了。以前连1级小怪都打不过的我，现在已可以与其他玩家进行PVP了。
这正是一款适合我意的游戏，我很喜欢他，也推荐大家去玩玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198095947134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1402573419}
review:
[h1]8BitMMO has a lot of potential. [/h1]

[i]Potentially[/i], the developers could scrap the entire concept and create something actually worth the price of admission. This game is not satire, it's referential. It presents itself as a Free-To-Play game, but you have to pay to access core features. On top of this, the graphical assets are bad, the dialog is bad, the sound assets are an assault on the eardrums. 

This game is clearly a joke. I just don't get it.

review: Not a bad game, if your into this type of thing. Kinda chapped my bum that I collected up the gold for the first player quest fee door, only to fall out the damn house and not complete the quest. Not wasting another 45 minutes to do that again. Best of luck with your development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068076094', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1422347187}
review: So far, I've sunk 2 hours into this game and I love it. The business model, while somewhat constricting, does not require you to spend money, and you can have just as much fun without it. The player quests are a great idea, and if you get one which is broken, you can ask for a new one. The graphics are somewhat confusing, but if you made it through the tutorial you SHOULD get the hang of it fairly easily. The game's sense of humour is great, and so is the rest of it. It's kinda like if Minecraft were a dungeon crawler, with a few extra features on the side.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118836259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1401931333}
review: The game gives me a very 8 bit vibe  a=but still looks good enough to be HD I personally love MMO's because its an adventure game and I absolutely love this game. The game is however glitched at somepoints so beware that the game isn't in the  best condition but the dungeon's and online play make up for that. Being able to communicate just incase your playing with a friend is really help so I reccomend playing this with friends its realt fun also the game is extreamly hard so don't evn think for the slightest seconnd your safe otherwise you might just get beatup in dungeon two. I absolutely love this game and anyone who loves multiplayer coop,8-bit games,MMO's,adventurer's,Dungeon Crawlers,and fun really ought to get this game plus its free so that makes the deal even sweeter

author: {'steamid': '76561198117330327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 106547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61060, 'last_played': 1447964914}
review: A retro-themed construction mmo. Build alone or with friends. After taking a little time to learn the z-axis mechanics, the system is quite easy to understand and flexible. Don't go in expecting it to be combat-driven, or too complex in the PvP department. Building is the primary focus here, and in this regard it excels. The community will usually answer any questions you may have promptly if you get stuck, just make sure you're polite, and the kindness will be reciprocated. A single developer runs this entire game, so updates are slow, however imput from the players is always taken into consideration. If minecraft-esque construction with a retro twist sounds appealing to you, give 8BitMMO a try.

review: Ah, 8BitMMO. One of my favorite Free-to-Play games on Steam. If you haven't tried this one, you're missing out. It takes up little space, works pretty well, and is an overall source of fun. It may have a few flaws, but the game makes up for it with its quirky jokes and its amazing soundtrack. As my friend Shane said, "I've played funner games before this, but for what it is, it's pretty good."

author: {'steamid': '76561198064571587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1400462424}
review:
The wilderness is choked and polluted with unfinished buildings and random blocks lying around. One cannot find a proper and public place to build. The world is not infinite, and that being said, theres random bits and pieces of debris lying around from some long-vanished player. Combat is bland, even given the early access there is only a minimal variety of enemies and weapons. It also gives access to powerful weapons very early in the game, and enemy spawns are quite very visible, making even the newbliest noob an easy way to farm for gold and exp. Building is also a pain, as it is confusing and blocks tend to overlap and behave in an odd way. The biggest problem I had was the "roofing" system. Ceilings that are placed overhead vanish and reappear suddenly, leading to a flashing and annoying ceiling over your characters head. 

TL;DR: 
1. Crappy Combat
2. Crappy Building System
3. Polluted Wastelands that rival those of Fallout
4. If you've played Portal, you will get PTSD relapse from potatoes
5. Pay to Build
6. Go play Minecraft or Terraria

TL;DR, TL;DR
Potatoes, 10/10 would buy
