author: {'steamid': '76561198108156098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1428453296}
review:
8BitMMO is a good game for people who want PvP action or feel like killing things to build. It's basicly Minecraft in a twisted way, but you are not mining the blocks to get them, instead you are killing things to get coins and build.

It's graphics are 8 bit, and is not laggy at all so in my opinion any computer would be able to handle this. 

I also have the slowest download speed and it took 5 minutes to download this. I'm pretty sure someone with a good quality PC would have it download in a snap of a finger. I am suprised this game isn't pay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117853839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1402698535}
review:
1st and formost. This game is mainly about building. Too often players come in expecting more. Do not come in expecting freaking world of warcraft. 2nd. The game is run and developed by ONE person who really does work hard to make it better. Yes updates can be small and slow but they do come. 3rd. The game is free to play... Yes there are some things that have to be bought with real money however all items except cloths can be traded for ingame gold. Genrally a LOT of gold but you can still get oretty much everything without having to spend real money. As long as you understand that and can accept that then you just might really like the game.

That having been said the games developer has been working on adding more than just building but the game content isn't a lot currently. If you do play just try to build and have fun. Yes the building system can take a bit to get used to and some things can be confusing but most players will try to help you out if not a moderator. OR alternativly watch a few youtube videos.

Bottom line. Give it a try and see for yourself weather you like it or not. If you do great and if not it's understandable that not everyone will like it but please don't stay and bash the game if you don't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013180268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1399183471}
review:
I can't say I strongly [i]dislike[/i] it, and I fully understand that I can't throw too much criticism at a game that is clearly in early beta, but I just can't recommend 8BitMMO in its current state. Also, it's obviously free, so if you want to prove me wrong and try it, go on ahead.

It's not about the dialogue, or the graphics, but it's just that the game feels [i]broken[/i] from the bottom up. The controls are unresponsive and jumpy, it lags your computer randomly, there's very little feedback from in game events (dying, picking up an item, etc) so it can be impossible to tell what the hell is going on, and the combat boils down to "press spacebar in the general vicinity of an enemy and something will happen, probably". It feels like an amateur project, not a game that anyone would consider spending money on. There's no point in adding more and more content (shoving it full of new weapons and terrain textures) to a game if it's broken on a very basic level.

Please don't hesitate to correct me if the creator has announced intentions to make major changes to the game engine from the ground up (or something along those lines), but until then, I'll probably be spending my time somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073600298', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1398739819}
review:
After spending only 20 minutes trying to deal with the slow tutorial, lousy controls, I have an 8bit headache.

I hopped into the game with really nothing on my mind and nothing to expect. This was an 8bit MMO that features building stuff and I honestly didn't know what to think. 

After playing the slow and annoying tutorial and dealing with the no so good controls, I decided to talk to the people in chat and got invited to visit some guys mansion/castle/whatever that 8bit thing was and I was kinda surprised that someone could finish something that big on that game. My brain hurt after 20 minutes, this guy must of spent atleast several hours completing his 8bit fortress of headaches.

The dialogue is also bland and features no depth to what your doing, it felt like I was jumping into a poorly built 90's game.

I recommend not touching this and just skip over to another free MMO on steam, like Neverwinter or CoS.

Unless you have the patience of a saint and really love confusing gameplay, then take a stab at it.

Awful controls, really annoying tutorial and a general feeling of overwhelming boredom shot this down long before it took flight.

Personal Rating: 1/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198047847675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1393371065}
review: I played this game for a little bit to see if it was worth playing, but I was disappointed. I started out on the main world and went through the tutorial (Which took a bit of time) and then went out to find a place to build. Ill say this, the world is so populated that it is very VERY hard to find a place to build that wasnt covered in debris from previous players. When i switched to the beta world to see if it was less populated, but I found that my gear did not carry over and i had to start the tutoial all over agin. I just stopped there and decided this game wasnt worth it. Even when i was doing missions in the main world, It wasnt really that fun.  I would just save yourself the trouble and if you want a real mmo, download neverwinter. It is also free and is superior in every way (Unless you have a toaster for a computer)

Sucks giant dildos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052843690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1396045891}
review:
An MMO set in an 8-bit universe, where the world is the players' making? Sounds too good to be true.

The game's far from perfect, some bugs and the common issues of any MMO are present, but the game's tight combat and fun creative aspect definitely make this game worth it to have a look-see. Recommended to any lover of the 8-bit retro games of old.

review:
Да-бы не обижать разрабов, я рекомендую эту игру. Мне лично, она понравилась. +
Подходит под слабые компы +
Одни американцы, англичане -
Игра однообразная. ЧЁ ДЕЛАТЬ!? -
В чате пообщаться невозможно. Тонны сообщений от русских, типо: Американцы хуесосы! -
Не любитель енглиша, сделайте русский. -
А так игра хорошая, поиграл 10 минут, может ещё поиграю. +

author: {'steamid': '76561198045813111', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1387902796}
review: I personally find this to be more of a "meh" kind of game. Even though I hate to say it, this game is basically a 2D version of Minecraft. I really don't like to compare things to Minecraft because it is a stupid thing to say in my opinion, but whenever I play this game, I just keep thinking that I could have a better time playing Minecraft or Garry's Mod. If you happen to be looking for a game similer to Minecraft, there are many different free games made that are comparable to Minecraft. Even after all of the flack I gave this game, I am willing to say that this game was interesting to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088093473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1391111228}
review:
A fun little game to go mess around in every once in a while. You get what you pay for- in this case it is free. Platinum is needed if you want to build your own town.

The building system is a bit funky, and the views of how blocks are being put and such is a bit confusing.

Has some stuff going for it, but not really one I could play for long periods of time. It got a bit boring.

review: This game is a bunch of bullshit. "Open world build/hack and slash PvP" they said. Yes, but to build, you need gold. To get gold you can either kill someone, get 1 GOLD, and repeat for 5 hours OR pay $5-$100+ to instantly get gold. The community isn't the friendlyist and......it's just so repetitive! So if you like spending shit tons of money on a game via micro-transactions, THIS IS YOUR GAME. If you don't, don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034743974', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1408668687}
review: This game is an interesting one. I don't know of many games like it. It reminds me of Realm of the Mad God. It is half "hack n' slash" and half "sandbox". Its pretty good, but it does get boring if you don't like grinding (like myself), although there isn't much of it, which is good. The building is a bit wonky, so I tend to avoid it and just explore. I know its still in Early Access, so maybe they'll fix it. Haven't seen to much "pay-to-win", although there isn't much to win. I've put about an hour in so far, and killed some Hipsters, Business Cats, and The Escapist.  There are some quests, and those are pretty cool. The sort-of cool thing is that when you finished the quests that came with the game, you get to do some player quests. Some are "get through the dungeon", some are "find the reward in my city", and some are "here's your reward, you're good at doing nothing". I prefer the latter two (I suck at fighting in games). Overall, its an O.K. game for what it is right now. I suggest you try it, and if you don't like it wait a bit and then come back. Its a pretty small file size too, so that helps. If the current game were the finished product, I would give it 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084381063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1392552552}
review:
Après plusieurs moments passés sur le jeu, je peut donner mon avis...
Ce jeu m'a en même temps plu et déçu, mais il est très possible que ça sois amélioré au fur et à mesure des mises à jours.
Plusieurs points : 
- Le jeu en anglais, moi qui n'a pas un niveau très haut, j'ai été très dépaysé, je n'y comprenais rien, je suis même aller sur le chat IRC officiel (en anglais) pour poser des questions (savoir comment faire une quête)

- MMO pour massivement multijoueur, mais les serveurs pourris, le système de gestion et le monde trop immense font que ça ne devient pas trop un MMO, mais je ne vais pas plus me plaindre là dessus car on peut croiser beaucoup de personnes dans des donjons (et c'est drôle de les voir mourir devant soi).

- Le style 8bit, vraiment sympathique, mais les musiques vous rentrent dans la tête et surtout du 8bit, votre cerveau aura du mal à digérer, vous pouvez désactiver la musique, mais il n'y a plus d'ambiance dans le style du jeu. Plus de musiques serait une bonne idée, et couper celles répétitives.

- La difficulté, comme dans beaucoup de MMO (RPG), les quêtes sont répétitives et on fait juste suivre à la trace ce qui est indiqué, dans ce jeu, c'est à la fois vrai et à la fois faux, des quêtes peuvent être créées par les joueurs, le problème, c'est que n'importe quoi peut-être créé, en passant par les quêtes les plus pourries... "embaucher" une team de créateur de quêtes serait une meilleure idée pour le jeu, ou bien alors pouvoir noter les quêtes et pouvoir essayer de les faire supprimer en cas de problèmes certains (quête inutile, construction à caractère offensif, etc...).

Au final, je n'ai pas mis le point sur TOUT, mais c'est déjà suffisant.
Le jeu a un gros potentiel, mais il reste encore du boulot selon moi, je vous donne un gros UP, étant quasiment certain que la balance peut et va pencher :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066533651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1395067995}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110248358', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1424381391}
review: If you like building, Pokemon (The 8bit view field), PvP, puzzles, strategy, or showing off your fancy new hats or cloths, you will love this game. Learning how to build is a task worth learning. Listen to what Draco the Dragon has to say!! He will help a lot. If you ever want to recieve the godly Red Sword, you will have to level up like crazy! Leveling up gets harder and harder, but keep up with the missions, and you will be there in no time. Some of the Player Quests are pretty hard, but read the signs, and reguard the traps and you'll be done in no time! I'd definately recommend this game, it suits all of my gaming wants/needs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080884518', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1430081256}
review: 8BitMMO is quite an amazing game. First of all it is like any MMO really, but has a more comical feel. Secondly, if you have a low performance computer, it still runs well. The music is great, simple and easy to use controls. Creative quests and concepts, and for me only playing about a half an hour of it. I love it so much! I highly reccomend it to anybody who has a sense of humor or somebody who likes MMO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078404774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1395634887}
review:
Half way through my hate speech they muted me. Now I'm as prejudicial as the next man, but I always listen to someone with conviction in their tone. In this case using caps lock was not enough to convey my point so I had to utilize the name Niggest. I'm certain I have a religion in my honor since I left my mark on that world. But, I will grace it one last time with some words of advice for the developers.

1) Allow racism. Not like Imperial Wizard level stuff, but a healthy dose of slurs.

2) Get some guns. The world is better with more firepower.

3) Get better graphics. Seriously. This isn't 1999. Don't they know Windows Vista exists?

4) Don't censor people. We're not a bunch of facists here, and kids are all going to grow up to be bitter old people anyway.

5) Have some original content. I swear, Simpsons did it better.

6) Ban everyone and close down the servers.

7) Lawyer cats? Fucking stupid.

I hope my constructive criticism will help this game in the future. Or not. I don't really give a shit what happens now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043524258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1395554932}
review: Just say no.  Don't touch it.  It's not being updated worth squat.  It takes maybe 10 minutes to see everything this game has to offer, which is almost nothing.  Very little variety in building materials, with the "reward block", teleporters, 3 traps, and the safe being the only interactable ones.  Only 4 enemies all melee, and only a couple items in 3 categories to change your looks.  That's even including the real world money required stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994661161', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1394602210}
review:
Resumen del juego basico:

Puedes construir tu propio "mundo" (casas o zonas enteras) incluidas mazmorras y demas. 
Basicamente, la idea fundamental del juego, aparte de pvp es construir y completar mazmorras (por regla general pesimamente hechas)

Resumen del juego real:

Te aburriras a los 30 minutos, cuando te des cuenta de que cualquier cosa minimamente interesante que hacer (como un pueblo, o una mazmorra realmente desafiante y que no este basada en andar y con suerte encontrar el camino correcto) requiere de dinero real de forma descarada.

El concepto de por si aceptable, la ejecucion no obstante (y no me refiero a graficamente) bastante mal realizado, si hablamo ya graficamente, un juego como este con MUY POCO ESFUERZO puede acabar con una pinta genial, pero no es el caso.

PD: El LAG para un juego de estas caracteristicas es DEMENCIAL, y segun el momento, lo hacen totalmente injugable.

review:
You know, i was originaly just going to leave this critism in the forums, as i did not want to leave a offical negitive review when the game has room to grow, but apparently critism is ground for being banned from the forums. so i guess ill leave this here

1. game is not really 8 bit, just poor art, its a indy title so that is exusable, but it is insulting to 8-bit consols to imply that is what it looks like. the music is also not 8-bit, but chip music as there are real drums and stuff playing. 

2. combat is poor, you just face the enemy and spam the attack key, 

3. hard to see, the rendering has issues. hard to tell what is wall or floor.


i did wish this game well, but not i am not so sure.

review: 8BitMMO é um MMO que tenho grandes expectativas, por se tratar de um jogo 8bit é simples porém oferece grande liberdade, uma comunidade bem receptiva e a possibilidade de ter horas de diversão sem gastar dinheiro real (coisa dificil nos dias de hoje). Com certeza um dos melhores MMO da atualidade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043108500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 767, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1394313083}
review: Good game, if you have 2GB RAM then you should be all good. I dont have that much of RAM unfortunately which causes me to lag at some point which bothers me. Why am i recommending it to people? Because, regardless of the requirements its actually a fun game. And even if i lag, i sometimes play just so i can lvl up or something when i'm bored lol. The gameplay looks VERY classic, nice pixels, of course coming from a game that said "8bitmmo" haha, thats how the game works isnt it? Lol! Anyways, its good to have friends to play this, its also a FREE game so go and fight with your friends or invite them in your house in which you make. Theres also PvP, so you can fight players. Anways its a free game so its not like anything matters lol, just give it a try. Its FREE!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112387359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1486604940}
review:
There once was a lad who played this game. He wandered around and built a house. Then he discovered that he could become a potato. So, he lept at the opportunity. The lad enjoyed being a potato and hopped around happily. Until one day the lad met a man with an eyepatch and fancy suit. He said to the man "Hi there I have mixed feelings about you. You are wearing an eyepatch. That makes me distrust you, but you are also wearing a fancy suit. Despite that the fact that I cannot figure out why it is so fancy, it makes me trust you."
"Well my lad no reason to fear me for I am a mayor. Follow me to my city and I will grant you citizenship and a free plot of land."
The lad happily followed the man to his city until they arrived there.
"Here is my city lad. Go in and make yourself at home."
"But sir it is a cave."
"Oh my silly boy. It is an underground city. See?" 
He said as he walked into the cave. The boy saw this as proof enough and went on in.
"No boy you must pay a small fee to pass this door."
"I thought you said it was free of charge."
"Oh yes but this a toll for all people. No exceptions."
The man waited as the boy deposited the fee. Then the man walked through the door and the boy followed. Except the boy felt the floor move and as he looked he felt himself falling. He did not understand what was going on.
"Thank you for the gold my dear potato, but I must bid you farewell."
The boy fell for about three more seconds until hitting a spike pit and subsequently dying.
(Moral of the story never trust a man with an eyepatch no matter how fancy a suit he wears.)

review: Um jogo ótimo,boa mecanica,mas só tem um ponto que podia melhorar,tem muito poucos itens,pois depois que chega ao lvl 5 de xp ja desbloqueiou tudo não tem mais nada para fazer,podia ter uma maneira de mudar o ângulo de visão para podermos explorar melhor(porque ninguem gosta de ficar construindo casas de trás pra frente),o estilo sandbox torna o jogo muito,MUITO bom para um jogo gratuito e vale a pena,mesmo sendo pouca as coisas para se fazer no jogo,tem sala PvP que já vale a pena ir ver,taréfas,e o lance de dungeons,bem.....,podia ser melhor no meu ponto de vista,sei que provavelmente o criado nem liga pelo que eu estou falando já que está tudo em português,mas se você quer um jogo para passar o tempo,este é ele.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080271668', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1444695609}
review: This Game! This game is the one of the greatest experiences i have ever had! The graphics in this game are very advanced, but dont worry it is still surprisingly manageable to run.  The enchanting graphics mixed in with the flawless story make for an emotional, yet rewarding experiance. In the story the protagonist, you has to delve into the mysterious caves filled with hundreds of "lawer cats" you have to vanquish using the superior combat system the devs have supplied you with.  8BitMMO will strike you with a great sense of joy whenever you obtain a new rare item such as a new sword or hat. After making some tough decisions throughout the marvilous game, the game sadly ends on a rough note, making you wish for another thrilling adventure with your brave warrior you have gone through so much with. All together 8BitMMO is the greatest FPS anyone can play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070227812', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1401917318}
review: By far one of the best games i have ever played. Between the story line and the next-gen combat fighting off herds of Lawyer cats the world needs to be exposed to games like this you might say the graphics are too next-gen or they are to good for the game to be enjoyable, wrong this game has found a way to make the outstanding graphics playable if you are looking for a good simulator. 8BitMMO is the game for you 10/10

review:
This game is still unfinished but i somehow doubt it will ever be refined enough to be labeled a "good game." 
There are many terrain glitches, the combat itself is pretty terrible in that you just trade blows or run about trying to stab something in the bum in a quality dogfight, but perhaps worst of all is the UI; it is simply abysmal to navigate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116040576', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1616567992}
review:
Pros:
Free To Play - No purchase necessary to have fun.

Anti-Griefing Systems - Several systems protect players from griefing. 

Customize your Character - Wear hats, clothing, accessories, change your skin color 

100% Player Built World - The entire world is built by players. Build your own house, town, voxelart, or dungeon. The world is massive -- there's plenty of space to build in, and it streams in as you explore (no load screens). 

Become a Zombie - Want to be a zombie? You can! But you'll need a steady supply of delicious brains from other players. 

Fight Nefarious Enemies - Congressional Lobbyist Slugs, LawyerCats, and Hipsters oh my. 

MegaMap - The world is huge, so the MegaMap interface (based on Google Maps API) is a handy way to browse the world and share your creations with friends.

Cons:
"Platinum" is required to build your own town, and must be bought with real money.

EDITED: Game has a serious problem. It always crashes. I would recommend it if RobbyZ would fix the bug.

review:
well, it is a work in progress........ obv, jk thats not all. it needs more players and the gameplay can be frustrating though its a fun frustarting experience.
if lots of players played it would have pottentian, even though i have not put much time into it at all its a game you can figure out.

gameplay: 9.5/10
graphics: 6/10 not because im picking in the genre of the graphics im saying the hitting of enmys could be less buggy.
story: 4/10 the story is not amazing but that is shaded away because of the good gameplay. 
overall: the gameplay is amazing but could be influenced by hitting easyer but the building is great. the story could be more immersive but its not the worst you will see. that is why ill give this game a 7.5/10 for a beta, but its free and still developing so it has potential

author: {'steamid': '76561198045727248', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1392676369}
review:
I couldn't stand to play this game for more than 45 minutes becasue it is so bad. The fetch quests don't even pretend like they have meaning to the game, the characters are annoying about just about everything in the game makes me want to uninstall it.

The controls are confusing, the orthographic camera is a nightmare (You might be able to change the camera settings, but the other things about this game don't make it worth it, and I couldn't stick around long enough to find out.).

This game is heavily based around micro-transactions, so if you just think "Nah! I don't need to spend money, it's free to play!" You are wrong. Every 10 minutes a box will pop-up asking you "pay to get the best experience" or some bullshit. You can always click no, but there is a sad face there and it just ruins emerision.

review: レベルを上げてキー連打ツールでHipsterをひたすら虐殺するゲーム。Plat（リアルマネー）がなければまともなダンジョンは作れない。ありふれたMMORPGのように敵を倒すことが目的でレベルを上げまくるゲームだとしても、Lv3以降の必要経験値が異常に多い気がするのは気のせいだろうか。PvPバトルにも参加してみたが、システムの都合からかLawyerCat狩りと同じにしか感じられなかった。唯一評価できる点は音楽が良かったということくらいであり、それでさえ30分も聞けばいい加減飽きてくる。

review: Что можно сказать об этой игре.…  На данный момент ничего хорошего, очень скудный и однообразный геймплей  уже сейчас разрабы пытаются нажиться на игроках продовая за реал предметы для стиля.  Прокачка бессмыслена кроме как купить новый меч ничего не дает постройка дома просто ужасна блоки нельзя убрать и переставить, так как вам надо, наличие пары квестов абсолютно ничем не разнообразит игру, сложно сказать будет ли будущее у этой игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067723583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1406584210}
review:
Overall: 9.5/10
----------------
Gameplay: 6/10
Story: -/10
Combat: 5/10
Concept: 9.5/10
-----------------
Summary:
I do like the fact that you can create your own adventure and play with friends and stuff like that, but the actual gameplay (in it's current stage) is a bit (heh, puns) lacking in certain places. Yes, I know it's an early-access title and that it's still in-development, but I would like to see a bit (heh, another pun) style and diversity in the combat and and customization of your character. Now, in regards to platinum, I don't like the fact that there is no conversion rate between the gold and platinum, and I do not agree that everything should cost platinum after level 3, but, because it's an early-access title this is probably just a temporary donation system and may be worked on as the game is updated more. As for the enemies and combat, I would like to see a bit more variation, maybe a randomly occuring dragon attack or space invasion you have to defend your town against, meanwhile, the combat shows a bit (I swear, I'm on fire today with these puns) of potential, I would like to see a magic/mana system worked into the combat. Other than that, I would say that because this game is free at the moment, you should download it and play it. It shows a lot of potential, and I would really like to see this turn into something great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126579617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1392483787}
review:
For a 8bit game, it's very funny and the creator has a great sense of humor and knows how to captivate players!
It's a very simplist game, so it can get addictive to people looking for a 5-min chill out game.
However, it's not my kind of game, as I would prefer Minecraft in order to give wings to my imagination, as a 2D environment isn't interesting to me.

My opinion is: give it a try. If you like it, just play it!
After all, it's just building thing and killing stuff. How hard can it get?

author: {'steamid': '76561198115332437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1392456103}
review:
8bitMMo это онлайн ммо рпг в кубичном стиле. В отличии от других кубичных игр у неё 2D режим.В игре нет Русского языка но для тех кто хоть немного разбирается в английском можно поиграть в неё.В игре присутствуют арены на которых можно проводить ПвП битвы. также есть некие "подземелья" в которых множество игроков убивают монстров.С недавнего обновления в игре стали доступна музыка которая играет во время игры. Минус в том что эту музыку нельзя выключить, но песни можно пропускать включая другие.
Фанаты ММО оценят эту игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107128375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1392925286}
review:
Viszonylag egyszerű. Hiszen az irányítás és a blockok tulajdonságait könnyen meg lehet szokni.
A játék nehézsége abban rejlik, hogy nem csak kreatív kell legyél, (mint pl Minecraft vagy Terraria), hanem rá kell hogy jöjj, hogyan is kell felépíteni egy házat, aminek falai és tetői is vannak.
A küldetések rendjén vannak.. Nem egetrengetőek, de hangulatosak, és pontosan olyan helyre vezetnek, ahol megláthatod, és megtapasztalhatod a játék lényegét: az egész világ a játékosok által kiépített dolgokból/épületekből áll. Egy kis példa: A dungeonok tele vannak luxus házakkal, és alig lehet kitalálni közöttük, mert egy óriási labirintust alkotnak. :))

Én ajánlom mindenkinek, próbáljátok ki, hiszen nem sokat veszítetek. Tíz perc játék után rájöttök, hogy megfog vagy nem fog meg titeket ez a stílus!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105672505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1404510199}
review: It's a really good game, but the tutorial and stuff is just plain BORING! Still, it's a pixelated world that you can build in, fun for the whole family! The concept is like "Minecraft", but 2d. I highly recommend this game for everyone, especially kids!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055478424', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1415480840}
review:
8BitMMo is fun. Nevertheless to say, much like other "F2P" games, it's more of Pay2GetTheRestOfTheGameTemporarily.

Why do i say it's that? It's that because the other half of the game, if you want to pay 5$ CONSTANTLY to have all the extra pieces from the store, you need platinum. Platinum is the in-game form of "Screw you all who only have gold, i'm going to lock the rest of the game down till you pay". It's stopping the gameplay. THIS is the problem with F2P. If you say it's F2P, DON'T LOCK THE GAME DOWN UNTIL WE PAY. Fine, Slow gameplay down a bit. Make the pieces harder to get, but don't stop the gameplay.

The idiots who do the microtranscations just feed the creator of this gam---- WAIT LEMME REPHRASE THAT! The creator of this Travisty, not game.

Onto the actual gameplay. The AI feels cheaply made and easy to farm, Infact, I could make the same in minutes.
Actual gameplay? Once again cheaply made. I RARELY fight things in the wilderness. That's caused by things RARELY spawning. Player quests are terrible; I can barely complete one due to hidden reward blocks, etc. It's not the monsters that make them hard. Once again, they're crappily made. Next up, The building tools. Oh god. Multilayered 2D building. That's it, I'm done. No more. I'm uninstalling this crap.

So yeah. I give this game 3/10. If it weren't 100% player built, It'd be a .000000000000000001/10.
Given, the game is still being made and there's room for MAJOR improvement, But come on, really? Flipping "Flappy Bird" is better than this game. Hold on lemme add another thousand zeros in that decimal. If the developer of this travisty sees my post, Please do fix the things i listed. Actually, lemme correct my rating.

I'm gonna be nice here. .1/10

EDIT: "Become a zombie"? I HAVE TO PAY REAL MONEY TO DO THAT? WHY DID I WASTE 256 MB OF DISK SPACE? Dear god, the F2P industry is CRAAAAAAAAAP. Double correction, 0.05/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198125507665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1392086031}
review: 这是一款8bit的像素风格游戏，让我想到了我的童年。说好的方面：游戏风格很对路，可以在游戏中建筑，与人聊天并且打怪获得金币，人多会很有意思。只是很多人不欣赏它。里面有一点儿解谜要素。BGM也很到位。不足的地方：很快就会让人玩腻。游戏的武器等道具有些单一。这款游戏缺少了很多元素在里面，使得游戏会显得无趣。自由度一般。趣味性低。画面低（无法想想作者已经做不出来角色模型来区分男女性）音乐还不错。

author: {'steamid': '76561198114625833', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1411263854}
review: 该游戏很好玩，游戏模式很多丰富。该游戏十分自由，给人一种焕然一新的感觉，游戏里也是非常的自由，能轻松与外国朋友聊天，增进友谊等，这种游戏的风格很有特点，简单风趣。操控简单。是一款适合于大众的休闲游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198038528907', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1388139793}
review:
[b]8BiTMMO Review[/b]

I have played 8BitMMO for a while now and I honestly can't recommend it as a free-2-play title. I'm fully aware of the difficulty of producing a game but this game is neither fun or interesting. There are many games out there like this, there is a massive range of issues plaguing the game and the game uses many different features in conjuncture that are just confusing and difficult. The UI is a joke, as well. 

[b]CONCEPT:[/b]

Possibly good on paper - an easy to access MMO that nearly anyone can play. 

[i]6/10[/i]

[b]GRAPHICS:[/b]

Ugly. I understand that the ability to allow everyone to play the game needs modest graphics but this is just ugly and poorly animated. 

[i]2/10[/i]

[b]SOUND:[/b]

I can't remember, to be honest. No voice acting and I can't even remember if there were sound effects. That fact alone is probably bad - if I can't remember them. 

[i]2/10[/i]

[b]PLAYABILITY:[/b]

I guess it's playable for the most part but the developer tries his/her hardest to make it not playable with an uninspired UI, a boring economy and crafting system and a story that is quite simply... not existant. 

[i]2/10[/i]

[b]ENTERTAINMENT:[/b]

The game amused me for roughly... 5 minutes. After that - there was no entertainment to be found... at all.

[i]1/10[/i]

[b]REPLAYABILITY:[/b]

[i]Low[/i]

[b]OVERALL SCORE:[/b]

 [i][b]2.5/10[/i][/b]

review: Its a funny little game but as the creators say, its NOT done yet. Its sometimes laggy, depending on where you live (only 2 servers in the USA). I have now played it for 30 minutes, and it got boring pretty quick. It has a nice and funny community, but you need to get in the game for a while to actually get into in to a town, get some friends to build things with and that kind of stuff. So, ill try again when its a little bit more "game-like" because, personally, I would not YET get this game out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977560009', 'num_games_owned': 2313, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1389447236}
review:
This game is really, REALLY boring. It could've easily been made by a couple 8th graders with Visual Basic... in fact a couple of my friends and I made a similarly dull looking game back then (which was around 11 years ago now) - it amazes me that anybody would pay for currency for this game. You can easily level to the max level (6?) in a day or so; and it doesn't really do anything for you. 

The only redeemable quality of this game would've been the customization, however you can barely do anything to customize your character; the build tools are extremely unintuitive and lack ease of use that makes you WANT to build anything yourself. It's one of the silliest things I've ever seen - purchasing numerous different types of blocks for the SAME piece of roof, rather than simply having different styles of roofs which automatically free-form to however the walls under it are designed. This should be the case with everything. 

I can't even believe there's somebody out there who can code a game that is at least functional for the most part, with so many illogical choices in design... It would take at least 30 times the amount of time to implement new components for building different styles of walls and roofs with the current implementation than it would with the one I mentioned above.

Sorry I have to be so harsh, but this game shouldn't be taking money from anybody until it is in a stage higher than extremely pre-pre-pre-pre-alpha. However, you just label it as an early access game and voila! These days you don't even have to ever develop a full game to make money and it's scaring me that this is going to be a huge portion of the development community now with the insane amount of awesome outlets for indie developers. I hate that it is such an easily abused style of developer outlet - we've already seen at least a couple games that totally abused this system... *cough* War-Z *cough*

Anyways... I hope you get a real coder working on this as well as somebody competent with game design so the people who have invested money in this thinking it will ever be as good as they are thinking it could be get what they deserve. For me however, I will stay away unless there is some MASSIVE improvement here.

review: It is a cool game worth trying but I would wait until there is a little more content. The building system is difficult because everything is so lo def and the level cap is only 6. The servers lag which makes no sense considering the game is 8 bit. For anyone wanting to check this game out I would wait a few months for some more updates to come out and for some more content to be added. It has potential and might be addictive in the future but I just do not see it right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119568634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1389426438}
review: A fun little time waster, but you quickly run out of things to do. You could go on the same fetch quest 7 times in a row (yes, this actually happened), or perhaps you'd like to learn how to build in the most inefficient and confusing way possible. Also, the microtransactions forbid from doijng anything more than making a home of the cheapest material before having to pay up. They also took a Team Fortress 2 approach and added the option to buy hats. This ould be fine if they  had a lot of unique concepts, or you could use them as bargaining chips with other players, but there are only 5 uncreative hats that are locked to your account. Until the creator adds the ability to do things, avoid this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098346483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1410796143}
review: This game is amazing. Very simple in terms of the game's control and skill level, but yet very fun and addictive. I would rate this 10/10 when it comes out fully finished. The only problems I have at the moment with it are; the bugs, and a slightly sloppy game engine with a few glitches. But when it come out complete, it will be one of, if not the best, retro-styled 2D game out there. This game is very similair to Runescape or World of Warcraft, but it includes elements of Mario and Roblox, and some even from Sploder and Minecraft. This game is amazing and I hope it never ends up becoming a paid game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054872025', 'num_games_owned': 2109, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1390958048}
review:
I do NOT reccomend this game. The concept is great, but the game sucks. I might say that since it's still in Early Access there might be something to it in the future, but no. This game is the product of 12 YEARS OF WORK. 12 YEARS. That is not a typo, the developer has spent 12 years working on this thing that is in such a sorry state. I would be impressed of the product because there's almost only one person working on it, but after 12 years this game sits as if it was a project someone could have made on DigiPen's ProjectFun developing engine. The graphics are terrbile, and not just because it's 8-Bit. Now let me just say great games don't have to have the most real graphics ever, but this game makes you confused about wether the obect in front of you is a wall, door, passageway, the ground, or the ceiling. 

If this had been worked on for a couple months to a year, i would say it has potential and could be something awesome someday, but after 12 years, there's no hope for a better product. Avoid this game altogether.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071363936', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1387093558}
review:
its looks fun, oh yes it does. but no, just no. lets start with the building problems. firstly you start with a VERY limited number of blocks, and when i say very, i mean like 15. and of course you have to grind for money to buy more, but thats not all. they put a level cap on the BLOCKS, i can build with bricks until im level 3? wtf?!? also i dont know how the hell they desinged half of the textures for these blocks, the gray concrete pieces of shit you start with look like two blocks stacked. but nope, apparently thats one block? ok game fair enough, what is up with your combat. ok not much to say about the combat except its very tedious. you attack in one of four directions with a tiny little sword on a VERY...big grid? i dont know how to explain it. then lastly the actual gameplay and how pretty the game is. ok graphics? not much to be seen, fair enough it is called 8bit mmo but cmon, you could add some detail rather than a flat color to every block. it feels almost like they had to throw it together in a game jam, ok granted it is early access and all that jazz, but put some effort in. the gameplay? not much to be found, you can have difficulty slashing away at a mess of pixels because they move on a smaller grid than you, or you can use your 15 blocks to build your heart away....until you need money to buy more.

                                                                          TLDR
Issues:
1. building is difficult and clunky at best, and the grinding for getting blocks is pointless and frustrating
2. the combat is non existent, walk around on a clunky grid trying to stab your tiny sword at hipster cats
3. no music at all, and i mean its silent. you would be hard pressed to find a sound effect
4. the hud is awful, a bunch of nasty plain white buttons, not much to be said
5. graphic wise its very bad looking, flat colors on flat colors on more flat colors, 8bit and early access but ive seen pixel are done right, and it can be very nice looking. the first legend of zelda tops this game graphically
6. i think the only charecter customization aspects i found are the ten level capped hats, none of them look good either

maybe a 3 out of ten, maybe fun is to be found here, and i didnt bother to fight through all the crap

review: I've played some Muds before that had amazing skills, spells, abilities, weapons, armor, accessories, classes, and power trees. You know, the works and a unique funky hat! I was expecting something alond those lines. This gives you a sword that does +1 damage. If you level up you get an additional 3 health and can buy the sword +2 damage. This game isn't just early access, it's just bad. Know mater how much polish they put on it, it will still be terrible.

review:
Buon gioco
Lo stile 2D lo differenzia da altri giochi F2P  e consente di divertirsi in una maniera completamente nuova.
Per essere un gioco ancora in fase di sviluppo non ho riscontrato grossi bug o glich o comunque nessuno che mi abbia costretto a riavviare una partita o a ricominciare una missione.
Consigliato per chi vuole divertirsi senza dover spendere 9 o 20 euro per comprarsi Terraria o Minecraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104453734', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1390937388}
review: 8BitMMO is a fun open sandbox game where players can meet up with thier friends, build, and explore. Personally i thought this game was really fun but it had the same action over and over again. Stab with sword, explore, stab with sword, repeat. In this game it is really hard to level up currently because you have kill a lot to level up. But it does have its ups like the ability to build amazing things and to be able to buy clothing for your character. The mobs are easy to kill and there are no bosses witch makes the game a little repeatative and boring. The only ranged weapon in the game is the gun but it only comes with 50 ammo so you have to buy the gun again if you run out. I would rate this game 3.5 stars out of 5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071421958', 'num_games_owned': 855, 'num_reviews': 340, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1387110226}
review: Before this game was on steam, I tried it out for a bit. And I get tell you what this game is. A horrible MMO in which you do nothing but spam your spacebar to kill enemies and read the annoying jokes in large text. This game is pure pay2win and in what no manner has the right to call itself an oldschool 8bit roleplaying game. People will steal your kills in large grinding areas, which makes it almost impossible to level up to get blocks to build your own town without paying money. This game would be like if team fortress two had you pay a small fee out of your steam wallet to capture a control point, the main objective of the entire game. Pass this one on if you're not willing to put tens of hours of grinding into this ridiculous game.

Wanna do pretty much anything? pay money.

The Only thnig you can do is build a house after you grind cats for an hour...

This game needs more freedom... But right now. all it is... is a money sink...

author: {'steamid': '76561198056233885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1396384720}
review:
8BitMMO é um enorme multiplayer role playing game (MMORPG) derivado do Dofus, sendo que a mecânica do jogo e seus gráficos foram reduzidos ao seu formato mais simples.

Elegantes gráficos "pixelados" formam o coração do jogo, o que exige criatividade por parte dos jogadores. É um game com grande potencial, que privilegia sua capacidade de criar ilimitadamente em vez de exigir conhecimentos mais técnicos

author: {'steamid': '76561198045974507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1392259234}
review: Extremely! It's fun if you want to take a break from the 3D virtual world MineCraft, or Terraria and jump into Pokemon view of things. But, there are some things that need to be worked out, such as the building. But keep up the quests and obey server rules, and you'll suddenly get tied up into this blingy world of MMO!

review:
Great idea, that floated just barely out of grasp as Mojang has thus cornered the market on block world building games.

I can honestly say that I'd rather play a minecraft clone rather than this game. It by no means is bad, just boring, and a bit too janky when building and goes in heavy with the gimics.

Some how I think that this game could be improved if everyone talked in poor translated russian.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098234206', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1388672302}
review: When I first saw this game, I thought this game was going to be really stupid. I have always hated RPG games and games in 2D, but this just looked like a stupid knock-off of minecraft. That changed when I started playing it for the first time. It was actually kind of fun. Granted the tutorials were dumb and somewhat impossible, actually getting to build on your own plot was really interesting. I was able to build cool looking buildings that wouldn't look as cool in minecraft. Granted it has some bugs, but there is apparently only one guy working on this thing, have to give him props for that. All in all, just get it. (its free...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073503998', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1390362809}
review: Honestly this could go either way. It's fun for about 45 mins but after a while you realize that there isn't much stuff to do. There isn't much adventure, mainly just PVP and broken player quests. Building isn't useful at all unless you are willing to spend the money to be allowed to build a town. But anyways, it's free, you may be more into the available options than I am. It has a lot of potential, hopefully the finished game is a bit better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043968820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1556672923}
review:
I LOVE THIS GAME, it is so addicting, I keep putting in more hours because of the addicting factor of this game, it doesn't get old either, you ALWAYS find something fun to do, and the mods are very helpful and always around to help, and the fact only one person developed this game, even more amazing, I can't wait to see more in the future, hopefully they increase the level cap and add more quest, I am bored of being at level 6. XD

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198080344475', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1390260310}
review: Well... Let's get started. For it's current state, this game is absolutley terrible. The animation is shotty at best and sometimes your character will randomly speed up for no reason. While moving objects, people and body parts tend to disappear and reappear, making it very hard to not get a seizure. The building... Oh boy... I like the idea that you actually have to kill things for building supplies. By killing monsters, you get gold, which can be used to purchase blocks. But, due to would-be reasonable protection systems for your creations, you can build almost NOWHERE. Heres how it is: You cannot break other player's blocks, or build/break around their blocks. Reasonable, right? No. At the beginning town, Origin, some d-bag must've come through and broken all the grass and replaced it with their own. When trying to place a block (which are awkward because they are 2x1) it says: "You cannot place near other peoples blocks!". This game is currently very, very bad, and I understand its WIP, but whoever made this should've at least had a working movement system that looked decent before releasing this to the public. So let's recap: Horrible animation, d-bag players, odd block dimensions, glitchy npcs, and disappearing things, not to mention a horrible movement system. I think the only thing I can say thats good about this game is its sillyness through chat with npcs, monster names, etc,. But it does not make up for all the absolutley broken mechanics of this game. It isn't even a REMOTELY original idea. Building and fighting in a blocky world! NEVER HEARD THAT ONE BEFORE!

review:
Though it is in 8-bit, hence it's name, the game provides an excelent tutorial, as well as a shop that you can access anywhere, at all times, both keyboard and mouse controls, as well as a world nearly made solely out of player made content. Each town, city, and house you come across in the main game world is made by some other player who got there first.
Better hurry up, before all the land is taken.

review:
Are you serious?
This is not an "8 bit style" MMORPG, it is just a game with shitty graphics and gameplay and NO sounds! (Just a couple of effects, rarely).
I think (and hope) the maker made it just to have fun doing it, as the "humorism" in the game suddegsts me.
It is good that Steam is open, but it should be not "too" open, to avoid ...this.
I could barely accept a game like this on a Flash games site.

I played it exactly 8 minutes. Got it? 8 bit... 8 minutes...? Shut up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036972167', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1663147730}
review:
First off, the prices are to support development, so the people moaning about it are kinda silly. If you like it, you can give 5 bux and help them along the way, and get some silly shwag in return. OR more, if you really like it. Right now its flooded with Steam kiddos, but that will pass when the newness wears off.

The review - 5 hours in, and well, I like it. It's quirky, it's simple, and it's creative. I built a house and road to a main road. Its a little rough around the edges, but it is fun. I like the simplicity, honestly, it is refreshing. I do not think this is where I will spend 30 hours a week, but hey, once or twice a week I will take a pixelated break from the "You need this 20 button mouse omg" OR "OMG noob you suck, go uninstall." 

Not a new minecraft, but fun for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003148789', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1419303712}
review:
This game is pretty fun. Though it is fun, it also will get boring quickly. Being only a one dev team, this game is pretty nice for one person to create. Going into school for coding, i heard that coding for multiplayer games is quite hard and complex so i give this dev props. This game has a nice aesthetic to it. Being early access this game doesnt really have much. About only 5 enemies in game as of right now, and not much in the weapons. The leveling from lvl 3-4 feels alittle grindy. 

The player-based quests need controlled and looked over honestly, it feels like anyone can just make a quest like "find the reward block" and have no clues at all on how to find it, only the quest teleporter will help you in these cases, putting you in the right general location. So, once you get done with the actualy dev created quests, the game can either be fun, or quite boring. Then again, its still early access.

I still recommend this game even with its faults, it can be fun if you find the right things to do. Though, if your looking for more, then maybe wait until the game develops more, and or support the development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972785583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1389669772}
review:
It's clear that the developers want nothing more than to make a quick buck with this game through in-game purchases. If you want to do just about anything, be prepared to whip out your wallet and dole out the cash.

The utter lack of any decent mechanic is matched only by the developers attempt to mask it with juvinile humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081458014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1387672208}
review: This game may be 8-bit and I respect the effort but this game is just plain old boring, it's slow, feels somewhat linear, with dull combat. I would of liked to of had a little variation with your character, it can be done though the game only 8-bit. I say this because it can become hard to find your character in a group of others, a simple fix could be to have your dude change his colour. With the combat, basically you press "A" until you win or die until you level up enough to move on and do it again. Lastly the busic is also not very catchy, it's not bad, just easily forgotten. The game is free so if you are bored and deperately need something to play like I did try it out and see for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106934887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1387283322}
review:
The idea is nice and at first I thought it was fairly intriguing but after less than an hour I found it to be horribly boring. It's very hard to build anything since i can't tell apart walls and floors and the grinding to buy blocks is horrendous. There's barely anything to do, and the combat is clunky (maybe I'm just bad at that so I won't hold it against the game) and aside from the first few levels where it's kinda' funny, after that it's just... ehh...
If you like it, more power to you, for me... No.

review:
I understand that this is an unfinished game but it definitely needs work.

The UI is terrible, the tutorial is lacking, and many features are not yet available; those that are available (such as creating a town) require microtransactions.

The game is overall highly unpolished. Maybe it'll be better if and when the developer gets it beyond its current stage.

review:
this game is garbage. the game developers instantly ban you for saying something as is "i dont like this game that much" bam instant ban. these guys are garbage that are making this game you can tell by how they talk to people and if you go on the forums everyone the says something negitive bout the game is instantly banned. i even saw someone asking "where are the bad reviews?" and he got banned. do you self a favor developers. you are harshly tarnishing your name and will not be recieving any feedback on this game because all you will do is ban and move on. good luck getting this game started lol


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


a more clear better review.

if you plan on playing this game, then by anymeans you can not ask a simple question or else you will be banned.

why?

honestly.. i don't know but the maker of the game is not doing him self a favor but the cummunity a favor departing us from a game that no one is going to like in the future.

diss the game - ban
ask questions - ban
complain about something or ask why this is this etc - ban

in short this is probably HITLERS version of a game. demands perfection or else.. well you know

review:
One of the titles that when you look at it, you really question why they even bothered.  They call it 8-bit, but nothing in the game is, perhaps they just mean, "looks like balls," and not, "looks like it was rendered on an 8-bit machine."

Gameplay is also horrible, so there's that too.

All in all, a shameful display.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068110750', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1390094135}
review: I believe this game is good for passing some time when you have nothing to do.  I also believe it is good as a free to play, for the most part. While it is free to play, some of the best features must be bought with platinum in game which you have to buy with real money. Platinum is not cheap either, you must pay $10 at least to get a townstone to make a town for yourself. I enjoyed it for the little bit that I played it but would not see myself playing it very often.

review:
8-bit MMO nostalgia overtakes me back to the days when everyone wanted does not cool the card, and the console type shogi or dandy. So the game is good at what it has no plot (it's just a bunch of incoherent scattered jobs) and the idea with 8 bit graphics I also liked. Gameplay boring but later when you're already used to the game, he can attain pleasure.And yet there is a stylish unreal slugs! Well let's look at the pros and cons of this game.
+ Is a good idea with 8 bit graphics
+ Slugs!
+ The same spirit of old school and mmo
- Plot. representing a bunch of incoherent scattered jobs.
put this game 9 out of 10
  remember slugs is steep.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997669587', 'num_games_owned': 703, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1387159407}
review: I really tried to get into this, unfortunately it didn't catch me. I can see where the concept and the idea were headed and what was wanted but it sadly wasn't executed the way I'd hoped. Building feels a bit like a chore, the dialogue and any sense of plot feels shallow and monotonous. Maybe, since this is an earlier version of the game (from what I gathered) it'll be fixed up and I'll like it more. For now, I'm going to have to downvote this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065265460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1387641861}
review:
First off, as soon as you get in there are hundreds of people around you.  You have no clue where you are and there is something about a telephone booth? Controls are pretty bad and if you are expecting it to be like Minecraft or Terraria look somewhere else.  Can't beat free but still the game is a hunk of junk.  If you aren't looking for a game like minecraft still I don't suggest this game.  You have to pay real money. You end up getting this game and playing for 30 minutes until you realize the game is just not that great.

Edit 1/8/14: It seems as though the developers are starting to change it and are taking a step in the right direction.  Still missing key components but the game is improving I need to see easier controls and easier, less cluttered online access for me to actually play this again but again it is free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061944050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1388140195}
review:
This game is in beta...and it still charges the testers for in-game purchases. I'm so dissapointed. 8-bit games possess some of my favorite titles: Mega Man 5, Legend of Zelda, Double Dragon, and Contra to name a few.  The writing is funny and creative. The combat is extremely basic. (Face enemy and hold spacebar.) The building aspect is what I loved the most. But to be in a town you only have two options. Beg somebody to let you into the town that they paid for, or buy one. I wouldn't really mind the whole asking for access into a town...except nobody seemed to be accepting anyone. I ran around doing quests and I saw the same people standing in place for half an hour just begging every mayor nearby to join. I never saw them move from those spots so I don't know if their pleading ever paid off.. In the end, the game is just not good. There are much better free MMO's to dump your time into than this.

Also I cannot stress enough...it CHARGES BETA TESTERS FOR IN-GAME PURCHASES!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993874801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1388455030}
review:
If you can enjoy some old school graphics, like sandbox games like Minecraft and MMORPG games then there's a good chance you'll find something to enjoy in 8BitMMO.  Unfortunately the game is not without it's issues but keep in mind this is an Early Access Game and in time some of those glaring issues will be ironed out.

Lets start with the good however.  First off this game will run on nearly any computer that's still up and running out there.  It's simple grapics style is a solid plus and you can feel confident inviting your friends to join with you no matter what kind of computer they have.  Secondly the game is free-to-play so you really have no excuse as to why you aren't at least trying this game out.  As an added bonus they currently are using what I consider one of the best free to play models out there.  There is nothing in this game, other than some cosmetic hats, that you can't get without spending money.  Other than the time things take to do your experience in this game will be no different whether you spend money or not.

So what is the gameplay like??  Well it's in part a roleplaying game.  Combat is currently limited to a small variety of mostly hand held swords that get better as you level and it is very basic but somehow enjoyable.  There are quests you can follow to recieve a nice reward in the end and different monsters to beat up.  Story wise, it's "not-so-serious" gameplay with a lot of witty humor and references to other movies, games, and so forth.  The other part of the game is very sandbox style.  Most of the world can be built up by the players which really gives you a chance to make your mark on the world, including designing dungeons and such for others to adventure in.  You buy the building blocks, monster spawners, and other building materials using in game money, which can be earned by killing monsters and completing quests, or bought with real money.  Other than a handful of hats that is the only thing that real money can buy for you.  Yes your gear is also bought with in game money however it is currently very limited and cheap enough to afford with just monster killing and questing money.  Even building materials are fairly cheap, though it will take some time saving up coins to build anything massive if your not willing to spend real money.

So what about the ugly side of the game.  Well first off the servers don't seem to currently be able to handle the load right now.  Granted there were what looked like hundreds of people playing, but I did experience quite a bit of lag that was worse in the more populated areas.  Secondly it is not at all or in any way pretty when it comes to graphics.  In some instances it can be hard to understand where you're supposed to go.  Some of this is players not being used to the building tools and thereby not building their structures in the most presentable way but some of it is simply the limitations of the graphics engine.  As far as audio goes, the sounds are extremely limited.  Start up some tunes of your own before you start the game.

Overall this is certainly a game you can and should at least try out.  While there's still a lot of things that can be ironed out there's a huge potential for this game to be massivly fun.  If you can put up with a few hiccups and bumps in the road I belive you'll find this a very enjoyable game.  It's certainly one that I will be playing from time to time and keeping an eye on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063837632', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1387655737}
review:
The concept of 8BitMMO is great. A 100% player built world with combat and an infinite world? Sounds great, right?

The way it's executed, however, isn't as great.

Before I say anything else, I do /NOT/ believe that you need good graphics to make a good game. That being said, this games graphics are one of the major issues with this game. The majority of the tutorial is telling you what you're even looking at, for example how to distinguish an overpass from the floor below. I think this game would be MUCH better if it had depth. the way it is constructed makes it difficult to tell where you are in comparison to anything. When you go under something, it dissapears, but that leads to even more confusion when trying to navigate through someones building. Furthurmore, when attenpting to build, you must puild from north to south unless using slabs. Attempting to do otherwise causes you to place the block on top of the previously placed one. Trying to build roofs or multi-story buildings is a pain, and the game doesn't tell you how to place blocks in the air without building up untill after you've placed 30 blocks. This wouldn't be an issue, except for the fact that you need gold to buy blocks. In order to get gold, you need to kill enemies, which is a good concept, but as with the rest of the game, is poorly done. The combat in this game consists of either jabbing a super-close ranged sword at the enemy, or using a pixel pistol to shoot the foes down. Aiming properly is difficult, and even if you use the swords, combat is extremely bland and difficult. 

There are so many things wrong with this game, the few things it does right are not enough to counter them. Like I said before, the concept is great, but I do not recommend this game.

review: I´ve played a little bit of it and I was so lost. The character´s position jumped from time to time, I think it´s a lag issue. Also i didn´t find it atractive or appealing to me, it didn´t say "continue playing me", this can be a really negative point considering the game mecanics and the type of game and graphic sistem they are using. In my opinion they should´ve refined and tested the entire product more before launching it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114365016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1388392056}
review:
Quite fun, and a time-killer as well. Does need a bit of work:

1) When exiting menus such as the inventory when the 'Drop Active' build tool is on, a block is automatically placed on the ground when clicking even if you don't click on the ground.

2) The building blocks in the air quest-you can basically place any block anywhere and still pull it off. Also I don't quite understand the z-axis lock...it's not really explained very clearly.

I haven't played the game for too long, as you can tell, and I'm aware that it needs improvement, but overall it's a fun little thing. :)

EDIT: Also, the shop interface could use some work. It tells me I'm buying things in quantities of ten, and when I open my inventory there is only one of each block that I bought.

And when placing blocks, I placed eleven, and then destroyed them all, and only got 7 back...

Also the quest where you have to place 100 blocks- you really don't have to build anything at all. You can simply place blocks, remove them, place them again, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120399158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1405194022}
review:
An Ok game. there are better games out there. but this game is free  if your looking for cheap fun the game is waiting for you.

pros: the ability to create what you want.
make your own public or private city.
its free.
servers are rarely full or never full.
Theres hats.
updated monthly.


cons:not alot of weapons.
hard to find friends.
gets sluggish when you get to level four as it feels like there nothing left to work for.
repetive gameplay.
the blocks have  limeted varity.
at times you feel like theres not much to do even early on.
chat bar gets spammed with people linking to websites claiming to have free plats and gold.

Take note: despite being able to buy coins or plats, this game in no way or form pay to win as you are limeted to how mch you can buy. plus theres not alot to buy anyway other than hats and awesome outfits

final verdict:
i suggest you go ahead and try it for your self as this review was based on my 1 hour experience to witch i got to level 5 and got tierd of the spam in the chat. but for what it is its great and should be tried by all who like building game with rpg elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974112108', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1388173524}
review: Sorry but i cant see anything good about this game, I know its beta but there are premium features so im reviewing it.. Ok you run about the place trying to level up..and there are missions, but half the time you cant find the person you need to talk to as a million other players are covering or hiding the person. Every place looks the same. Combat is awful. The movement is very poor, seems blocky and jumps all over the place. On top of that you die in many places and your never quite sure sometimes what killed you :/. I wont say the graphics are awful as the game is an 8 bit game and meant to be simple. However i can see why the game is free. Personally its not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086278065', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1602721411}
review:
Alrighty, time for a REVIEW! (a serious one, i know, crazy. right?)

8bitmmo, "Build anything!" after a bit of grinding.

The gameplay:
1. Combat
Combat is terrible. Person with best spacebar wins.

2. Building
Blocks cost gold, and gold is valuable.

3. Obtaining said "gold"
You have to farm, farm farm farm like a real farmer, just no crops, rather instead you kill game critics and lawyers. I plan on being a lawyer when I grow up, so please do not murder me with a blue sword.
There is a place known only to man as the twilight zon- I mean zoo, do /tele zoo and grind for days.

The community:
1. The good
Helpful, half of them are kind and are willing to help. I even had a guy stop and ask me what I was doing. "Finding a reward block" I replied. He said "I have all the reward blocks so which one?" I told him which reward block I was looking for and in a few minutes he helped me solve the puzzle and get the reward! Kind, nice people except for ...

2. The bad
Some people in this game are stuck up jerks. Like, half. They care only about themselfs are their towns, and will not help, assist, or comfort you in any way. They care about money and money alone.

The feel:
Feels great, like a true 8 bit game mixed with a 3d MMORPG. I love the feel.

Overall rating:
Possible ratings for F2P games:
Stay away from | Try it if a friend has it | Try it | Try it NOW! | Devote your life to it

It gets a...

Try it NOW! (4/5)

I recommend you try it, NOW! It's a great game and if you like it for a half hour, you will like it forever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990725997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1387905747}
review:
Free2play game (with in-game store of course), what more can you really say? It appeals more to kids or pixel indie game enthusiast types. It's fast paced, which is nice, but it's so freaking convoluted that it can give you a headache or be a bit overwhelming. I would give this a neutral vote because it is a free game, but in lieu of having an absence of that choice, I am downing the vote because of the huge headache it has given me. It also makes it a difficult game to play with friends and the building function, albeit cool, is nothing new nor entertaining. 

The best thing about the game is how huge the player-made world is. That brough some awe, but not enough to keep me in. 

But it's a free game, what do you have to lose to try?

author: {'steamid': '76561198061290492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1388077489}
review: Not very much played of it, but for the few moments I did, not very much popped out at me at all. Everything was very simplistic and don't get me wrong, I'm a huge fan of simplistic games but this just doesn't catch the eye. Also, the sound effects are heart wrenching, I think that they could have atleast used some kind of track pad for the sound effects and/or asked someone online if they could have used thier sound effects. At the most this game is subpar and glitchy, if it gets a sprite makeover and a sound makeover, maybe then I will take a good look into the game. If this game is one of those stop and smell the flowers type of games, then it should feel like it, not like it was made in paint.

review:
EXTREM ABGESPECKTES SPIEL! Die Charaktere und NPCs sind sehr mager, allein schon wegen der Umsetzung.
Es sind noch einige veränderungen nötig, bis dieses Spiel was wird. 

Ich bin selbst Fan von Retro Games ^^ doch bei diesem Spiel fehlt einiges, das ein Retro Spiel ausmacht.
Ich will nich sagen das ich es besser kann, doch die Entwickler müssen hier richtig Dampf reinhauen!

Fazit: Sehr frühe Early die noch reichlich unprogrammiert werden muss
Note: 4+ ( Hat Potenzial)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045486598', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1387726424}
review: The current version of the game is very unfinished and lacks polish, but as this is practically an early access game that's to be expected. The game itself doesn't have much to do apart from building a house (in a confusing 3D styled 2D) and mashing the keyboard to kill monsters. If you want a game like this that has more quality and enjoyment compared to this, I'd recommend Realm of the Mad God (also F2P, but has more microtransactions). I guess it'll change in the future but currently my first impressions of this game weren't very good, apart from the humour, that was one thing I liked from playing this.
