author: {'steamid': '76561198036565820', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1387770466}
review:
I dind´t play too much, but from what I played, 8BitMMO is a trying hard to be nerdy, I mean, hipster dungeon, and I am like "ha, wait, do we still make hipsters jokes?"
Gameplay:
 Clunky, a basic grinding MMO, go kill this, do that, so boring and repetitive, the combat sucks, press SpcBar to attack, but the range of the sword is bad, and it´s pure random, 50% of the times that you strike at point blank range, you miss.
 Building is a mess, the perspective doens´t help, and the UI is all over the place, and yes, you can build cool stuff.
Storyline: 
 You wake up in the Dev home, for real like, haha, a unfriendly first meeting, but I think the game is just a big parody, and it doens´t have a plot.
Bussiness Model:
 WTF? Seriously? I mean, everything is so pricey, and you gain so little Gold, but no fear, you the wonderful overpowered microtransations, I mean, in Brazil, where I live, R$(Real, Brazil´s money) or BRL, it costs the double of the dollar, so that pricey ultra duper whatever gold pack costs here 400 R$!(200 U$D!)
Aesthetic:
 It sucks. it ins´t 8 bit btw, it´s boring and bland.
Overall:
 Good Concept, Bad Execution. And I understand for example the aesthetic being crap(Cuz is retro and intentional),
but it doens´t excuse an poor and obnoxious title like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082678636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1423263689}
review:
This game, to put it accurately, is just a blast to play!  The fact that it's open world and free just makes me smile.  I love several features in this game specifically, including customization of your character, the cleaness of the chat, and the fact that your blocks can only be destroyed by you (SO NO GRIEFING. HECK FLIPPIN YEAH!)!
I recommend this game whole heartedly.  Get registered right now, and go forth into this awesome experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029792072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1387747307}
review:
Even though the developers seems like a good and polite person, it is just not my type of game. I do enjoy sandbox games a little bit, but when i have to spend real money to get a decent quantity of blocks, i use to get mad. They do give you some blocks, but if you are a "Sandboxer" you just wont get enough.
Mayb it is an awesome game and i didn't noticed because i did not wanted to go forward, thats the problem: The game wasn't encouraging enough for me to keep going forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048054765', 'num_games_owned': 3005, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1387508271}
review:
I actually turned this game on expecting to love it immensely. The idea is very appealing on paper, but just something about the execution the turned me off completely. I'm not one to nitpick over graphics but this isn't really an 8-bit game. In fact there's an inconsistency when it comes to graphics altogether. Menus are one thing, the world is another, some of the sprites something else, and the inventory is it's own thing. It seems like each of the components were made individually and then thrown together with glue and duct tape. This game seems to lack an overall harmony.

On the bright side it's in early access beta so a lot can change in the coming months. For the time being though... meh. I'll wait a bit before turning it on again.

I will however give this game a point of kudos for having a quirky personality. The NPCs are pretty witty and hilarious at times.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198072367055', 'num_games_owned': 1244, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1527217846}
review:
I recommend this game to anyone that likes 8Bit Games. Even though it is only in it's beginning stages there is a great future for this game.

Pros
--------
-Fighting is simple
-Concept is fun
-Missions
-Unlockables (HATS)
-Leveling Up
-Owning your own town/area of land

Cons
-------
-Hard to understand building at first
-Player Quests are nearly impossible
-Laggy Servers (Will get better over time)

author: {'steamid': '76561198008442485', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1387550623}
review: Ужасная непонятная хрень. Судя по текстовке игры - разработчики сами изначально задумали игру как несерьезную - чисто для лузлов. Но лично мне более 5 минут играть в эту игру не захотелось. Снес. И уж тем-более игра не стоит денег. Это больше похоже на курсовую работу студента, тема которой "сетевые игры". Просто кто-то учился делать онлайн игры с большим количеством живых игроков. За такую выполненную курсовую или даже диплом я бы поставил отлично. Но на игру это не тянет ни как.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010636387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1387462697}
review:
Where to start..
When I first entered the game, there was a lot to learn, and even in the tutorial area, it was difficult to understand it all, especially with so many people in one area. I know this is only because there's only two servers.
After that, I walked into a random room and instantly began seeing potty mouths and spammers. Most MMOs have these, but it's very annoying.
Everything else went fine, the first 2 dungeons were interesting, but then I ran into a problem. I had been getting the same two player quests that were both broken/glitched, and could not be finished, thus I spent 30 minutes trying to get to level 3, farming gold for blocks. It would of been nicer to be able to choose which quest you get.
Basicly, if you want to make your place public, you must pay money for it, which is fine, but it's simply something I wouldnt pay money for yet. Maybe give the option to pay a lot of gold for a small town, where only a few people can enter at a time, otherwise the place you build is basicly your private home, which is something I dont usually care to do. Strip this feature away and it becomes a pointless, spam-filled, glitched building system, MMO.
The servers are laggy, and full of undesirables. In a couple of months these things might be changed, but as far as I can tell, it's definitely not worthy of being played just yet. They should of kept it under development until a stable game was put out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064252277', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1410708093}
review: This game is awesome. Having a med-power computer, MMOs like WoW or others are just too taxing and overheat it. This game tones down the graphics, not only making it faster, but more nestalgic (Probably didn't spell right). 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022313082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1387296544}
review:
На это, действительно, жалко тратить деньги. В игре нет ничего, что есть в других песочницах типа Minecraft, Terraria, Starbound, ect. Взаимодействие с миром заканчивается на тыканье блоков. Нет цепочек редстоуна или альтернативы его, необходимости добывать себе еду или вообще создавать хоть что-то. Игра никак не мотивирует игрока делать вообще хоть что-то из-за этого теряется всякий интерес к ней. Даже если бы игра была на крутом движке, с крутой графикой и анимацией, едва ли кого-то удержала бы перспектива безнаказанно рисовать картинки и строить пустые домики. Скука смертная.
Так же, блоки могут убирать только владелец и администрация из-за чего общий мир, который выглядит как бесконечно огромный кусок грязи, где доброжелательные игроки оставили свой след в истории надписями  "Хуй" или "Fuck Off". Впрочем, у кого мозгов хватило на большее - построили безвкусный, как и сам дизайн игры, домик, а потом благополучно забили на игру т.к. больше в ней делать нечего.
Пустая трата времени, не утруждайтесь.
PS Системой боя "кликни, пока не кликнули тебя" назвать сложно. Даже Minecraft, не отличающийся умопомрачительной системой боя даёт гораздо больший простор для PvP, чем эта псевдо-игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024976479', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1387413375}
review: It's alright. It's kind of extremely barebones and doing anything interesting costs platinum, but you can still build freely and stuff. Graphics are very minimalist and the game tries way too hard to be funny, but I'm not really docking poitns against the game for either of those things. Not much to keep you playing for a long period of time, but for 1-3 hours it's a good game to check out. It's free and only like 200MB so I would reccomend seeing if you like it I suppose. Personally I grinded a lot of ingame currency to build this giant-ass fortress but then I realized there was no point to building it at all because there's no real goal or feeling of accomplishment in this game except that you built something obscenely large and took up so much space that the other 99% of players don't get the opportunity to build something in this small gameworld

review: 创意足够，操作简洁，画风怀旧。但判定点不清晰，计算方法有待测试。在玩游戏的初期阶段可能会遇到操作混乱的问题。但总体感觉是一款潜力很强的游戏，如果能改进判定点问题能提高操作流畅度，增强游戏性。个人认为从剧情上而言多数角色的性格相对一致，是相对弊端较大的一点。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025161407', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1387344024}
review: Fun for a bit but really has a long way to go. After just a small amount of time playing the game I already find myself just unsure what to do with it, the quests keep looping and all I can do is farm for gold and build something. But the mechanics are there for something really fun and I find myself interested in it constantly. I'd build my own dungeon but I have to shell out far too much real money to get something even going. I recommend it simply because it is free to play and very interesting (it really is a fun idea) but be warned there are microtrasactions to get to the meat of the game and right now there is very little content to play around with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118402738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1505438849}
review:
"Platinum" is required to build your own town, and must be bought with real money.  And it takes a lot of it.  This may be a good game to try if there are some major changes made, however i would not waste my time or money on it until then.

The best thing, however is the developers sense of humor. However MOST of the game is player built and MOST people do not share the same humor or intelligence. There are a LOT of misspelled words in the player built areas. Sometimes i could not even guess the meaning!  The leveling up is very repetitive, at some point you will discover you cannot do some things in the game without real money (to buy Platinum).  The player driven quests were the most unique feature, however, many of them are broken or too long or boring to be interesting. The most time i spent in game was trying to complete two player driven quests only to have no way to finish them.
 Homes people build are mostly empty, and you can only explore so many towns with nothing to really do in them. And you are unable to interact with most items. So no world exploring there , either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053271326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1387215148}
review:
Экшн хуже, чем в Fantasy Online. Возможностей для творчества меньше, чем в Everybody Edits. Выглядит беднее, чем Golemizer. Хотите построить домик? Готовьтесь задрачивать один и тот же квест часами, чтобы накопить денег на покупку блоков. Блоки есть серенькие, зелененькие, синенькие прозрачные, коричнивые и черно-белой шашечкой. Есть еще ловушки и спаунилки монстров, но без доната их не продадут.
Я бы серьезно подумал, прежде чем тратить на это время и тем более деньги.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027339254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1387205007}
review:
Would really like to think that with lesser graphics, developers have the chance to invest more into gmaeplay details and working mechanics. I would like to believe that when people are alowed to converge in an artistic virtual space, griefing would be a minimal, almost non existent problem. I would like to think I didn't see the microtransactional fukfest spam on almost every menu window. Promising, but not there yet.

It needs more time, but fahk, Steam will sell you a pile of dog poop promising it will turn itself into a gold bar and be back with chicken poop to silver next week, never to mention the dog ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979918194', 'num_games_owned': 1188, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1387200883}
review:
There are so many things wrong with this game.  I feel as if the game was made by some middle-school child whom thinks cats are funny, and signs everywhere saying "F*** YOU" is hillarious and appropriate.  The main dungeons are simply just a couple small areas full of players farming spawnpoints, and to make matters worse it seems to have a pay to win type of free gameplay.  Otherwise you won't be able to make anything better looking than the minecrafts dirt house.  Also there are obvious memory leaks.

My recommendation is simply to just ignore this things existence; I was hoping for a game which I could build underground dungeons and castles; and everything is just so ugly and awkward to do.

review:
I logged in, had issues making my account so once I was able to get that done. I logged in and met RobbyZ or the NPC of.. He had me run around in the most.. Odd manner spamming my little 8bit sword with 26 other users to kill a slug to continue.

And at this post I must stop my self, look this game isn't really that bad. I just can't find my self spending time on that kind of game when they are jsut soo many good RPG's out there to enjoy. For example if you must have one- for the same style of game go play rune scape- at least there are things to do in that game. 


Also the custom part of this game doesn't show till way late in the game and with how the community is blowing up on it. By the time any of us get there the whole place will be build with awful builds xP

author: {'steamid': '76561198030753283', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1450536664}
review: I think that this game has a very interesting concept but the graphics are horrible. Yes I know it's trying to mimic 8 bit game graphics but even then it is very bad for 8 bit. Plus, whats so wrong with 16 bit. 16 bit graphics would be amazing for this game. Any ways, this game still has a lot to offer. Imagine it as a Minecraft server where you can build, do quests and become a mayor. That's pretty much what it is but with annoying graphics and bad sound effects. Also the learning process isn't too intuitive especially since there are always crowds of players blocking some of the npcs you need to speak to and the only way you know that the npc is there is because of all the people around it. If I was you I would still try it and maybe you'll like it. And this is just my opinion, others may have their own opinions and I respect that.

review:
Okay, for a Early access,
This game is an okay game, took me while to oriantate my self on how locks work as it can et confusing trying toplace 3D block in a 2D world. Not really my type of game, my patience runs very low, very quickly with this game. Only just got past tutorials, then randomly placed in the "wilderness". 
Havnt got in depths with the game as such but what ive played its like marmite...You'll either love it or hate it..

★★★-GamePlay
★★★★-Graphics (8bit)
★★★★-User friendly
★-Fun

Overall-★★★

author: {'steamid': '76561198048091958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1387144736}
review: It is a neat concept.  The trouble with games like this is they rely so much on user content.  That forces players to sift through all the garbage to find the good stuff.  I have found a lot of half done cities.  I get that the game is new, but things like this tend to get abandoned.  So you are left with half done areas.  I have found a few broken quests as well.  Hopefully over time it improves.  Items and building options seem very limited.  Not a lot of monster types.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038700412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1387098256}
review: Logging on, I immediately noticed how bad the dialogue was and the quality of the UI. Dungeons aren't instanced so the beginning quests take forever (the ones where you have to kill XX amount of monsters) because all the new players are competing to kill the mobs, and only one person gets the credit. Perhaps there's some party system that alleviates that? I'm not sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116214859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1407033540}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057958080', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1387153106}
review:
8bitMMO is a promising Early Access game. Ive spent a few minutes playing and I am hooked already. The UI is neat and uncluttered, the controls are perfect for this kind of game and the story line is epic. A new server has been added for increased demand. If you quit the game you appear where you left off last session. objectives are easy to read and follow.
The game is easy on the system while still looking good. I really recommend this game. The only problem was slight lag from the load of players! (This is an early access game after all)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003802813', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1397968317}
review:
This game could be a very good indie title, however when i play it, it feels as if i'm playing some pre-alpha debug version.
It's definitley not done yet, it's buggy, laggy and full. I do see potential in this game though. If it's given some time it could become something big. 

All in all, i would wait until the game is more finished before actually playing it. 
But you can check it out! It's free!                 Oh and also, i love the comedy in this game. Hillarious, keep it up.

-Farian

author: {'steamid': '76561198094744038', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1408295206}
review: This MMO has to be one of my favorites. It has a really retro feel to it, and it just reminds me of all those ols 8-bit games. Plus, it's just a good place to hang out with friends, build things, and kill monsters. I would recommend this to anyone who just wants to relax and have a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054278258', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1451796690}
review: 8BitMMO is a great, unique game. I like to think of it as Minecraft-meets-Legend of Zelda-meets-8 Bit graphics. You can build a town, dungeon, PvP arena, or anything you like! The world is entirely player built (even creator Sim9 has to follow the rules of establishing a town). Players can also create their own quests. In a way, the game is like a Wiki, it depends almost entirely upon its users. And the game is still in Beta, so it can only go up from here! I'd recommend this game to all players, casual o hardcore alike. There's something for everybody. And hats. Who doesn't love hats?

author: {'steamid': '76561198043429720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1386900989}
review:
It is a  fun causual game. but if you are looking for a hard core MMO to play with friends then this is not the game. I found it fun for the first few hours, but i cannot see this being a game where I bulid a Giant castle. The game right know has a small community so I would personall suggest waiting Exactly a month after the release day. So my first Complaint is that it gets hard to see from time to time when going through the sides. Another small gripe for me is the fact all the Characters look the same, I think that it needs a Character custumization complete with races, hair color, faces, and eye color, it would be something to make the game seem less monotonus. There is almost no Custimization in this game, Aside from Building, also for building you will need to be social in this game other wise you will be having a hard time finding a place to build outside in the world. There is almost no combat in this game though, and the combat that is in it is very monotuns.

But there are posotives, The user created content is good because it allows creativity annd the building of the masses. Some good thing is are the personal plots of land that you can get which then allow you to have some land that can not be trifled with. I enjoy the silly art style and the fact it never takes itself to serously.

So Ultimatley i found this to be an enjoyable pixaleated mix of Minecraft and Terria, The community is fair. So I give this game a good 4 out of ten 10, which is pretty good for an indi Developed game like this, i suggest a buy when it drops below five dollars, it will give you atleast an hour of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061313398', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1490703710}
review:
First time pixels go MMO for me. This game is really amazing, it brings you new view about building and shopping, fighting and talking. Even NPC's language is awesome. What impressed me most - THIS IS NOT PAY TO WIN. Fight Cats , Peoplle and Zombies to build your own dream Castle , Village or City Hall.
I reccomend this game to everyone who is creative and loves Indie games with friends.

P.S. RobbyZ : Hey, that's you Hero? Omg, i have an epic quest for you! You must come to the kitchen to meet me. Try this out! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198070974889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 3091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1409529277}
review:
With sound effects & graphics of the classic NES, customization of your character, and the ability to make anything, even your own house, you'll be having hours of fun! It's worth a try if you want that good ol' feel of the 1980's again.

That and the fact the whole map is player built makes the game even more fun! Though a word of caution: you MAY see some references in the game, I'll note two of them: 1) the White Sword has the description from Zelda (NES: 1987) and 2) the TARDIS (Doctor Who: 1963-2005) makes an appearence in the game! Talk about epic, yes?

author: {'steamid': '76561198113644029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1386756240}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085564783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1386731529}
review:
This game is very simple but it does not fit the MMO genre. Instead, it is more of a make-shift Creative MMO, similar to Lego Universe (with a weak MMO aspect).

There is lots of room for improvement in nearly every aspect.
1. The GUI is terrible it needs a overhaul, or at least a opacity option (so that it doesn
t get in your face)
2. The economy is too unbalanced; building blocks are too expensive
3. The "wilderness" is just empty. It needs features like hills or terrain.
4. I don't like the idea of man-made dungeons. They should be randomly generated in the wilderness.
5. The quests rewards are too little and the experience system is too large. (It takes 2-3 quests to level up)

Enduring the poor quality in this beta will really help you for the future, if you like MMOs (as it's easy to get everything; took me 5min of grinding to buy the gear I needed, and will really help when it improves.
EDIT: Someone needs to fix the signage preview and dialolgue window!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003343531', 'num_games_owned': 4912, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1403397027}
review: 8BitMMO in my opinion seems to be a game where building a community is key. You don't get handed your materials and get sent out to mine and craft them though like several other games out there. Instead you have two systems working and playing off of each other. On one hand you have the RPG section. Here the system handles your characters progression, shop system, quests, economey and the most importing thing, FIGHTING THE BAD GUYS! On the other hand you have have the Building system that directly feeds off of the RPG system. You fight monsters which nets you gold and expierence which can net you more expierence and gold from a quest but most importantly it lets you get your materials to build. The shop is tiered in such a way that your level dictates what you can buy in the various sections of the shop and you use the gold you gain to purchase the items. You can then take the materials you purchase to your own Pocket Dimension. Here you can build what you want then invite people to visit or open it up to the public. The game has heart behind it. I can clearly see inspirations, aspirations and a future for this game, if it can quickly evolve and try to weather the storm.

review: Game so far is pretty silly.  Some goofy internet humor.  Sometimes tries to hard, but it's still worth a play.  You can do a lot of building and make a town at your will.  Make people citizens and have lots of fun.  This game can be endless fun because there are player made quests.  So are good, some suck.  Just hope you get lucky.  It's free, and you can get the currency by just killing creatures.  7/10 worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041966606', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1437869335}
review:
You can become a potato. If that doesnt sell this free game to you, i dont know what will.


Anywho, its a f2p game, so theres no reason not to try it, especially since its a small game and easy to run. So far, its enjoyable, and has potential to be a pretty good time waster. As to depth, i personally havnt done any building yet, so i cant comment on it dragging you in for hours on end or not, but its definitely shaping up to be something you can play for a 30 min run here and there at the very least, which is more than fine for something like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002606014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1590165750}
review: A pretty good old school themed MMO, while still in Beta. There isn't really any lore for the game as it continually breaks the 4th wall. The first character you meet is the personification of the games designer. It is a decent time killer but has yet to prove that it has any sort of break out as far as its uniqueness. Needs a tune up as far as player interface is concerned, somethings in the game are not as clear as they should be leading to frustration followed by keyboard pounding eureka moments. If you want a 2D Minecraft with quests, this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023999718', 'num_games_owned': 2919, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1558, 'last_played': 1439964916}
review: Doesn't revive the MMO genre, but fun and a unique creative game nonetheless. You'll have fun for about two hours if you like multiplayer games; five minutes if your favourite game is Skyrim or Half-Life: Blue Shift. It's also pay-to-have-fun unless you want to be grinding one of four mobs for eight hours. You can't be creative without laying down forty dollars.
